original: 'di ni phyi ma'o zhes bya bar yongs su mi chod de 'chol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni phyi ma'o zhes bya bar yongs su mi chod de 'chol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not definite that this is the latter, because it is confused.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po med na ni 'dra ba 'dra ba'i rgyu mthun par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po med na ni 'dra ba 'dra ba'i rgyu mthun par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If there is no prior or subsequent state, then it is not reasonable that it is similar and a natural outcome.

original: 'on te skyes zin pa 'das pa'am da ltar ba ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te skyes zin pa 'das pa'am da ltar ba ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if you maintain that it is the natural outcome of what has arisen, either in the past or present, then it is said:

original: de'i phyir byung zin pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun par mi rung ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byung zin pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun par mi rung ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable that what has already occurred is the natural outcome of the future.‚Äù

original: dper na 'das pa da ltar ba'i rgyu mthun pa ma yin ba de bzhin du byung zin pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin par mi 'os so //
analyzed: dper na 'das pa da ltar ba'i rgyu mthun pa ma yin ba de bzhin du byung zin pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin par mi 'os so //
translated: Just as the past is not the natural outcome of the present, so it is not reasonable that what has already occurred is the natural outcome of the future.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu snga ma mi rung bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu snga ma mi rung bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúBecause it is not reasonable that the effect precede the cause.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rgyu don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu don med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the cause would be pointless.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu snga ma dang lhan cig par mi rung ba'i phyir la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu snga ma dang lhan cig par mi rung ba'i phyir la zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is illogical for the fruitional effect to be simultaneous with the cause.

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu snga ba mi rung bas snga ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu snga ba mi rung bas snga ba mi rung ngo //
translated: Since it is illogical for the effect to be prior to the cause, it is illogical for it to be prior.

original: lhan cig pa yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: lhan cig pa yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also illogical for it to be simultaneous.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'chol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'chol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even in the future state, it would be mixed.

original: 'di ltar da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs @210b na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu bzhin du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang lhan cig skye bar ma dmigs so //üîΩma 'ongs pa'i dus la yang snga phyi med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu snga la /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar byung ba'i gnas skabs @210b na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu bzhin du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang lhan cig skye bar ma dmigs so // ma 'ongs pa'i dus la yang snga phyi med pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu snga la /
translated: Thus, like coemergent causes in the present, the fruitional effect is not observed to arise simultaneously with the cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'phyi ba yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'phyi ba yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Also, because there is no earlier or later in the future, it is illogical for the fruitional cause to be earlier and the fruitional effect to be later.

original: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang ma 'ongs pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang ma 'ongs pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like homogeneous causes, fruitional causes would not be future.

original: bye brag tu smra bas de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: That is not so.

original: de lta na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang zhes gang smras pa de ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang zhes gang smras pa de ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the statement ‚ÄúThe cause of karmic maturation is also like that‚Äù is not correct.

original: phan tshun rgyu mthun pa nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu mthun pa nyid ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not logical that they are homogeneous causes of each other.

original: chos 'dra ba la gang zhig gang gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa de nyid ji ltar de nyid kyi tshe de'i rgyu mthun par rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos 'dra ba la gang zhig gang gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa de nyid ji ltar de nyid kyi tshe de'i rgyu mthun par rig par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is a homogeneous cause of a similar phenomenon be known as its result of natural outflow at that time?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of karmic maturation?

original: snga phyi med bzhin du yang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga phyi med bzhin du yang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they do not exist earlier and later, it is not logical that they are cause and result of each other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?üîΩBecause cause and result have different characteristics.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The definition of the cause of karmic maturation is:üîΩThe cause of karmic maturation is only nonvirtue and

original: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
analyzed: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
translated: virtue that is contaminated.

original: zhes de'i 'bras bu las tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes de'i 'bras bu las tha dad pa yin la /
translated: Its result is different from that.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang /
translated: The fruitions of karmic maturation are as follows.üîΩ

original: rnam smin lung du ma bstan zhes rang gi rgyu las mtshan nyid tha dad do //
analyzed: rnam smin lung du ma bstan zhes rang gi rgyu las mtshan nyid tha dad do //
translated: The maturational result is also different from its cause, since it is stated that the maturational result is neutral.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ni snga phyi med bzhin du yang phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni snga phyi med bzhin du yang phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though they are not simultaneous, it is not contradictory for them to be mutual results.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Homogeneous causes are not different from their result, because the cause and result are different in nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what?

original: dus snga phyir 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dus snga phyir 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are not different because they arise earlier and later.

original: de'i phyir snga phyi med na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga phyi med na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, if they are not simultaneous, homogeneous causes are only mutual results,

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not maturational causes.

original: gnas skabs las rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas skabs las rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, ‚ÄúThe state of an ordinary being is the nonobtainment of a noble being.‚Äù

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rim pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i gnas skabs kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rim pa rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i gnas skabs kho na yin gyi /
translated: Past and present states are homogeneous causes because the sequence of cause and effect is ascertained.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: But future states are not homogeneous causes.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation

original: mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
translated: is nonvirtue and contaminated virtue.

original: zhes mtshan nyid las rnam par gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes mtshan nyid las rnam par gnas pa yin la /
translated: This is the definition of the cause of karmic maturation.

original: mtshan nyid kyang dus gsum du 'khrul pa med pas ma 'ongs pa yang mi bzlog go ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang dus gsum du 'khrul pa med pas ma 'ongs pa yang mi bzlog go ste /
translated: Since the definition is not confused about the three times, future states are not excluded.

original: mi dgag go //üîΩsa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du zhes bya ba rgyas par @211a * //
analyzed: mi dgag go // sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du zhes bya ba rgyas par @211a * //
translated: That is, they are not negated.üîΩThe path of the nine levels is a homogeneous cause of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.

original: 'byung ba la /üîΩni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par du bya ba'i don du'o //üîΩlam zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa la brjod par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba la / ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni khyad par du bya ba'i don du'o // lam zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa la brjod par 'dod de /
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam las khyad par du 'phags pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam las khyad par du 'phags pas so //
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level.üîΩThe term ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is a homogeneous cause of the uncontaminated path of the same level

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni rang gis pa khon skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni rang gis pa khon skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Contaminated phenomena are homogeneous causes of their own level.

original: gzhan gyi sa pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sa pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not of other levels,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa rnams ni sred pas yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa rnams ni sred pas yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the contaminated levels are differentiated by craving.

original: lam gyi bden pa yang sa tha dad par mtshungs bzhin du sa dgu'i lam kho na phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yang sa tha dad par mtshungs bzhin du sa dgu'i lam kho na phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The truth of path is a homogeneous cause of the nine levels, since it is similar in being of different levels.üîΩBut it is not a homogeneous cause of contaminated states.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason for this?

original: de'i phyir rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: 'di ni sa de dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sa de dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is a guest in those levels.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ltar 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pas ma bsdus pas sa dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ltar 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pas ma bsdus pas sa dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: It is a guest in the levels, since it is not subsumed by the desire, form, or formless realms, like contaminated states.

original: sa dgu la brten nas 'thob pa'i phyir sa dgu pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dgu la brten nas 'thob pa'i phyir sa dgu pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the nine levels because it is obtained in dependence on the nine levels.

original: yang ji ltar sa de dag tu gtogs pa ma yin par shes shen /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sa de dag tu gtogs pa ma yin par shes shen /
translated: Why are they not classified in those levels?

original: de'i phyir / sa de ba'i sred pa dag gis bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sa de ba'i sred pa dag gis bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, because they are not appropriated by craving for those levels.

original: sred pas bdag gir byas pas yongs su bcad pas khams dang sa rnams yongs su gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: sred pas bdag gir byas pas yongs su bcad pas khams dang sa rnams yongs su gcod pa yin la /
translated: The realms and levels are differentiated by craving that appropriates them and by the complete severance of that appropriation.

original: bdag gir byas pa yang dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa yang dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, appropriation increases through focal objects and concomitance.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas pa ma yin te /
translated: But uncontaminated states are not appropriated by craving for the desire, form and formless realms.

original: de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because they are antidotes to those.

original: 'o na ji ltar lam don du gnyer bar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar lam don du gnyer bar byed ce na /
translated: If that is so, then why do they strive for the path?

original: de ni chos la 'dun pa dge ba zhig yin te /üîΩ'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni chos la 'dun pa dge ba zhig yin te / 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
translated: That is a virtuous aspiration for Dharma.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not attachment because it is an object to be abandoned.

original: de ltar lam glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ris mthun pa gzhan gyi sa pa'i yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas thams cad thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du thal ba yin dang / mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /üîΩgong dang 'og dang rang gi sa pa mnyam pa dang khyad par can gnyis kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar lam glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ris mthun pa gzhan gyi sa pa'i yang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas thams cad thams cad kyi rgyu nyid du thal ba yin dang / mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin // zhes bya ba smos te / gong dang 'og dang rang gi sa pa mnyam pa dang khyad par can gnyis kyi yin gyi /
translated: Therefore it follows that everything would be the cause of everything.üîΩThe Abhidharmakosa states, It is the cause of that of equal or higher status.

original: chung ngu'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu'i ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the cause of that of equal and higher status, but not of that of lower status.

original: 'di lta ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is stated in the Abhidharmakosa:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni lan cig kho na skye'i yang dang yang du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni lan cig kho na skye'i yang dang yang du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises only once and not repeatedly.

original: @211b de'i phyir de nyid ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @211b de'i phyir de nyid ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore the Abhidharmakosa states, It is the cause of that of equal status in the future.

original: mnyam pa'i phyir de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: mnyam pa'i phyir de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: It is the homogeneous cause of that of equal status because it is equal.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nas mi skye ba shes pa'i bar khyad par can gyi yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nas mi skye ba shes pa'i bar khyad par can gyi yang rgyu yin no //
translated: It is also the special cause of the knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering up to the knowledge of nonarising.

original: mi skye ba shes pa ni mi skye ba shes pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa ni mi skye ba shes pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The knowledge of nonarising is only the knowledge of nonarising.

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the other.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par can gzhan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because there is no other special one.

original: mi skye ba shes pa bas ni chos khyad par can gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa bas ni chos khyad par can gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other special factor beyond the knowledge of nonarising.

original: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam rnams ni gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam rnams ni gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The paths of seeing, meditation, and no-more-learning are, respectively, the homogeneous causes of three, two, and one.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam gzhan dang bsgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas gsum gyi yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni mthong ba'i lam gzhan dang bsgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pas gsum gyi yin no //
translated: The path of seeing is the homogeneous cause of three: the other path of seeing, the path of meditation, and the path of no-more-learning.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni bsgom pa'i lam gzhan dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni bsgom pa'i lam gzhan dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi yin gyi /
translated: The path of meditation is the homogeneous cause of two: the other path of meditation and the path of no-more-learning.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the homogeneous cause of the path of seeing.

original: dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is inferior.

original: mi slob pa'i lam ni mi slob pa'i lam gzhan gyi yin gyi /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam ni mi slob pa'i lam gzhan gyi yin gyi /
translated: The path of no-more-learning is the homogeneous cause of the path of no-more-learning,

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gi ni ma yin te /
translated: but not of the path of seeing and the path of cultivation,

original: dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are inferior.

original: de ltar thun mong gi dbang du byas nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar thun mong gi dbang du byas nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa bshad de /
translated: Thus, the path of seeing, etc. are explained from the point of view of the general.

original: dbang po'i bye brag gi dbang du byas na ni re re zhing dbang po'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i bye brag gi dbang du byas na ni re re zhing dbang po'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: But from the point of view of the specific faculties, each is differentiated by its faculty.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩde la yang dbang po rtul po'i lam ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //üîΩde la mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dag las /üîΩdbang po rtul po'i lam mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i lam gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / de la yang dbang po rtul po'i lam ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo // de la mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dag las / dbang po rtul po'i lam mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin ni dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i lam gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: For this very reason,üîΩthe path of dull faculties is the homogeneous cause of the path of dull and sharp faculties.üîΩThe path of sharp faculties is the homogeneous cause of the path of sharp faculties alone, not of the path of dull faculties.

original: dbang po rnon po'i lam ni dbang po rnon po'i lam kho na'i yin gyi dbang po rtul po'i lam gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i lam ni dbang po rnon po'i lam kho na'i yin gyi dbang po rtul po'i lam gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: The path of dull faculties is the homogeneous cause of the path of dull faculties alone, not of the path of sharp faculties.

original: bsgom pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //üîΩ'di nyid kho na bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o // 'di nyid kho na bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The path of meditation and the path of no more learning should be explained in the same way.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩdad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i lam gzhan dang / ci rigs par chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dang / dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ni dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i lam gzhan dang / ci rigs par chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dang / dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang /
translated: To demonstrate just this, he says:üîΩFor example, the path of one who follows faith is the homogeneous cause of six:üîΩthe path of one who follows faith, the path of one who follows reality, the path of one resolute in faith, the path of one obtaining results by insight, the path of one liberated regardless of circumstances, and the path of one liberated regardless of circumstances.üîΩThe path of one resolute in faith is the homogeneous cause of five, excluding the path of one who follows reality.

original: dus dang mi sbyor ba'i lam skye ba'i chos can rnams dang / mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi yin pas na drug gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩdad pas mos @212a * //
analyzed: dus dang mi sbyor ba'i lam skye ba'i chos can rnams dang / mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi yin pas na drug gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩdad pas mos @212a * //
translated: The path of one obtaining results by insight is the homogeneous cause of four, excluding the path of one who follows reality and the path of one who follows faith.üîΩThe path of one liberated regardless of circumstances is the homogeneous cause of three, excluding the path of one who follows reality, the path of one who follows faith, and the path of one resolute in faith.üîΩThe path of one liberated regardless of circumstances is the homogeneous cause of two, excluding the three paths mentioned above.üîΩThe path of one who follows reality is the homogeneous cause of one, excluding the four paths mentioned above.

original: pa'i lam ni dad pas mos pa'i lam gzhan dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba dang / gzhan dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: pa'i lam ni dad pas mos pa'i lam gzhan dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba dang / gzhan dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The path of one who is resolute in faith is the homogeneous cause of other paths of one who is resolute in faith, of the path of one who obtains results by insight, of the path of one liberated according to circumstances, of the path of one liberated not according to circumstances.

original: dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gzhan dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi yin te /
analyzed: dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gzhan dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi yin te /
translated: The path of one liberated according to circumstances is the homogeneous cause of other paths of one liberated according to circumstances and of the path of one liberated not according to circumstances.

original: de ltar na gnyis kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩchos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no // chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus it is the homogeneous cause of two.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam gzhan dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam gzhan dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The path of one who follows the teachings is the homogeneous cause of other paths of one who follows the teachings, of the path of one who obtains results by insight, of the path of one liberated not according to circumstances.

original: de ltar na gsum gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gsum gyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus it is the homogeneous cause of three.

original: mthong bas thob pa'i lam ni mthong bas thob pa'i lam gzhan dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi yin te /
analyzed: mthong bas thob pa'i lam ni mthong bas thob pa'i lam gzhan dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi yin te /
translated: The path of seeing is the homogeneous cause of the path of seeing and the path of no-more-learning.

original: de ltar na gnyis kyi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis kyi yin no //
translated: Thus it is the homogeneous cause of two.

original: dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam gzhan kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam gzhan kho na'i yin te /
translated: The path of no-more-learning is the homogeneous cause of the path of no-more-learning alone.

original: de ltar na gcig gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gcig gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus it is the homogeneous cause of one.

original: sa 'og ma dman pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /üîΩyang ji ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma dman pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni / yang ji ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The question is asked because the lower stage is inferior.üîΩHow is it that the path of the one who follows faith is the homogeneous cause of the path of the one who obtains by insight?

original: de la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa ni sa 'og ma pa'i dang pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam mnyam ste /
analyzed: de la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa ni sa 'og ma pa'i dang pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam mnyam ste /
translated: The path of the one who follows faith of the fourth absorption stage is equal to the path of the one who obtains by insight of the first stage,

original: gnyis ka yang dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang dbang po rtul po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are of dull faculty.

original: de bzhin du dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam sa gong ma pa bas ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam sa 'og ma pa khyad par can yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam sa gong ma pa bas ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam sa 'og ma pa khyad par can yin te /
translated: So too, the path of one who is a follower through faith on a higher level is superior to the path of one who is a follower through doctrine on a lower level.

original: dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du yang sa gong ma pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dang ni /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du yang sa gong ma pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dang ni /
translated: Because the former has sharper intellectual faculty.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam sa 'og ma pa mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam sa 'og ma pa mnyam pa yin te /
translated: So too, the path of one who is a follower through doctrine on a higher level is equal to the path of one who is a follower through doctrine on a lower level.

original: gnyis ka yang dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang dbang po rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both have sharp intellectual faculty.

original: de bzhin du dbang po'i sgo nas sa gong ma pa'i dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / mnyam pa dang khyad par can yin pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po'i sgo nas sa gong ma pa'i dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / mnyam pa dang khyad par can yin pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, the paths of one who is resolute in faith, one who obtains results by insight, one liberated only by the occasion, and one liberated regardless of occasion on a higher level, by means of their intellectual faculty, are superior and equal to the paths of those on a lower level.

original: de bzhin du rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas kyang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas kyang yin te /
translated: So too, they are equal and superior by means of the cause that generates them.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam dag ni sa gong ma'i @212b mthong ba'i lam pas rgyus rgyas par byas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam dag ni sa gong ma'i @212b mthong ba'i lam pas rgyus rgyas par byas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can yin no //
translated: The path of meditation of a lower level and the path of no more learning are special in the sense that they are extended by the cause of the path of seeing of a higher level.

original: de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i bsgom pa'i lam pas sa 'og ma pa'i mi slob pa'i lam khyad par can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa gong ma pa'i bsgom pa'i lam pas sa 'og ma pa'i mi slob pa'i lam khyad par can yin no //
translated: Similarly, the path of no more learning of a lower level is special in the sense that it is extended by the path of meditation of a higher level.

original: de la rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩsogs pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni sgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam nye bar bsdu ste sa gong ma pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod ba bas /
analyzed: de la rgyus shin tu rgyas par byas pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la / sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni sgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam nye bar bsdu ste sa gong ma pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod ba bas /
translated: Here, extended by the cause means extended by the path of seeing and so on.üîΩThe term and so on refers to the path of meditation and the path of no more learning.üîΩThe perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering of a higher level is special in the sense that it is extended by the cause of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering of a lower level.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to the other levels.

original: de bzhin du chung ngu'i chung ngu bas chung ngu'i 'bring rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can yin la de bzhin du chung ngu'i 'bring bas chung ngu'i chen po'i rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can yin pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du chung ngu'i chung ngu bas chung ngu'i 'bring rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can yin la de bzhin du chung ngu'i 'bring bas chung ngu'i chen po'i rgyus rgyas pa'i sgo nas khyad par can yin pa nas /
translated: So too, the medium path of the medium stage is superior to the small path of the small stage through the door of its extensive cause. So too, the great path of the great stage is superior to the medium path of the medium stage through the door of its extensive cause.

original: chen po'i 'bring bas chen po'i chen po'i bar du khyad par can yin te /
analyzed: chen po'i 'bring bas chen po'i chen po'i bar du khyad par can yin te /
translated: The medium path of the great stage is superior to the great path of the great stage.

original: chen po'i chen po pas ni khyad par can gzhan med do //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po pas ni khyad par can gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other path superior to the great path of the great stage.

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ni drug dag gi skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyu yin no zhes smras na /üîΩdad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dag ni rgyud gcig la skye ba mi srid do zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma khong na yod pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam ni drug dag gi skal ba mnyam ba'i rgyu yin no zhes smras na / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam dag ni rgyud gcig la skye ba mi srid do zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma khong na yod pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is said that the path of one who follows faith is the homogeneous cause of the six,üîΩthen in order to clarify the former position that it is impossible for the paths of one who follows faith and one who follows reality to arise in one mindstream, he says,

original: rgyud gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyud gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is impossible for the paths of one who follows faith and one who follows reality to arise in one mindstream.‚Äù

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam byung ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam mi skye ba'i chos can gyi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i lam byung ba ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i lam mi skye ba'i chos can gyi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: The path of one who follows trust, when it arises, is the cause of the path of one who follows reality, but it is not its condition.

original: de mi skye ba ni rkyen mtshang ba las yin te /
analyzed: de mi skye ba ni rkyen mtshang ba las yin te /
translated: The nonarising of the latter is due to the incompleteness of its conditions.

original: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa de ni nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa de ni nam yang rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is said, ‚ÄúWhatever is the cause of something is never not the cause of it.‚Äù

original: sbyor byung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyor byung zhes bya ba la /
translated: Arisen from practice.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba smos pa ni skyes nas thob pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba smos pa ni skyes nas thob pa dgag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarisen from practice‚Äù is stated to exclude that obtained from birth.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba ni sbyor ba las skyes pa'o //üîΩthos pa las byung ba ni gang dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab thos pa las skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba ni sbyor ba las skyes pa'o // thos pa las byung ba ni gang dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab thos pa las skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: That arisen from practice is that arisen from practice.

original: mu stegs can gyi tshig thos pa las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi tshig thos pa las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That arisen from hearing is that arisen from hearing the scriptures of the Buddha, but not that arisen from hearing the words of non Buddhists.

original: bsams pa las byung ba ni de bsams pa nyid las skyes pa dag go //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba ni de bsams pa nyid las skyes pa dag go //
translated: That arisen from contemplation is that arisen from contemplating those teachings.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgoms pa las skyes bdag go //üîΩmnyam pa dang khyad par can dag kho na'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgoms pa las skyes bdag go // mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag kho na'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: That arisen from meditation is that which arises from meditation on impermanence, etc.

original: dman pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te @213a * //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dman pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te @213a * // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the cause of the equal and superior, but not of the inferior.

original: rgyu'i 'bras bu dman pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu'i 'bras bu dman pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: The inferior is not the effect of a cause,

original: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that effort would be fruitless.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba med do //
translated: The realm of desire is not the effect of meditation, because it is not meditative equipoise.

original: bsams pa las byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The realm of desire is not the effect of deliberation, because deliberation is absent there.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams ni rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan pa'i phyir gang gi tshe sems par rtsom pa de'i tshe de dag ting nge 'dzin la nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams ni rgyud zhi gnas kyis brlan pa'i phyir gang gi tshe sems par rtsom pa de'i tshe de dag ting nge 'dzin la nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The realm of form is the effect of deliberation, because when one begins to deliberate, one enters meditative concentration, since the continuum of the mind is moistened by calm abiding.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Those also are the effect of hearing, etc.

original: chung ngu'i chung ngu'i dag ni thams cad kyi yin la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu'i dag ni thams cad kyi yin la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The small-small are the homogeneous cause of all.

original: chung ngu'i chung ngu dag ni chung du'i gzhan mnyam po rnams dang / chung ngu'i 'bring la sogs pa gzhan khyad par can brgyad kyi yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung ngu dag ni chung du'i gzhan mnyam po rnams dang / chung ngu'i 'bring la sogs pa gzhan khyad par can brgyad kyi yin no //
translated: The small-small are the homogeneous cause of the other small stages, the small-medium, etc., and of the other eight superior stages.

original: chung ngu'i 'bring po dag ni brgyad kyi yin la /
analyzed: chung ngu'i 'bring po dag ni brgyad kyi yin la /
translated: The small-medium are the homogeneous cause of eight.

original: chung ngu'i chen po dag ni bdun gyi yin zhing /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po dag ni bdun gyi yin zhing /
translated: The small-great are the homogeneous cause of seven.

original: 'bring gi chung ngu dag ni drug gi yin pa nas ;
analyzed: 'bring gi chung ngu dag ni drug gi yin pa nas ;
translated: The medium-small are the homogeneous cause of six.

original: chen po'i chen po dag ni chen po'i chen po dag kho na'i bar gyi yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po dag ni chen po'i chen po dag kho na'i bar gyi yin no //
translated: The great-great are the homogeneous cause of the great-great.

original: skyes nas thob pa can gyi dge ba'i chos rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa can gyi dge ba'i chos rnams ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The wholesome factors acquired at birth are the homogeneous cause of the wholesome factors acquired at birth.

original: skye bas thob pa ni skyes nas thob pa ste /
analyzed: skye bas thob pa ni skyes nas thob pa ste /
translated: Acquired at birth means acquired through birth.

original: de 'di dag la yod pas na skyes nas thob pa can no //
analyzed: de 'di dag la yod pas na skyes nas thob pa can no //
translated: They are the wholesome factors acquired at birth.

original: rnam pa dgu po de dag thams cad phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu po de dag thams cad phan tshun skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: All nine stages are the homogeneous cause of each other.

original: chung ngu'i chung du dag chung ngu dag gi yin pa nas chen po'i chen po dag chung ngu'i chung du dag gi bar gyi yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung du dag chung ngu dag gi yin pa nas chen po'i chen po dag chung ngu'i chung du dag gi bar gyi yin no //
translated: The smallest of the small are the homogeneous causes of the smallest of the small up to the largest of the large.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu ni dman pa yin par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu ni dman pa yin par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: The result of a homogeneous cause that is produced through effort is not considered inferior.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa can ma yin pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa can ma yin pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: But that which is not produced through effort is inferior.

original: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same applies to the defiled.

original: rnam pa dgu po thams cad phan tshun skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu po thams cad phan tshun skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: All nine types are the homogeneous causes of each other.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not produced through effort.

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are, respectively, the homogeneous causes of three, two, and one.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa bzhi'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa la sogs pa bzhi'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The maturational birth is the homogeneous cause of the four: maturational birth, and so on.

original: spyod lam pa ni gsum gyi yin gyi /
analyzed: spyod lam pa ni gsum gyi yin gyi /
translated: The birth of deportment is the homogeneous cause of three.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the homogeneous cause of those born from the cause of evolution,

original: de dag ni mngon par 'du byed pa can ma yin pa nyid kyis dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mngon par 'du byed pa can ma yin pa nyid kyis dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those born from the cause of evolution are weak, since they are not created by effort.

original: bzo'i gnas pa ni gnyis dag gi yin la /
analyzed: bzo'i gnas pa ni gnyis dag gi yin la /
translated: The state of skill in arts and crafts is the homogeneous cause of those two.

original: @213b sprul pa ni sprul pa rnams kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: @213b sprul pa ni sprul pa rnams kho na'i yin te /
translated: Emanation is the homogeneous cause of emanations alone.

original: phyi ma phyi ma da ga ni ches mngon par 'du byed pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma da ga ni ches mngon par 'du byed pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the latter are created by greater effort.

original: sprul pa'i sems bsam gtan bzhi'i 'bras bu 'dod pa na spyod pa yang yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems bsam gtan bzhi'i 'bras bu 'dod pa na spyod pa yang yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind of emanation is also the homogeneous cause of the desire realm, which is the result of the four absorptions.

original: de yang rim pa bzhin du bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de yang rim pa bzhin du bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the homogeneous cause of those of its level and lower levels, respectively, in order: four, three, two, and one.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir de la bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / de'i phyir de la bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: How is that?üîΩTherefore it is said: The result of the higher absorptions...

original: de nyid las rgyu smras pa ni 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rgyu smras pa ni 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The reason is stated in that text: because it would be pointless to make effort.

original: mngon par 'du byed pas bskyed pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa can te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pas bskyed pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa can te /
translated: That which is generated by formation is formed.

original: de dag rnam pa bzhi char yang mngon par 'du byed pa can yin no //
analyzed: de dag rnam pa bzhi char yang mngon par 'du byed pa can yin no //
translated: All four types are formed.

original: bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas de de dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan gong ma'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas de de dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: The result of the higher meditative development is superior to the result of the lower meditative development. Therefore, the higher meditative development is not the homogeneous cause of the lower.

original: lhag ma rnams ni de'i yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni de'i yin te /
translated: But the lower is the homogeneous cause of the higher.

original: dman pa'i phyir dang sngar skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa'i phyir dang sngar skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is inferior and because it arises earlier.

original: de nyid la dpe ni /
analyzed: de nyid la dpe ni /
translated: An example of this is

original: s'a lu dang nas la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: s'a lu dang nas la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: like rice, barley, etc.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ni mnyam pa'am lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ni mnyam pa'am lhag pa yin te /
translated: The result of the homogeneous cause is either equal or superior.

original: s'a lu'i sa bon gcig las 'bras bu gcig gam du ma 'byung gi dman pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: s'a lu'i sa bon gcig las 'bras bu gcig gam du ma 'byung gi dman pa ni ma yin no //
translated: From one seed of rice, one or many results arise, but never from one seed of rice, the result of barley.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu dman pa'i ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu mngon par 'du byed pa can gyi 'bras bu dman pa'i ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result of a homogeneous cause that is an active cause is not inferior.

original: zag pa med pa skyes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa skyes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: When uncontaminated states arise, etc.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni skyes kyang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rang gi rigs can ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ma yin te /üîΩdman pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnam pas khyad par can nyid yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni skyes kyang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rang gi rigs can ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ma yin te / dman pa'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnam pas khyad par can nyid yin te /
translated: The state of perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering that arises does not generate the future state of perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering of its own type because it is inferior.

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The state of knowledge of the truth of suffering is superior to the state of perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering because it is definite in nature and it arises simultaneously with the obtainment of freedom from affliction.

original: khyad par can thams cad dman pa'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par can thams cad dman pa'i lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All superior states are like inferior states.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams na /
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams na /
translated: For example, if one degenerates from the state of an arhat,

original: mi slob pa'i lam sngar skyes pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba phyis skyes pa dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam sngar skyes pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba phyis skyes pa dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the previously arisen path of no-more-learning is not the homogeneous cause of the later arisen once-returner and non-returner.

original: rgyud gcig la @214a * //üîΩnges pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rgyud gcig la @214a * // nges pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: In one mindstream

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa dag ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ma skyes pa'i sngar sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i dus kho nar thob pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i sngon du thob pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma 'ongs pa dag ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ma skyes pa'i sngar sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i dus kho nar thob pas sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i sngon du thob pa yin no //
translated: The future perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is obtained at the time of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering alone, prior to the arising of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa de dag thob nas gzod skye bas de dag thob pa bas phyis skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa de dag thob nas gzod skye bas de dag thob pa bas phyis skyes pa yin no //
translated: Since it arises only after obtaining Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, it arises later than that obtained.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa sngar skyes pa gang yin pa de ni de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa sngar skyes pa gang yin pa de ni de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba kho na yin te /
translated: Any previously arisen perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is its homogeneous cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sngar thob pa zhes smos kyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sngar thob pa zhes smos kyi /
translated: Therefore, it says previously obtained,

original: sngar skyes pa zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not say previously arisen.

original: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni 'di ltar 'bras bu snga ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu bshad pa ni 'di ltar 'bras bu snga ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The cause of that is explained:üîΩIf the effect were to arise earlier, the cause would be pointless.

original: gal te 'bras bu ches snga bar 'gyur na ni rgyu don med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu ches snga bar 'gyur na ni rgyu don med par 'gyur la /
translated: If the future were a homogeneous cause, cause and effect would be confused because there would be no earlier and later.üîΩThis has already been explained.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier,üîΩthe future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yin na yang snga phyir med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag 'chol bar 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //üîΩzag pa med pa'i chos sngar skyes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa yin na yang snga phyir med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag 'chol bar 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to // zag pa med pa'i chos sngar skyes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.

original: 'dir ni 'bras bu sngar skyes pa nyid dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa nyid yod pa ma yin no snyam ste dris pa'o //üîΩ'di lta ste 'bras bu gong ma las yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'bras bu sngar skyes pa nyid dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma 'ongs pa nyid yod pa ma yin no snyam ste dris pa'o // 'di lta ste 'bras bu gong ma las yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.

original: 'bras bu gong ma ni dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: 'bras bu gong ma ni dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: If the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier, the future would be a homogeneous cause.üîΩIf the effect arises earlier

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'am lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'am lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: It is the result of nonreturn or the result of once-return.

original: 'bras bu 'og ma mngon du byed pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la 'og ma ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'og ma mngon du byed pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la 'og ma ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'am /
translated: When manifesting the lower result,

original: rgyud du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyud du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the lower is the result of nonreturn or the result of once-return or the result of stream entry.üîΩWhen manifesting the lower result, the former path subsumed by the higher result is not a homogeneous cause of the later path subsumed by the lower result.

original: de la 'bras bu gong ma las yongs su nyams pa 'bras bu 'og ma mngon du byed pa'i tshe 'bras bu gong ma'i lam sngar skyes pa yin yang 'bras bu 'og mas bsdus pa'i lam phyis skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin ba lta bu ste
analyzed: de la 'bras bu gong ma las yongs su nyams pa 'bras bu 'og ma mngon du byed pa'i tshe 'bras bu gong ma'i lam sngar skyes pa yin yang 'bras bu 'og mas bsdus pa'i lam phyis skyes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin ba lta bu ste
translated: For example, when degenerated from the higher result, the former path subsumed by the higher result is not a homogeneous cause of the later path subsumed by the lower result.

original: / de na dman pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: / de na dman pa'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Because it is inferior.üîΩObtaining the knowledge of the truth of sufferingüîΩand so on is obtained by the knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on.

original: de thob pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de thob pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: Obtaining the knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on is obtained by the knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin pa lta bu ste /üîΩ@214b de dag ni phyis skyes mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i thob pa sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin pa lta bu ste / @214b de dag ni phyis skyes mod kyi /
translated: That is, the obtainment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is not the homogeneous cause of perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on that arise later.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa bas dman pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i thob pa bas dman pa kho na yin no //
translated: They are inferior to the obtainment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma gong ma gong ma dang lhan cig skyes pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma gong ma gong ma dang lhan cig skyes pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of those that arise simultaneously with higher moments.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of the homogeneous cause is complete.üîΩThe concurrent cause is minds and

original: mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems byung zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems byung zhes bya ba la /
translated: mental factors.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba kho na 'o zhes nges par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni sems dang sems las byung ba kho na 'o zhes nges par gzung ba dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù in the verse indicates that the concurrent cause is definitely only minds and mental factors.

original: rnam pa gzhan du nges par gzung na ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa bkag pa mi 'dod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du nges par gzung na ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la sogs pa bkag pa mi 'dod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the mind and mental factors would not be denied as coemergent causes.

original: de lta na ni dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta na ni dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúThose arisen from different times and different continuua.‚Äù

original: 'o na ni dmigs pa gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'o na ni dmigs pa gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they are the same objective support,

original: de lta na dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ldog pa yin no //
translated: then it follows that those arisen from different times and different continuua would be concomitant causes because they have different aspects and different objective supports.

original: de lta na yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyud dang dus tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang sngar smras pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyud dang dus tha dad pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang sngar smras pa'o //
translated: Even so, the same error would occur, that is, the error previously stated, ‚ÄúThose arisen from different continuua and different times.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa tha dad pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar dus dang rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa tha dad pa dag go //
translated: Thus, those that arise from different times and different continua are those that have the same aspect and object, and those that have different aspects and objects.

original: de la rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag ces bya ba smos pas ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa bkag go //
analyzed: de la rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag ces bya ba smos pas ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa bkag go //
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúthose that have the same aspect and object‚Äù excludes those that have different aspects and objects.

original: cig shos ni ma bkag pas thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig shos ni ma bkag pas thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the other is not excluded, the absurd consequence is that those that have different aspects and objects are also similar and immediately antecedent conditions.

original: 'o na ni dus gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'o na ni dus gcig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúBut then they would be simultaneous,‚Äù one might say.

original: de lta na yang rgyud tha dad pa pa las skyes shing dus tha mi dad pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyud tha dad pa pa las skyes shing dus tha mi dad pa rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even so, the absurd consequence is that those that arise from different continua and are not different in time are also similar and immediately antecedent conditions.

original: mang po rnams zla ba tshes pa la sogs pa la lta ba dag gi lta bu /
analyzed: mang po rnams zla ba tshes pa la sogs pa la lta ba dag gi lta bu /
translated: For example, many people looking at the new moon.

original: rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa las skyes pa /
translated: Those that arise from different continua

original: dus gcig cing rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gcig cing rnam pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: are simultaneous and have the same aspect and object.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par de dag gis ni gzhan du yang thal bar 'gyur ba de lta bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par de dag gis ni gzhan du yang thal bar 'gyur ba de lta bas na /
translated: Because of those differences, it would follow that they are different.

original: rten mtshungs can rnams so //
analyzed: rten mtshungs can rnams so //
translated: They are similar in that they are the support.üîΩSince they are different streams, they are similar in that they are the support of the eye faculty, etc., from the perspective of their type.

original: rgyud tha dad pa rnams kyang rigs kyi sgo nas rten mig la sogs pa mtshungs pa can yin pas de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩ'dis ni skad cig @215a * //
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa rnams kyang rigs kyi sgo nas rten mig la sogs pa mtshungs pa can yin pas de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad pa ste zhes bya ba smos te / 'dis ni skad cig @215a * //
translated: In order to distinguish them from that, it says, ‚ÄúThey are similar in that they are not different.‚Äù

original: ma'i dbang du byas nas mtshungs pa nyid du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: ma'i dbang du byas nas mtshungs pa nyid du 'dod kyi /
translated: This shows that they are similar from the perspective of momentariness.

original: rigs kyi dbang du byas nas ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbang du byas nas ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: They are not similar from the perspective of type.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúFor example,‚Äù and so on.üîΩWhat is the difference between the concomitant cause and the co-originated cause?

original: yang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces khong na yod pa'i dri ba gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ces khong na yod pa'i dri ba gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to resolve this question, which is implied by the text, it says,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yang yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The co-existent cause is also the associated cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a co-existent cause that is not an associated cause.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs dang / skye ba la sogs pa dag dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs dang / skye ba la sogs pa dag dang / 'byung ba chen po rnams so //
translated: This is form that is derived from the fundamental material elements and is concomitant with mind, such as the sense faculties, and the characteristics of birth, etc.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa kho na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa kho na lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin na /
translated: If the co-existent cause is only the associated cause,

original: de la rdzas khyad par med pas 'dri pa ni yang don gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩphan tshun 'bras bu'i don gyis na //
analyzed: de la rdzas khyad par med pas 'dri pa ni yang don gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // phan tshun 'bras bu'i don gyis na //
translated: then why does the Abhidharma state: ‚ÄúWhat is the co-existent cause?

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: It is said that they are co-existent causes by the meaning of mutual result.üîΩThe meaning of mutual result is like the meaning of mutual support.

original: ji ltar 'gron po rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gron po rnams phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lhan cig lam du 'gro ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as travelers proceed on the road by the power of each other,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang phan tshun gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir phan tshun 'bras bu nyid du 'dod la /
translated: Also, minds and mental factors arise by the power of each other, therefore they are asserted to be reciprocal results.

original: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid kyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur 'dod do //
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu nyid kyis kyang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyur 'dod do //
translated: They are asserted to be coemergent causes by virtue of being reciprocal results.

original: mtshungs pa lngas zhes bya ba ni rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa'i rnam pa dag gis so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa lngas zhes bya ba ni rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa'i rnam pa dag gis so //
translated: By the five similar states means by the five similar states of support, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par 'jug pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par 'jug pa'i don gyis te /
translated: By the meaning of association means by the meaning of similar engagement.

original: ji ltar 'gron po phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lam du 'gro ba de dag zas dang btung ba dang / khrus dang / mal dang stan la sogs pa yongs su longs spyad pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar sbyor ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gron po phan tshun gyi stobs kyis lam du 'gro ba de dag zas dang btung ba dang / khrus dang / mal dang stan la sogs pa yongs su longs spyad pa'i bya ba la 'dra bar sbyor ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as travelers on a road go by the power of each other and they are similar in their engagement in activities such as eating, drinking, bathing, beds, seats and so on.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar ba'i dus su 'ong ba na gcig med na yang thams cad mtshungs par mi ldan pas /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar ba'i dus su 'ong ba na gcig med na yang thams cad mtshungs par mi ldan pas /
translated: Also, when minds and mental factors come from the future to the present, if one does not exist, all do not exist.

original: 'di ni de dag gi rgyu'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi rgyu'i dngos po yin te /
translated: This is their causal state,

original: de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they exist when it exists.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //
translated: The concurrent cause has been explained.

original: kun 'gro zhes bya ba nyon mongs can //üîΩrnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun 'gro zhes bya ba nyon mongs can // rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The pervasive is afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa smos pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir @215b te ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa smos pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir @215b te ;
translated: The term ‚Äúafflicted‚Äù in the root text is stated to distinguish this from the homogeneous cause.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can rnams dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi yin gyi 'di ni nyon mongs pa rnams kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can rnams dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi yin gyi 'di ni nyon mongs pa rnams kho na'i yin no //
translated: That is, the pervasive cause is the cause of afflicted and unafflicted states, but this is the cause of afflicted states alone.

original: de lta yin na gzhan gyi sa pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / phyis skyes pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa yang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan gyi sa pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / phyis skyes pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa yang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyur thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that the pervasive cause would also include states of other levels, future states, states arisen earlier, and coemergent states.

original: de'i phyir / rang sar kun 'gro snga zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩkun du 'gro ba yang de dag yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rang sar kun 'gro snga zhes bya ba smos so // kun du 'gro ba yang de dag yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe omnipresent ones of its level are prior.‚Äù

original: snga ba yang yin pa ni kun 'gro snga ste /
analyzed: snga ba yang yin pa ni kun 'gro snga ste /
translated: They are omnipresent and prior, thus they are omnipresent prior.

original: kun du 'gro ba sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrang gi sa pa'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa'am /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba sngar skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to // rang gi sa pa'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa'am /
translated: The meaning is that the omnipresent ones that arise earlier.

original: da ltar byung ba 'ang rung ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba 'ang rung ste /
translated: The omnipresent negative tendencies of its level, whether past or present,

original: sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can thams cad kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can thams cad kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: are the omnipresent cause of all afflicted entities.

original: 'di skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rang gi ris smos pa ni ma byas te /
analyzed: 'di skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rang gi ris smos pa ni ma byas te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúof its level‚Äù is not stated here as it is in the case of homogeneous cause.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi thun mong ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro//üîΩde dag kyang 'og nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi thun mong ba'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro// de dag kyang 'og nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Because this is a cause that is shared by all afflicted entities, it is distinguished from homogeneous cause.

original: de dag kyang /
analyzed: de dag kyang /
translated: They are also said to be

original: sdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba //
translated: the objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and origin.

original: lta dang de bzhin the tshom dang // gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
analyzed: lta dang de bzhin the tshom dang // gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
translated: that is connate with those,
