original: ma rig gang yin kun du 'gro //
analyzed: ma rig gang yin kun du 'gro //
translated: and the ignorance that is connate withüîΩthe other root afflictions and branch afflictions

original: zhes bya ba ste /üîΩdngos po ris lnga po thams cad kyang dmigs par 'gyur ba 'am ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / dngos po ris lnga po thams cad kyang dmigs par 'gyur ba 'am ;
translated: are called ‚Äúpervasive ignorance.‚ÄùüîΩBecause they are the cause of all afflicted entities, they are called ‚Äúpervasive.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bas na kun du 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bas na kun du 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äúpervasive‚Äù because they are the cause of all afflicted entities, or because they are the cause of all afflicted entities of the five types.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs shig tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu las logs shig tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because they are the common cause of afflicted entities, they are established as a distinct type of cause, in addition to the homogeneous cause.

original: ris gzhan dag gi yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid du rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: ris gzhan dag gi yang zhes bya ba 'dis ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid du rtogs par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúof other types as well‚Äù indicates that they are the common cause of afflicted entities.

original: de la kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de la kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris gzhan yin la /
translated: The objects abandoned by seeing the truths of origin, cessation, and path, and the objects abandoned by the path of meditation are the pervasive cause of the other classes of affliction abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du gang dag kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba las gzhan pa de dag kyang ris gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba las gzhan pa de dag kyang ris gzhan yin no //
translated: Similarly, those other than the objects abandoned by seeing the truth of origin are the other classes.

original: de'i phyir ris gzhan po de dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ris gzhan po de dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore they are the pervasive cause of those other classes because they are the cause of those other classes.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang gi ris pa rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang gi ris pa rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: The word also in the root text indicates that they are also the cause of those of their own class.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu sngar @216a * //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu sngar @216a * //
translated: Pervasive causes that arise earlierüîΩare the homogeneous cause of those of the five classes that have not yet arisen.

original: skyes pa ni ris lnga char gyi nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa yang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid du yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: skyes pa ni ris lnga char gyi nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa yang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid du yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: They are also the dominant result of those that have arisen.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi mthus ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi mthus ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is said that they are the cause of those other classes through their power.

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Thus the BhagavƒÅn also said:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can no //üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba can no // 'jig tshogs la lta ba las skyes pa'o //
translated: All the defilements have the afflicted view of self for their root.üîΩThey are born from the afflicted view of self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun 'byung ba can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun 'byung ba can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are produced by the afflicted view of self.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of Ka≈õmƒ´r say that the noble ones have abandoned the universal cause of the defilements.üîΩBut it is impossible for the abandoning to be a cause.

original: spangs pa yang rgyu'i dngos por mi srid do snyam ste 'dri ba ni /üîΩci 'phags pa'i gang zag gi zhes bya ba rgyas bar smos pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa yang rgyu'i dngos por mi srid do snyam ste 'dri ba ni / ci 'phags pa'i gang zag gi zhes bya ba rgyas bar smos pa'o //
translated: The author asks:

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'od pa rnams la mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'od pa rnams la mngon par 'dod de /
translated: ‚ÄúIs it the case that the noble ones, i.e., the stream-enterers, the once-returners, the non-returners, have abandoned all the defilements whose object is the impure?

original: de dag la nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The noble ones have not abandoned the defilements whose object is the impure, for it is possible that the defilements become active in them.

original: kha che ba rnams na re nyon mongs pa can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re nyon mongs pa can thams cad kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of Ka≈õmƒ´r say: All the defilements, i.e., the defilements of the realm of desire, the realm of fine-materiality, and the realm of immateriality, are abandoned by the noble ones.

original: de dag ni spangs zin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i gnas skabs na rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de dag ni spangs zin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i gnas skabs na rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur bar mi rung ste /
translated: They are not suitable to be the cause of afflicted states in the context of ƒÅryas because they have already been abandoned.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de dag ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs kho nar rgyu'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa yin te /üîΩgang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa de ni nam yang de'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya bas de dag ni spangs kyang /
analyzed: de dag ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs kho nar rgyu'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa yin te / gang zhig gang gi rgyu yin pa de ni nam yang de'i rgyu ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya bas de dag ni spangs kyang /
translated: They are the cause of afflicted states only in the context of ordinary beings.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid du bsnyad do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid du bsnyad do //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is the cause of something is never not the cause of it,‚Äù they are called the pervasive cause of afflicted phenomena even though they have been abandoned.

original: 'di la khungs ni 'di ltar rab tu byed pa dag las /
analyzed: 'di la khungs ni 'di ltar rab tu byed pa dag las /
translated: The source for this is as follows.üîΩThe treatise Differentiating the Middle and Extremes says:

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What are phenomena that arise from the cause of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: 'dir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin pa'i khungs ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu nyid yin pa'i khungs ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The source for the pervasive cause being the common cause of afflicted phenomena is the phrase ‚Äúafflicted phenomena.‚Äù

original: 'dir 'phags pa'am so so'i skye bo'i nyon mongs pa can zhes bya bar khyad par du ma byas pa de'i phyir na 'phags pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa'am so so'i skye bo'i nyon mongs pa can zhes bya bar khyad par du ma byas pa de'i phyir na 'phags pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: Since the root text does not specify that they are afflicted states of ƒÅryas or ordinary beings, it is understood that they are also of ƒÅryas.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes khyad par med pa yin yang kun du 'gro ba rnams kho na gzung ngo //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rgyu las byung ba zhes khyad par med pa yin yang kun du 'gro ba rnams kho na gzung ngo //
translated: Although the root text does not specify that they are the causes of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, they are only pervasive states.

original: de bzhin du rnam par smin pa yang khyad par med par brjod du zin kyang mi dge ba rnams kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par smin pa yang khyad par med par brjod du zin kyang mi dge ba rnams kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, although the root text does not specify that they are the causes of karmic maturation, they are only nonvirtuous states.

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni ma yin @216b no ;
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi ni ma yin @216b no ;
translated: They are not the causes of neutral states.

original: / lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: / lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúDharmas that arise from neutral causes‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir yang mi dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba 'di khungs yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mi dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba 'di khungs yin no //
translated: Here, the source is the statement, ‚ÄúThey are nonvirtuous states.‚ÄùüîΩNeutral states are the two views of the

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis yin te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis yin te /
translated: perpetuity of the self and the annihilation of the self.

original: de dag kyang khyad par med par mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos por bstan pas 'phags pa'i mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang khyad par med par mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos por bstan pas 'phags pa'i mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, since it is taught that they are the cause of nonvirtuous phenomena in general, it is certain that the nonvirtuous phenomena of ƒÅryas arise from the cause of the afflicted view of the self and the extreme view.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'dus byas rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'dus byas rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconditioned phenomena that are neutral‚Äù is stated.

original: 'dus byas smos pa ni nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas smos pa ni nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa rnam par gcad par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù is stated in order to exclude space and nonanalytical cessation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe truth of suffering that is caused by the afflicted view of the self‚Äù is stated.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is not the cause of the afflicted view of the self‚Äù is stated.

original: 'dir rgyas par zhes bya ba smos pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir rgyas par zhes bya ba smos pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin la /
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that the truth of suffering that is caused by the afflicted view of the self

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: is not the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: There are four possibilities:üîΩThat which is a cause of the afflicted view of the self but is notüîΩa result of the afflicted view of the self.üîΩThat which is a result of the afflicted view of the self but is notüîΩa cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin ba yang yod /üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yin ba yang yod / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu can yang ma yin la /
translated: That which is both a cause of the afflicted view of the self and aüîΩresult of the afflicted view of the self.üîΩThat which is neither a cause of the afflicted view of the self nor

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu yang ma yin pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: a result of the afflicted view of the self.

original: de la mu dang po ni /
analyzed: de la mu dang po ni /
translated: The first possibility is past and present negative tendencies that areüîΩto be abandoned by means of the path of seeing the truth of suffering,üîΩand those that are concomitant with them, except for the truth of

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden ba ma gtogs pa dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden ba ma gtogs pa dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba 'das pa dang /
translated: suffering.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di 'phen pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma 'ongs pa dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa dang zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'di 'phen pa yin no //
translated: except for those that are future and concomitant with the truth of path that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: ma gtogs pa dag las gzhan pa de dag gang zhe na /üîΩkun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / kun 'byung @217a * //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa dag las gzhan pa de dag gang zhe na / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / kun 'byung @217a * //
translated: What are those other than those that are excluded?üîΩThey are future states to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin that are concomitant with it, future states to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering,

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun du 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad kho na ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun du 'gro ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad kho na ste /
translated: future pervasive states to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, and all those to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path and by the path of meditation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ltar 'phags pa rnams kyi yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba de
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni khyad par du ma byas pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ltar 'phags pa rnams kyi yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba de
translated: arising from the cause of the afflicted view of the self, but they are not the cause of the afflicted view of the self.

original: skad du rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skad du rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa'i gang zag gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even the afflicted phenomena of ƒÅryas arise from the cause of the pervasive states.

original: 'o na btags pa'i bshad pa zhes bya bas ni bstan bcos dang 'gal bar ston te /
analyzed: 'o na btags pa'i bshad pa zhes bya bas ni bstan bcos dang 'gal bar ston te /
translated: But the commentary called the Vrtti teaches that this contradicts the treatise.

original: gal te 'phags pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: If the afflicted phenomena of ƒÅryas arise from the cause of the pervasive states,

original: mi dge ba'i chos rgyu las byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rgyu las byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: then they would not arise from the cause of nonvirtuous phenomena alone.

original: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu las byung ba dag kyang yin na'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu las byung ba dag kyang yin na'o //
translated: They would also arise from the cause of nonvirtuous and neutral phenomena.

original: 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni mi dge ba ni mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni mi dge ba ni mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir na /
translated: The thought behind the question is that since it is certain that nonvirtue arises only from a nonvirtuous cause,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no snyam pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin no snyam pa'o //
translated: it does not have a cause that is neutral.

original: yod de 'phags pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yod de 'phags pa'i gang zag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: There is, for example, the volition of an ƒÅrya who is free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: sems pa de'i rgyu ni mi dge ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sems pa de'i rgyu ni mi dge ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The cause of that volition is not only nonvirtuous,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i bdag nyid can lung du ma bstan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i bdag nyid can lung du ma bstan pa yang yin no //
translated: but also neutral, which is to say, the view of the self and the extreme view.

original: de ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can nyid kyang yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rgyu can nyid kyang yin mod kyi /
translated: That volition has a cause that is nonvirtuous and neutral.

original: de ni rgyu ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rgyu ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But that is stated with the intention of not abandoning its cause.

original: de'i rgyu lung du ma bstan pa yang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu lung du ma bstan pa yang spangs pa yin te /
translated: The neutral cause of that volition is abandoned,

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba yongs su gtugs te spangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba yongs su gtugs te spangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is abandoned by the limit of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam las yongs su nyams pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam las yongs su nyams pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because there is no complete degeneration from the path of seeing.

original: de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las skye ba yin te /
translated: It arises from improper mental attention.

original: de'i phyir mi dge ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dge ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement that the root of cyclic existence is the nonvirtuous root of attachment is made with the intention of referring to nonvirtuous states that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, such as attachment and so on.

original: de ji ltar ma spangs she na /
analyzed: de ji ltar ma spangs she na /
translated: How are they not abandoned?

original: de spangs pa las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de spangs pa las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they degenerate from abandoning them.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyus bsdus pa'i rgyu mi dge ba la @217b dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pas bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyus bsdus pa'i rgyu mi dge ba la @217b dgongs nas de skad du gsungs pas bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since the nonvirtuous states subsumed by the coemergent cause and the concomitant cause are referred to, there is no contradiction with the treatise.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu bshad zin to //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu bshad zin to //
translated: The all-pervading cause has been explained.

original: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is nonvirtuous.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de dag kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de dag kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung ste /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is only those.

original: de dag rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na'o zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na'o zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that they are only the cause of karmic maturation.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni zag pa med pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúwith-outflows‚Äù is mentioned in order to clarify the absence of outflows.

original: mi dge ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin pas de khyad par du ma byas so //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na yin pas de khyad par du ma byas so //
translated: Since nonvirtue is only with-outflows, it is not specified.

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu tha dad kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu tha dad kyang 'bras bu tha mi dad par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúand‚Äù is used to indicate that although the causes are different, the effect is not different.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag kho na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di dag kho na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are only these causes of karmic maturation and not others?

original: de'i phyir / rnam par smin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam par smin pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause they possess karmic maturation.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means because they have the nature of karmic maturation.

original: gzhan dag rnam par smin pa'i chos can nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dri ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag rnam par smin pa'i chos can nyid ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir dri ba ni /
translated: In order to show that other phenomena do not possess karmic maturation, the question is asked:

original: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Why is a neutral action not a ripening cause?

original: ji ltar sa bon rul ba dag gis mngon par brlan yang stobs chung ba'i phyir myu gu'i rgyu ma yin ba de bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sred pas mngon par brlan yang stobs chung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'iüîΩrgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon rul ba dag gis mngon par brlan yang stobs chung ba'i phyir myu gu'i rgyu ma yin ba de bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir sred pas mngon par brlan yang stobs chung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Just as a rotten seed, even though moistened, is not a cause of a sprout because it is weak, so too a neutral action, even though moistened by craving because it is contaminated, is not a cause of karmic maturation because it is weak.

original: yang ji ltar sa bon grung po chu dag gis mngon par ma brlan pa myu gu'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du zag pa med pa rnams kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir grung yang sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma
analyzed: yang ji ltar sa bon grung po chu dag gis mngon par ma brlan pa myu gu'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du zag pa med pa rnams kyang dge ba yin pa'i phyir grung yang sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma
translated: Just as a fresh seed, even though not moistened by water, is not a cause of a sprout because it is not moistened, so too uncontaminated states, even though fresh because they are virtuous, are not a cause of karmic maturation because they are not moistened by craving.

original: yin no // gcig ni rang gi nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: yin no // gcig ni rang gi nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: One is not a cause of karmic maturation because it lacks the capacity to generate karmic maturation.

original: cig shos ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The other is not a cause of karmic maturation because the conditions that are its collaborators are incomplete.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are not concomitant‚Äù is to be completed as follows:

original: rnam par smin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur na /
translated: Because karmic maturation is a phenomenon of the desire realm, and so on, it must be concomitant with the desire realm, and so on.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa ni rnam par smin pa dang ldan pa'i rgyur mi rung ste /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa ni rnam par smin pa dang ldan pa'i rgyur mi rung ste /
translated: But that which is not concomitant cannot be a cause of karmic maturation.

original: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no fixed cause.

original: lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe remaining‚Äù refers to nonvirtuous and contaminated states.

original: rnam pa gnyis @218a * //üîΩka yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis @218a * // ka yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are both.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyis grung po yin pa'i phyir rang gi nus pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid kyis grung po yin pa'i phyir rang gi nus pa dang ldan la /
translated: Because they are strong due to being virtuous and nonvirtuous, they possess their own power.

original: srid pas mngon par brlan pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pas mngon par brlan pa'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: And because they are moistened by the water of craving, they possess the conditions that are their collaborators.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ci zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ci zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: What is the cause of karmic maturation?

original: gal te rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dngos po sgrub pa yin na ni rnam par smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dngos po sgrub pa yin na ni rnam par smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: If the cause of karmic maturation is the establishment of a thing called karmic maturation, then karmic maturation is karmic maturation.

original: der ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes drug pa'i tshig bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: der ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu zhes drug pa'i tshig bsdu ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the compound cause of karmic maturation would be a genitive tatpurusa compound.

original: 'on te rnam par smin par bya bas na rnam par smin pa yin na ni 'di ni las su grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par smin par bya bas na rnam par smin pa yin na ni 'di ni las su grub pa yin te /
translated: But if karmic maturation is that which is to be matured, then it is established as karma.

original: der ni rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o zhes gzhi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: der ni rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o zhes gzhi mthun pa yin no //
translated: In that case, it is a karma that is the cause of karmic maturation, so it is the cause of karmic maturation.

original: des na cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dir nyes pa gang zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dir nyes pa gang zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the problem with that?

original: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin na ni /
translated: If it is the cause of karmic maturation,

original: mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur te /
translated: it would not be the case that the eye is derived from karmic maturation.

original: 'di ltar mig ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the eye is not derived from karmic maturation.

original: 'o na ci zhi na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhi na /
translated: What is it derived from?

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las te /
translated: from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: las las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is born from karma.

original: 'on te rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin na ni /
translated: But if the cause of karmic maturation is the cause of karmic maturation itself,

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be called the karmic maturation of karma.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: las ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: las ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because karma is the cause of karmic maturation,

original: rnam par smin pa yang las kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang las kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but karmic maturation is not the nature of karma.

original: gnyis ka ltar yang rung ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis ka ltar yang rung ngo zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: It was previously explained that both are correct.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'o zhes tshig bsdu na ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'o zhes tshig bsdu na ni /
translated: If the cause of karmic maturation is summarized as karmic maturation,

original: rgyu'i sgra mi mngon par byas pas mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgra mi mngon par byas pas mig rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: then the term cause is not expressed, but it is not contradictory to say that the eye is born from karmic maturation.

original: yang na rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin no zhes tshig bsdu na yang 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las la rnam par smin par 'gyur ba na /üîΩrnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam par smin pa nyid rgyu yin pas rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yin no zhes tshig bsdu na yang 'bras bu'i dus su phyin pa'i las la rnam par smin par 'gyur ba na / rnam par smin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When the cause has reached the time of the result, it is called karmic maturation.

original: de ltar na las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, it is not contradictory to say that the result of karmic maturation is karma.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa yin pas rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa yin pas rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o /
translated: The result is karmic maturation, therefore it is called karmic maturation.

original: rnam par smin par 'gyur bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin par 'gyur bas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not called karmic maturation because it is karmic maturation.

original: mi 'dra bar smin pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'dra bar smin pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Maturation is dissimilar

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The result of karmic maturation is a result dissimilar to its cause.

original: @218b 'di ltar rgyu ni mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dag yin la /
analyzed: @218b 'di ltar rgyu ni mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dag yin la /
translated: Thus the cause is nonvirtue and virtue contaminated,

original: 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: but the result is neutral, so it is dissimilar to its cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bshad pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu bshad pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is explained in terms of

original: 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa'i rgyu phung po gcig la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: The following should be stated: ‚ÄúIn the desire realm, the cause of karmic maturation is one aggregate,‚Äù and so on.

original: thos pa rnams dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir na phung po gcig go //
analyzed: thos pa rnams dang de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir na phung po gcig go //
translated: The obtainment of those and their birth and so on are subsumed by the aggregate of formation, thus they are one aggregate.

original: thob pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pas 'bras bu gcig go //
analyzed: thob pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi yang yin pas 'bras bu gcig go //
translated: The result of obtainment is also the result of their birth and so on, thus they are one result.

original: thob pa rnams ni thob pa dang ldan pa dang 'bras bu tha dad kyi /
analyzed: thob pa rnams ni thob pa dang ldan pa dang 'bras bu tha dad kyi /
translated: Obtainment and possession are different results.

original: mtshan nyid rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: But the characteristics are not,

original: mtshan gzhi dang gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are coemergent causes of the characterized basis.

original: phung po gnyis la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phung po gnyis la zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúIn two aggregates‚Äù means

original: lus dang ngag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni gzugs kyi phung po yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni gzugs kyi phung po yin no //
translated: virtuous and nonvirtuous physical and verbal karma are the form aggregate.

original: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po yin no //
translated: Their birth and so on are the aggregate of formation.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni gcig kho na yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni gcig kho na yin te /
translated: The body and speech karma and their arising, etc., have only one result, the result of conscious effort, because they are coemergent causes.

original: 'bras bu tha dad na ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad na ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the results were different, they would not be coemergent causes.

original: phung po gsum pa ni khams gsum na yang med de /
analyzed: phung po gsum pa ni khams gsum na yang med de /
translated: There is no third group in the three realms,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gdon mi za bar 'bras bu gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gdon mi za bar 'bras bu gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because minds and mental factors are necessarily the same result.

original: phung po bzhi la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phung po bzhi la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four aggregates are the dominant result of the three karmas.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba dag ni ci rigs par phung po bzhis bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba dag ni ci rigs par phung po bzhis bsdus pa yin la /
translated: The virtuous and nonvirtuous minds and mental factors are included in the four aggregates,

original: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa yin no //
translated: and their arising, etc., are included in the aggregate of formation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems med pas rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs mi srid pa'i phyir phung po lnga po ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems med pas rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs mi srid pa'i phyir phung po lnga po ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The five aggregates do not exist in the desire realm because form that is derived is impossible there, since there is no mind of meditative equipoise.

original: phung po bzhi po bzhi char gyi yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni gcig kho na'i yin gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po bzhi po bzhi char gyi yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni gcig kho na'i yin gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The ripened result of the four aggregates is the same for all four, but it is not different,

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are coemergent causes.

original: gzugs kyi khams na zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba la /
translated: In the form realm, the four aggregatesüîΩare the dominant result of the four.üîΩThe four aggregates are the dominant result of the four aggregates in the form realm.

original: thob pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: thob pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Obtainment of the form realm, along with birth and so on, and the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, along with birth and so on,

original: thob @219a * //
analyzed: thob @219a * //
translated: are the dominant result of the four aggregates.

original: pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir phung po gcig yin la /
analyzed: pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i phyir phung po gcig yin la /
translated: Obtainment and the two meditative attainments of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, along with their birth and so on, are included in the aggregate of formation.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi gnyis 'bras bu tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa yin no ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi gnyis 'bras bu tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu gcig pa yin no ;
translated: Because the characteristic and the basis of the characteristic are not different results, they are the same result.

original: / phung po gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / phung po gnyis pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second aggregate is

original: bsam gtan dang po kho na'i rnam par rig byed dge ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po kho na'i rnam par rig byed dge ba yin gyi /
translated: only the virtuous informative form of the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag gi ni ma yin te /üîΩde'i sa pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag gi ni ma yin te / de'i sa pa'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: It is not that of the second absorption and so on,

original: sa 'og ma pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kho na der mngon du byed pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kho na der mngon du byed pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: because it lacks investigation and analysis of its level and because it does not possess the unobscured neutral states of lower levels.

original: rnam par rig byed ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: It is the form aggregate.

original: de'i skye ba la sogs pha dag ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de'i skye ba la sogs pha dag ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: Its birth and so on are the formation aggregate.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nonmeditational states are

original: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi pa'o //
translated: four aggregates.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Meditational states areüîΩfive aggregates.

original: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir phung po lnga pa'o //üîΩgzugs med pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la de gzugs thams cad med pas phung po gcig pa'am /
analyzed: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir phung po lnga pa'o // gzugs med pa'i khams na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la de gzugs thams cad med pas phung po gcig pa'am /
translated: It is fivefold because it is associated with form.üîΩIn the formless realm, it is one aggregate or four aggregates,

original: bzhi pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bzhi pa yin gyi /
translated: because it is devoid of all form.

original: phung po gnyis pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po gnyis pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not two aggregates.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu de ni rnam pa dgu yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu de ni rnam pa dgu yin te /
translated: That cause of karmic maturation is ninefold,

original: khams gsum pan rim bzhin du rnam pa gsum dang / bzhi dang / gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: khams gsum pan rim bzhin du rnam pa gsum dang / bzhi dang / gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it is threefold in the three realms, fourfold in the fourth absorption, and twofold in the formless realm.

original: gang gi rnam par smin pa chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par smin pa chos kyi skye mched gcig kho na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: That which is the karmic maturation of one element of mental objects alone,

original: kha cig na re ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi 'bras bu kho na yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re ris mthun pa dang srog gi dbang po ni 'phen par byed pa'i las kyi 'bras bu kho na yin la /
translated: Some say: Homogeneity and the faculty of life force are the result of projecting karma alone.

original: gzhan dag ni gdon mi za bar 'phen par byed pa'i yin pa kho nar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gdon mi za bar 'phen par byed pa'i yin pa kho nar ma zad kyi /
translated: Others say: It is not definite that they are the result of projecting karma alone,

original: rdzogs par byed pa'i yang yin te /
analyzed: rdzogs par byed pa'i yang yin te /
translated: but they are also the result of completing karma.

original: de bas na srog gi dbang po gang gi rnam par smin pa yin pa de'i ni ris mthun pa dang de'i skye ba la sogs pa yang yin pas de'i rnam par smin pa ni chos kyi skye mched kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na srog gi dbang po gang gi rnam par smin pa yin pa de'i ni ris mthun pa dang de'i skye ba la sogs pa yang yin pas de'i rnam par smin pa ni chos kyi skye mched kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the faculty of life force is the maturational result of that action whose maturational result is the life force. The homogeneous collection of components and the birth of that life force are also the maturational result of that action. Thus, the life force is the maturational result of action and is included in the phenomena element alone.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kun du spyod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i srog gi dbang po mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kun du spyod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i srog gi dbang po mngon par 'dod de /
translated: Others believe that the faculty of life force is the basis for the occurrence of virtuous and afflicted minds in the formless realm.üîΩIn the desire and form realms, other sense spheres are also present in all states.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag na ni gnas skabs thams cad du skye mched gzhan dang @219b gzhan yang yod do zhes zer ro //üîΩgang gi yid kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gnyis te zhes bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩde la rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag na ni gnas skabs thams cad du skye mched gzhan dang @219b gzhan yang yod do zhes zer ro // gang gi yid kyi skye mched yin pa de'i ni gnyis te zhes bya ba 'byung ste / de la rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: The faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dang / de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The faculty of life force is the maturational result of action in the formless realm.üîΩThe

original: gang gi reg bya'i skye mched yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi reg bya'i skye mched yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same is true of the base of touch.

original: reg bya'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched de de'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched dang / chos kyi skye mched de de'i skye ba la sogs pa rnams chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The base of touch and the base of factors are included in the base of factors.

original: 'dir reg bya'i skye mched ni sems can du bgrang ba la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir reg bya'i skye mched ni sems can du bgrang ba la rig par bya'o //
translated: Here the base of touch should be understood as that which is counted as a sentient being.

original: gang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i gsum ste /
analyzed: gang gi lus kyi skye mched yin pa de'i gsum ste /
translated: One who has the base of body has three.

original: lus kyi skye mched ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi skye mched ni 'byung ba las gyur pa yin la /
translated: The base of body is derived from the elements.

original: de yang 'byung ba la ltos pa'i phyir lus kyi skye mched ni lus kyi skye mched 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can la mi ltos pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba la ltos pa'i phyir lus kyi skye mched ni lus kyi skye mched 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can la mi ltos pa mi srid do //
translated: Since it depends on the elements, it is impossible for the base of body to not depend on the base of body that is the nature of the elements.

original: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa rnams ni chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since their arising and so on are included in the base of factors.

original: gang gi dang dri dang ro'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi dang dri dang ro'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same is true of one who has the bases of smell and taste.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams las ni gang yang rung ba zhig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams las ni gang yang rung ba zhig go //
translated: The eye sense faculty is one of the sense spheres, i.e., the eye sense sphere.

original: de dag gi rten 'byung ba chen po dag ni reg bya'i skye mched do //
analyzed: de dag gi rten 'byung ba chen po dag ni reg bya'i skye mched do //
translated: The great elements that are its support are the sense sphere of tangibility.

original: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa dag ni chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba la sogs pa dag ni chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: Its birth, etc., are the sense sphere of factors.

original: mig ni lus la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dang ; 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: mig ni lus la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir dang ; 'byung ba la brten pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir na /
translated: The eye sense faculty is not confused with regard to the body, because it is supported on the great elements, and because it is not confused with regard to the characteristics of birth, etc.

original: gang gi rnam par smin pa mig gi skye mched yin pa'i de'i skye mched bzhi yin no //
analyzed: gang gi rnam par smin pa mig gi skye mched yin pa'i de'i skye mched bzhi yin no //
translated: One who has the eye sense sphere as his retribution has four sense spheres.

original: gang gi rna ba dang sna dang lce'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi rna ba dang sna dang lce'i skye mched dag yin pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same holds for one who has the ear, nose, and tongue sense spheres.

original: de dag gi tshul yang mig gi dbang po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de dag gi tshul yang mig gi dbang po dang 'dra ste /
translated: Their method is like that of the eye sense faculty.

original: de dag kyang 'byung ba chen po la brten pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / lus kyi skye mched la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'byung ba chen po la brten pa'i phyir dang / skye ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / lus kyi skye mched la rag las te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also called sense bases because they are based on the great elements, because they possess origination, etc., and because they function in dependence on the sense base of the body.

original: bcu gcig ni sgra ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcu gcig ni sgra ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: Eleven are not sound,

original: de ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sound is not a karmic maturation.

original: yang las 'ga' zhig rnam par smin pa skye mched gcig rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang las 'ga' zhig rnam par smin pa skye mched gcig rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
translated: What is the reason that some karmic maturation is the single sense base of form,

original: 'ga' zhig gi bcu gcig smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa la rgyu cu yod ce na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi bcu gcig smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa la rgyu cu yod ce na /
translated: and some is the eleven?

original: de'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu sna tshogs pa dang / sna tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩphyi'i sa bon ltar @220a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu sna tshogs pa dang / sna tshogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te / phyi'i sa bon ltar @220a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause the result of karma is diverse and not diverse.‚Äù

original: nang gi las kyi sa bon yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi las kyi sa bon yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The internal seeds of karma should be understood to be like external seeds.

original: 'di ltar pad ma'i sa bon rnams rtsa ba dang / myu gu dang / lo ma dang / sdong bu dang / ge sar dang / ze'u 'bru dang / lte ba sna tshogs pa yin pa dang / shing n+ya gro dha la sogs pa sdong bu dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar pad ma'i sa bon rnams rtsa ba dang / myu gu dang / lo ma dang / sdong bu dang / ge sar dang / ze'u 'bru dang / lte ba sna tshogs pa yin pa dang / shing n+ya gro dha la sogs pa sdong bu dang /
translated: Thus, lotus seeds have various roots, sprouts, leaves, stems, anthers, pistils, and centers, and trees such as nyagrodhas have many trunks, branches, twigs, leaves, sprouts, flowers, and fruits.

original: yal ga dang / lcug ma dang / lo ma dang / lo ma phran dang / myu gu dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu du ma dang ldan pa dag sprin ltar spyod par snang ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: yal ga dang / lcug ma dang / lo ma dang / lo ma phran dang / myu gu dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu du ma dang ldan pa dag sprin ltar spyod par snang ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as they appear to be like clouds,

original: nas dang gro la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nas dang gro la sogs pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: but barley, wheat, and so on are not.

original: las dus gcig pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: las dus gcig pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Karma that is simultaneous with its resultüîΩThe Abhidharmakosa states, Karma that is simultaneous with its result is not past or future.

original: las 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no //üîΩlas dus gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no // las dus gnyis pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Karma that is past, present, or future

original: 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i ma 'ongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i ma 'ongs pa ma yin no //
translated: Karma that is past, present, or future is not simultaneous with its result.

original: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: The cause of that is stated.

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur bar 'od ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur bar 'od ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because the effect would be too small in comparison with the cause.

original: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reverse is not the case.

original: las skad cig ma du ma'i rnam par smin pa skad cig gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: las skad cig ma du ma'i rnam par smin pa skad cig gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: The maturation of many moments of action is not a single moment,

original: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu bas 'bras bu ha cang nyung bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect would be too small in comparison with the cause.

original: rnam par smin pa ni las dang lhan cig tu rnam par smin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni las dang lhan cig tu rnam par smin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the maturation of action occur simultaneously with the action,

original: lhan cig skyes pa la ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gnyis byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa la ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gnyis byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two causes‚Äîthe co-existent cause and the associated cause‚Äîwould be simultaneous.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi 'dra bar smin pa la ltos te rnam par gzhag na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni mi 'dra bar smin pa la ltos te rnam par gzhag na /
translated: The maturation cause is established as a cause in dependence on a maturation that is dissimilar.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshogs pas bsdus pas ni mi 'dra bar smin pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i tshogs pas bsdus pas ni mi 'dra bar smin pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But there is no dissimilar maturation in the case of a collection of wholesome and unwholesome actions.

original: mjug thogs su yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mjug thogs su yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nor does the maturation of action occur immediately after the action,üîΩbecause the effect would be too small in comparison with the cause.

original: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin pa ma yin te zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin pa ma yin te zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot a ripened effect‚Äù is supplied from the context.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is drawn out by the immediately preceding condition.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i 'jug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid kyis drangs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i 'jug thogs kyi skad cig ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid kyis drangs pa yin gyi /
translated: The moment that follows the operation of the cause of a ripened effect is drawn out by the immediately preceding condition,

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: not by the cause of a ripened effect.

original: de'i mjug thogs su dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su dge ba dang mi dge ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a wholesome or unwholesome moment can arise immediately after a ripened effect.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom a cause of a ripened effect‚Äù means that

original: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa ni de dang lhan cig tu smin pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par smin pa ni de dang lhan cig tu smin pa ma yin zhing /
translated: a ripened effect does not ripen simultaneously with that cause,

original: mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mjug thogs su yang ma yin te /
translated: nor does it immediately follow that cause.

original: rgyun yongs @220b su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa dag dus yongs su chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun yongs @220b su 'gyur ba'i khyad par las skye ba'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa dag dus yongs su chad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a ripened effect arises from a special transformation of the continuum and because the time of a ripened effect is fixed.

original: 'di dag gi dus nges pa don gyis ni bshad mod kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di dag gi dus nges pa don gyis ni bshad mod kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The time of these is definitely explained by the meaning, but not by the words.

original: don gyis ni bshad mod kyi sgra'i sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gyis ni bshad mod kyi sgra'i sgo nas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is explained, but not by the words.

original: smras pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: smras pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of explanation:

original: rang gi sgras mngon par brjod pa dang / don gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sgras mngon par brjod pa dang / don gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: explanation by one's own words and explanation by the meaning.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
translated: It is said, Whatever co-arises is the effect of each other,

original: zhes bye brag med par brjod pas de ni dus gsum pa yin no zhes bya bar don gyis bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bye brag med par brjod pas de ni dus gsum pa yin no zhes bya bar don gyis bshad do //
translated: without distinction. Therefore, by the meaning, it is explained that it is of the three times.

original: sngar skyes rnams zhes brjod pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: sngar skyes rnams zhes brjod pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Since it is said arisen previously, it is explained that it is a homogeneous cause of past and present.

original: sems dang sems byung rten mtshungs rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung rten mtshungs rnams //
translated: Since it is said mind and mental factors with a similar basis,

original: zhes bye brag med par brjod pas dus gsum pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bye brag med par brjod pas dus gsum pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: without distinction, it is explained that it is of the three times.

original: kun 'gro snga zhes brjod pas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: kun 'gro snga zhes brjod pas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin no zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Since it is said pervading, earlier, it is explained that it is past and present.

original: mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
translated: and nonvirtuous and contaminated virtuous actions.

original: zhes bye brag med par brjod pas de ni dus gsum pa yin no zhes bya bar don gyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bye brag med par brjod pas de ni dus gsum pa yin no zhes bya bar don gyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since it is stated without distinction, it is implicitly explained that it exists in the three times.üîΩThe causal condition is stated without distinction:

original: rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu //
translated: The active cause is a cause other than itself.

original: zhes bye brag med par brjod pas byed rgyu dus gsum pa dang / dus las rnam par grol ba yin par don gyis bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bye brag med par brjod pas byed rgyu dus gsum pa dang / dus las rnam par grol ba yin par don gyis bshad do //
translated: Since it is stated without distinction, it is implicitly explained that the active cause exists in the three times and is free from time.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here the reason is stated:

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it possesses a result that is a natural outflow.

original: de yang ma 'ongs pa la mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang ma 'ongs pa la mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is illogical that it exists in the future.

original: snga phyi med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: snga phyi med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is not earlier or later.

original: phan tshun rgyu mthun pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgsum po dag ni dus gsum pa //üîΩgsum po dag ni dus gsum pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu mthun pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gsum po dag ni dus gsum pa // gsum po dag ni dus gsum pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: And because it would follow that it would be a natural outflow of each other.üîΩThe three are in the three times.üîΩThe three are only in the three times.

original: gsum po dag kho na dus gsum pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gsum po dag kho na dus gsum pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The three are not only in the three times.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang dus gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang dus gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the active cause is also a cause of the three times.

original: de yang dus gsum pa kho na'o zhes bya bar ni nges par mi gzung ste /
analyzed: de yang dus gsum pa kho na'o zhes bya bar ni nges par mi gzung ste /
translated: Moreover, it is not ascertained that it is only of the three times.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is both conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: Because of that very fact.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni dus nges pa ma bstan pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni dus nges pa ma bstan pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The active cause is not taught to be restricted to a specific time.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ltos te 'jug pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun ltos te 'jug pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: Because cause and effect operate in mutual dependence, the question is asked:

original: rgyu de dag gang gi yin pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas @221a * //üîΩpar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu de dag gang gi yin pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas @221a * // par 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúWhich are the effects of which causes?‚Äù

original: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Conditioned and unconditioned are effects.

original: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma gtogs pa /
translated: Except for space and nonanalytical cessation,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gzhan thams cad ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gzhan thams cad ni 'bras bu yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: all other conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are effects.

original: nam mkha' bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha' bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Space is an effect because it is not an action and is not obtained.

original: rkyen ma tshang bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yang 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa yang 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: and because it is obtained due to the incompleteness of conditions, the cessation not due to deliberation is also not a result.

original: de ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa dang / 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ltar lam gyis thob pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin pa dang / 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ltar lam gyis thob pa ma yin na /
translated: It is not obtained by the path like cessation due to deliberation, because it is not something that is directly desired and it is not something that is accomplished through effort.üîΩThe treatise states that it is to be accomplished, as it is extensively stated in the treatise:

original: de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos smras pa ni bstan bcos las 'bras bu'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos smras pa ni bstan bcos las 'bras bu'i chos rnams gang zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: What are the resultant phenomena?

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then there would be no cause without a result

original: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu 'am /üîΩrgyu med pa'i 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu 'am / rgyu med pa'i 'bras bu med de /
translated: or result without a cause,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because causes and results are mutually dependent.

original: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, because unconditioned states are causes, they would be results that have causes.üîΩIf you say that unconditioned states are results,üîΩthen they would also be causes.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de gang gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is an effect, it would also be a cause of that.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be,

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas kho na la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: because it is only conditioned phenomena that are causes and effects.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mtshungs bzhin du 'dus byas kho na la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod kyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mtshungs bzhin du 'dus byas kho na la rgyu dang 'bras bu dag yod kyi /
translated: Although they are similar in being the state of cause and effect, only conditioned phenomena are causes and effects.üîΩUnconditioned phenomena are not.

original: 'dus ma byas la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la de la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la de la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: de'i phyir / rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúBecause the six types of cause are impossible and because the effect is impossible.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'di la rgyu rnam pa drug med la /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu rnam pa drug med la /
translated: The six types of cause do not exist in unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'di la 'bras bu yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu yang med de /
translated: Nor do effects exist in unconditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byung bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are unconditioned and because it is contradictory for them to originate.

original: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi rigs pa rgyas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi rigs pa rgyas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The reason why the characteristics of cause and effect are illogical should be extensively explained.

original: de la byed rgyu'i rgyu yang mi srid de /
analyzed: de la byed rgyu'i rgyu yang mi srid de /
translated: In this regard, the efficient cause is also impossible.

original: de ni skye bzhin pa la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor bzhag na /
analyzed: de ni skye bzhin pa la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor bzhag na /
translated: If it is posited as the nature of not obstructing that which is arising,

original: 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then unconditioned states do not arise.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa phan tshun rgyu dang / 'bras bu dngos po yin pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i @221b rgyu yang mi srid do //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa phan tshun rgyu dang / 'bras bu dngos po yin pa'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i @221b rgyu yang mi srid do //
translated: Also, it is impossible for them to be coemergent causes, because things that possess arising are mutually cause and effect.

original: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir sngar skyes pa med pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir sngar skyes pa med pas skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang mi srid do //
translated: Also, it is impossible for them to be homogeneous causes, because unconditioned states do not arise and they do not arise earlier.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang med do //
translated: Also, they are not conjoined causes, because they are not by nature mind and mental factors.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang med do //
translated: Also, they are not omnipresent causes, because they are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that views suffering and so on.

original: 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang mi srid do /
