analyzed: 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang mi srid do /
translated: Also, it is impossible for them to be the cause of karmic maturation.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not conjoined and because they are permanent.

original: gzhan yang rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the ripened result is neutral,

original: bral ba ni dge ba yin pas 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: bral ba ni dge ba yin pas 'di la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: but separation is virtuous. Therefore, it has no ripened cause.

original: de ltar na rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the six types of cause are impossible, unconditioned states are not results.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pa'i phyir yang 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pa'i phyir yang 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu med do zhes ston to //
translated: It is also taught that unconditioned states have no result because the five types of result are impossible.

original: 'di ltar 'dus ma byas la bdag po'i 'bras bu ni mi srid do /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus ma byas la bdag po'i 'bras bu ni mi srid do /
translated: Thus, the dominant result is impossible for unconditioned states.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: The dominant result

original: sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
analyzed: sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //
translated: is not a prior state.

original: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
translated: A conditioned state is the dominant result of a conditioned state.

original: zhes lhan cig 'byung ba dang / phyis 'byung bar 'dod na /
analyzed: zhes lhan cig 'byung ba dang / phyis 'byung bar 'dod na /
translated: If it is asserted that the dominant result is either coemergent or arises later,

original: de ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: it does not possess arising.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang mi srid do /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang mi srid do /
translated: The result of natural outflow is also impossible.

original: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Natural outflow is similar to its cause.

original: zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The unconditioned does not possess arising.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu 'ang mi srid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu 'ang mi srid de /
translated: Therefore the effect of conscious effort is also impossible.

original: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir skyes bu'i rtsal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir skyes bu'i rtsal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the unconditioned does not possess arising, it does not have the power of conscious effort.

original: 'di la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang mi rung ste /
translated: The effect of separation is also impossible here,

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni mi dge ba dang dge ba zag ba dang bcas pas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni mi dge ba dang dge ba zag ba dang bcas pas bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect of separation is generated by nonvirtue and virtue that is contaminated.

original: lam gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir na 'di la bral ba'i 'bras bu yang mi srid de /
analyzed: lam gyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir na 'di la bral ba'i 'bras bu yang mi srid de /
translated: The effect of separation is not possible here, because it is not the nature of the path.

original: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That is the effect of the uninterrupted paths.

original: gzhan yang dus las grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir yang 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus las grol ba la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir yang 'bras bu med de /
translated: Moreover, the effect does not exist because that which is free from time does not have the power to hold or give an effect.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lnga ni da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
analyzed: lnga ni da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
translated: Five hold the effect in the present.

original: zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes rgyas par gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: ci'i phyir lam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Why is it called a ‚Äúpath‚Äù?

original: de ni dngos por 'byung ba la byed pa dang bral ba kho na yin par 'dod do snyam pa ni 'dri ba'i bsams pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar de @222a * //
analyzed: de ni dngos por 'byung ba la byed pa dang bral ba kho na yin par 'dod do snyam pa ni 'dri ba'i bsams pa'o // 'di ltar de @222a * //
translated: The thought of the questioner is that it is asserted that it is just the absence of activity with respect to the arising of things.

original: ni skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ni skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, it is the state of not obstructing the arising of that.

original: gang zhig skye bzhin pa gang zhig la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa de ni de'i byed rgyu'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig skye bzhin pa gang zhig la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa de ni de'i byed rgyu'i rgyu yin na /
translated: If something is the state of not obstructing the arising of something that is arising, it is the active cause of that.

original: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni skye ba dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: But unconditioned states do not possess arising.

original: de'i phyir lam 'di'i byed rgyu'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam 'di'i byed rgyu'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not active causes of this path.

original: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //üîΩzhes bya ba 'dir bral ba 'bras bu'i ngo bor grags pas de'i phyir da ni de gang gi 'am zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩgal te lam 'di'i byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'dod na'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin // zhes bya ba 'dir bral ba 'bras bu'i ngo bor grags pas de'i phyir da ni de gang gi 'am zhes bya ba smras te / gal te lam 'di'i byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'dod na'o //
translated: The Abhidharmako≈õa declares, ‚ÄúThe conditioned and cessation are results.‚Äù

original: yang na de'i rgyur mi 'dod na ji ltar de 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na de'i rgyur mi 'dod na ji ltar de 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: Since it is well known that cessation is the nature of a result, therefore it is said here, ‚ÄúIf it is not asserted that this path is the active cause of that cessation, or if it is not asserted that it is the cause of that, how is it a result?‚Äù

original: de gang gi 'bras bu yin zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni /
analyzed: de gang gi 'bras bu yin zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni /
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúWhose effect is it?‚Äù

original: lam gyi 'bras bu yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúWhose result is it?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is the result of the path.‚Äù

original: yang ji ltar na 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba de'i lan ni de'i stobs kyis thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba de'i lan ni de'i stobs kyis thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúHow is it the result?‚Äù is ‚ÄúBecause it is obtained by the power of the path.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'dus ma byas lam gyi stobs kyis 'thob ba de'i phyir 'dus ma byas lam gyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus ma byas lam gyi stobs kyis 'thob ba de'i phyir 'dus ma byas lam gyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Since the unconditioned is obtained by the power of the path, the unconditioned is the result of the path.

original: de ltar na lam byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lam byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus the path is not the active cause of the unconditioned.

original: 'o na ni de lam gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir lam de thob pa de kho na la nus pa'i phyir thob pa kho na lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni de lam gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir lam de thob pa de kho na la nus pa'i phyir thob pa kho na lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi /
translated: Objection: But if the unconditioned is the result of the path because it arises by the power of the path, then only the obtainment of the path is the result of the path, because it is capable of being obtained by the power of the path.

original: bral ba ni lam gyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: bral ba ni lam gyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: The unconditioned is not the result of the path,

original: de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not capable of being obtained by the power of the path.

original: de'i phyir lam mya ngan las 'das pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam mya ngan las 'das pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the path does not function in nirvana, nirvana is not the result of the path.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid 'gag pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la yang nus pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir thob pa la yang nus pa gzhan la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid 'gag pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa la yang nus pa yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir thob pa la yang nus pa gzhan la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: And nirvana has the power to stop the non-result, i.e., the entire self.

original: thob pa la ni byed pa po nyid kyis nus pa yin te /
analyzed: thob pa la ni byed pa po nyid kyis nus pa yin te /
translated: Obtainment has power over the agent,

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir myu gu la sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir myu gu la sa bon bzhin no //
translated: because it is a homogeneous cause, like a seed in relation to a sprout.

original: bral ba la ni thob par byed pa nyid kyis nus pa yin te /
analyzed: bral ba la ni thob par byed pa nyid kyis nus pa yin te /
translated: Freedom has power over the one who obtains,

original: lam med par ni bral ba mi 'thob po //
analyzed: lam med par ni bral ba mi 'thob po //
translated: because without the path, one does not obtain freedom.

original: de lta bas na re zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta bas na re zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Therefore, the root text states,

original: rgyu rnams ni dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir lam ni ji ltar yang bral ba'i rgyu ma yin gyi bral ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir lam ni ji ltar yang bral ba'i rgyu ma yin gyi bral ba ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Since causes are the reason for the arising of things, the path is not in any way the cause of freedom. Freedom is its result.

original: yang mya ngan las 'das pa rgyu med pa rgyur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang mya ngan las 'das pa rgyu med pa rgyur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can nirvana, which is without cause, be a cause?

original: 'jig rten na mngon par 'dod pa'i don nus pas thob pa dag la 'bras bu zhes bya bar grags la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na mngon par 'dod pa'i don nus pas thob pa dag la 'bras bu zhes bya bar grags la /
translated: In the world, that which is renowned as the result of a cause is the attainment of a desired object through the power of that cause.

original: mya ngan las @222b 'das pa de yang 'phags pa'i lam gyi nus pas 'thob pas de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las @222b 'das pa de yang 'phags pa'i lam gyi nus pas 'thob pas de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: And since nirvana is attained through the power of the arya path, it is called the result of the path.

original: rgyu med pa nyid ni de thob par bya ba la 'phags pa'i lam rgyu drug po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid ni de thob par bya ba la 'phags pa'i lam rgyu drug po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not causeless, because the six causes of the arya path are the cause of attaining it.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa kho na yid la bzhag nas lam bsgom pa la 'jug gi de'i thob pa ba yid la bzhag nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa kho na yid la bzhag nas lam bsgom pa la 'jug gi de'i thob pa ba yid la bzhag nas ni ma yin te /
translated: One engages in the cultivation of the path by taking nirvana itself as the object, not by taking the obtainment of nirvana as the object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid gtsor lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi de'i thob pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid gtsor lam gyi 'bras bu yin gyi de'i thob pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, nirvana itself is the primary result of the path, not the obtainment of nirvana.

original: lam ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path does not engage in the obtainment of nirvana.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis spangs pa kho na dge sbyong gi 'bras bur gsungs kyi spangs pa'i thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis spangs pa kho na dge sbyong gi 'bras bur gsungs kyi spangs pa'i thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For that reason, the Bhagavan stated that only abandonment is the result of training, not the obtainment of abandonment.

original: yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yang med na go zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Also, if dominant results do not exist, then the phrase ‚Äúthe five causes are causes of the dominant result‚Äù would be meaningless.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di la bdag po'i 'bras bu khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di la bdag po'i 'bras bu khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Since it is the active cause, the dominant result should be accepted as the result of that cause.

original: de khas mi len na byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de khas mi len na byed rgyu'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa dang 'gal lo //
translated: If it is not accepted, then it would contradict the assertion that it is an active cause.

original: 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction,

original: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bos byed rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bos byed rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is an active cause by the nature of not obstructing the arising of other things.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba la 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / 'dzin pa nges pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa da ltar dus dang bral ba la de'i nus pa med pas 'di la 'bras bu mi 'dod do //üîΩ'di la 'bras bu yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba la 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / 'dzin pa nges pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa da ltar dus dang bral ba la de'i nus pa med pas 'di la 'bras bu mi 'dod do // 'di la 'bras bu yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Since it is definite that past and present states yield results and hold results, it is asserted that future states do not have the ability to yield results, because they are free from the present time.

original: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
analyzed: lnga po da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
translated: The five causes are causes of the dominant result.

original: gnyis ni 'byin par byed pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis ni 'byin par byed pa yin //
translated: Two are causes of the result of conscious effort.

original: zhes dus kyis bsdus pa kho na la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa bshad na /
analyzed: zhes dus kyis bsdus pa kho na la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa bshad na /
translated: If it is explained that only that subsumed by time holds or produces results,

original: 'dus ma byas la ni da ltar ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'dzin pa mi srid la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni da ltar ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'dzin pa mi srid la /
translated: then it is impossible for the unconditioned to hold a result because it does not exist in the present.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'byin pa mi srid do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'byin pa mi srid do //
translated: And it is impossible for it to produce a result because it does not exist in the past or present.

original: de'i phyir 'di la dngos kyi rtog pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag med mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la dngos kyi rtog pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag med mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, in reality, cause and effect do not exist in the unconditioned.

original: 'on kyang btags pa'i rtog pas rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid du bsnyad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang btags pa'i rtog pas rgyu nyid dang 'bras bu nyid du bsnyad do //
translated: But they are called cause and effect by nominal thought.

original: rgyu ma yin no zhes ni rnam grangs kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin no zhes ni rnam grangs kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha said that it is not a cause in a certain sense,

original: don gyis gsungs kyi sgra ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gyis gsungs kyi sgra ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but he did not say it in terms of words.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes 'dir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen ma lus par smos pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang khyad par med par mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir rgyu rtag pa @223a * //üîΩmed do zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag yin pa dang rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes 'dir gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen ma lus par smos pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang khyad par med par mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir rgyu rtag pa @223a * // med do zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because this passage mentions all the causes and conditions of form and so on, and because they are established as impermanent without distinction, it is said that there is no permanent cause.üîΩIf that is so, then the Abhidharmikas say:

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes zer ba ni chos mngon pa pa ste byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes zer ba ni chos mngon pa pa ste byed rgyu'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only would it not be the active cause,

original: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa'i rkyen du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: but it also would not be the objective condition of consciousness,

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams bye brag med par mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams bye brag med par mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because causes and conditions are established as impermanent without distinction.

original: mdo sde pa na re skyed pa'i zhes bkar ba'i phyir 'gyur te /üîΩgang dag rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa tsam yin la /
analyzed: mdo sde pa na re skyed pa'i zhes bkar ba'i phyir 'gyur te /üîΩgang dag rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa tsam yin la /
translated: Sautrantikas say: It would be so if it were stated to be a producer.üîΩBut it is not stated to be a producer.

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de dag rtag pa nyid du mi 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de dag rtag pa nyid du mi 'gal lo zhes zer ro //
translated: But it is not contradictory for that which is not a producer to be permanent.

original: chos mngon pa pa na re rgyu rnams kyang de kho na ltar yin te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa na re rgyu rnams kyang de kho na ltar yin te /
translated: The Abhidharma masters say: Causes are just like that.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu thams cad ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu thams cad ni skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes zer ro //
translated: For it has been demonstrated that not all efficient causes are producers.

original: rkyen ni bzhi po zhes bya ba'i mdo de las dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi /
analyzed: rkyen ni bzhi po zhes bya ba'i mdo de las dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi /
translated: In the sutra that states that there are four conditions, the objective condition is stated.

original: ma bsgribs pa'i rgyu yin par ni mdo gang las kyang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i rgyu yin par ni mdo gang las kyang ma gsungs so //
translated: But nowhere in the sutras is it stated that unobscured neutral states are causes.

original: yang na mdo las 'dus ma byas dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi /
analyzed: yang na mdo las 'dus ma byas dmigs pa'i rkyen yin par gsungs kyi /
translated: Or else, in the sutras it is stated that unconditioned states are objective conditions.

original: ma bsgribs pa'i rgyu yin par ni ma gsungs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa'i rgyu yin par ni ma gsungs so zhes bya ste /
translated: But it is not stated that they are unobscured neutral states.

original: de'i phyir mdo las 'dus ma byas rgyu'i dngos por mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las 'dus ma byas rgyu'i dngos por mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore unconditioned states are not established as things that are causes.

original: mdo rnams kyang phal cher nub na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo rnams kyang phal cher nub na zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sutras have mostly disappeared.

original: rtsa ba'i bsdu ba nyams pa sems la bzhag nas de skad du smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bsdu ba nyams pa sems la bzhag nas de skad du smras pa yin no //
translated: This is said because the root collection has deteriorated.

original: mdo nub kyang bkag pa'i phyir mdo gzhan las ma gsungs par shes la /
analyzed: mdo nub kyang bkag pa'i phyir mdo gzhan las ma gsungs par shes la /
translated: and the sutra also refutes the existence of a self, it is understood that it does not teach the existence of a self.

original: ma bkag kyang mdo ma lus par rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes bya bar rtogs par nus kyi /
analyzed: ma bkag kyang mdo ma lus par rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes bya bar rtogs par nus kyi /
translated: Even if it does not refute the existence of a self, it is understood that it does not teach the existence of a self because it does not teach all the sutras.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that it does not teach the existence of a self because it does not teach the existence of a self.

original: de lta bas na ma bkag pa'i phyir dang rtsa ba'i bsdus pa nyams pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes nges par gzung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma bkag pa'i phyir dang rtsa ba'i bsdus pa nyams pa'i phyir ma gsungs so zhes nges par gzung bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it cannot be ascertained that it does not teach the existence of a self because it does not refute the existence of a self and because it would undermine the root compendium.

original: gzhan na re skyed par byed pa'i zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan na re skyed par byed pa'i zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Another says: Because it says ‚Äúthat which generates,‚Äù

original: 'di las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus ma byas rgyu nyid dang rkyen nyid du mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di las bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus ma byas rgyu nyid dang rkyen nyid du mtshon pa yin te /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn indicates that unconditioned states are causes and conditions.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di skad du gzugs kyi rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin na zhes gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di skad du gzugs kyi rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa de dag kyang mi rtag pa yin na zhes gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: Otherwise, he would have said, ‚ÄúThose that are the causes and conditions of form are impermanent.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas rgyur gyur pa yod cing /üîΩrkyen du gyur pa yod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus ma byas rgyur gyur pa yod cing /üîΩrkyen du gyur pa yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, unconditioned states exist as causes and conditions.

original: 'ga' zhig skyes par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig skyes par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not all causes are productive causes.

original: rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of causes:üîΩthe productive cause and the cause that does not create an obstacle.

original: skyed par @223b byed pa dang / 'gal bar mi byed pa'o zhes 'di ni byed rgyu'i rgyu bsam par bshad zin to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyed par @223b byed pa dang / 'gal bar mi byed pa'o zhes 'di ni byed rgyu'i rgyu bsam par bshad zin to zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the way the efficient cause should be understood.

original: yang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang bral ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: What is this disconnection?

original: rab tu grags pa'i don gyis ma grags pa'i don nges par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i don gyis ma grags pa'i don nges par byed pa yin na /
translated: If the meaning of a word that is well known in the world is not well known, then the meaning of a word that is not well known in the world is ascertained by the meaning of a word that is well known.

original: 'dir gnyis ka yang don ma grags pa yin pas phan tshun bsten par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir gnyis ka yang don ma grags pa yin pas phan tshun bsten par 'gyur te /
translated: But in this case, the meaning of both words is not well known, so they are mutually dependent,

original: rta dang bres bzhin no //
analyzed: rta dang bres bzhin no //
translated: like a cripple and his wife.

original: 'dir de'i rang gi ngo bo ni 'phags pa rnams kho bos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir de'i rang gi ngo bo ni 'phags pa rnams kho bos zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the intrinsic nature of that is known by the noble ones.

original: 'di ni lung gis rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni lung gis rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes ston to //
translated: This is to be understood through scriptural authority.

original: mdo sde pa rnams na re so so'i brtags pas 'gog pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams na re so so'i brtags pas 'gog pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The Sautrantikas say: Not only is the cessation due to deliberation a non-thing,

original: 'dus ma byas thams cad rdzas su med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas thams cad rdzas su med do zhes zer ro //
translated: but all unconditioned things are non-things.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la /üîΩji ltar gzugs ni tshor ba la sogs pa dag las dngos po gzhan yin zhing /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la / ji ltar gzugs ni tshor ba la sogs pa dag las dngos po gzhan yin zhing /
translated: Like form, feeling, etc.üîΩJust as form is a different entity from feeling, etc.,üîΩand feeling, etc., are different entities from form,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang gzugs las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du 'dus ma byas ni /üîΩ'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dag kyang gzugs las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du 'dus ma byas ni / 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: so too unconditioned states are different entities from each other.

original: phan tshun las dngos po gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun las dngos po gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Or, unconditioned states are different entities from conditioned states.

original: de'i phyir rdzas su med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas su med do //
translated: Therefore, they do not substantially exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then do they exist as?

original: reg bya med pa tsam ni nam mkha' yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: reg bya med pa tsam ni nam mkha' yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Space is the mere absence of form.

original: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dngos po gzhan dang gzhan dgag par bya ba'i phyir te /üîΩreg bya snga na med pa 'am /
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dngos po gzhan dang gzhan dgag par bya ba'i phyir te / reg bya snga na med pa 'am /
translated: The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe mere absence of form‚Äù refutes that space is a different entity from form.

original: zhig nas med pa la /
analyzed: zhig nas med pa la /
translated: Space is the mere absence of form that existed previously or the mere absence of form that will arise later.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya bar gdags so //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya bar gdags so //
translated: Space is designated as the mere absence of form.

original: 'di ltar mun pa'i nang dag na zhes bya bas ni de gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mun pa'i nang dag na zhes bya bas ni de gzhung 'dzugs par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the midst of darkness‚Äù in the root text establishes the context for this discussion.

original: ma rnyed na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rnyed na zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif you do not find it‚Äù means

original: ma phrad na nam mkha'o zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: ma phrad na nam mkha'o zhes 'dzer to //
translated: if you do not contact it, then it is space.

original: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa 'gags nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa 'gags nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen negative tendencies and birth that have arisen cease‚Äù is an extensive explanation.

original: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa rnams 'gags nas so //
analyzed: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa rnams 'gags nas so //
translated: When negative tendencies and birth that have arisen cease,

original: rkyen gzhan ma tshang bas kyang mi skye bas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan ma tshang bas kyang mi skye bas de'i phyir so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: they do not arise due to the incompleteness of other conditions. Therefore, it says, ‚Äúdue to the power of analytical discrimination.‚Äù

original: phra rgyas dang skye ba gzhan mi skye ba'i so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phra rgyas dang skye ba gzhan mi skye ba'i so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nonarising of other negative tendencies and birth is called analytical cessation.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, it is taught:

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The element of nirvana that is with remainder and without remainder is analytical cessation.

original: 'di ltar bden pa gnyis 'gags pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bden pa gnyis 'gags pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cessation of the two truths is analytical cessation.

original: de la phra rgyas ni kun 'byung gi bden pa @224a * //
analyzed: de la phra rgyas ni kun 'byung gi bden pa @224a * //
translated: In this context, negative tendencies are the truth of origin,

original: yin la / skye ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yin la / skye ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: and birth is the truth of suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sa bon 'gags nas rgyu med pas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa skyes pa dang 'gal ba'i rten thob pas nyon mongs pa phra rgyas 'dod chags la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa mi skye ba ni nyon mongsüîΩpa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sa bon 'gags nas rgyu med pas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa skyes pa dang 'gal ba'i rten thob pas nyon mongs pa phra rgyas 'dod chags la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa mi skye ba ni nyon mongs pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Afflictive obstructions are the nonarising of future subtle and pervasive afflictions such as attachment due to obtaining a basis that is incompatible with the generation of afflictions through the power of analytical cessation.

original: de bzhin du skye ba da ltar ba 'gag pa dang so sor brtags pa'i stobs nyid kyis yang srid pa'i skye bar mtshams mi sbyor zhing mi skye ba ni skye ba 'gog pa yin no //üîΩdper na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba da ltar ba 'gag pa dang so sor brtags pa'i stobs nyid kyis yang srid pa'i skye bar mtshams mi sbyor zhing mi skye ba ni skye ba 'gog pa yin no // dper na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Similarly, the cessation of birth is the nonarising of birth that does not link to birth in a subsequent existence through the power of analytical cessation alone.

original: so sor brtags pa med pa kho nar rkyen zas la sogs pa ma tshang bas bar ma dor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa med pa kho nar rkyen zas la sogs pa ma tshang bas bar ma dor 'chi ba'i ris mthun pa lhag ma mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, the remainder of the homogeneous collection of beings that die in the intermediate state due to the incompleteness of conditions such as food is not the nonanalytical cessation.

original: sde pa gzhan dag na re bya ba la /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag na re bya ba la /
translated: Other schools say:

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rten skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i skyes pas na phra rgyas rnams mi skye ba la shes rab kyi nus pa yod do /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang rjes su 'brel pa'i rten skye ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i skyes pas na phra rgyas rnams mi skye ba la shes rab kyi nus pa yod do /
translated: Because it is incompatible with the arising of a life-basis that is connected with the latent states of the afflictions, it is incompatible with the arising of the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the power of wisdom is the non-arising of the negative tendencies.

original: sdug bsngal mi skye ba gang yin pa de la ni shes rab kyis byed pa med pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skye ba gang yin pa de la ni shes rab kyis byed pa med pa'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is the non-arising of suffering does not have the function of wisdom, and therefore it is not analytical cessation.

original: de ni sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ma tshang bas 'thob pas 'dir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa ma tshang bas 'thob pas 'dir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is obtained through the incompleteness of the causes of the arising of suffering, it is not analytical cessation.

original: de yang so sor brtags pa med par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang so sor brtags pa med par zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is also called ‚Äúnon-analytical cessation.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal mi skye ba de yang ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skye ba de yang ste /
translated: That which is the non-arising of suffering is also called ‚Äúnon-analytical cessation.‚Äù

original: rgyu ma tshang ba ni so sor brtags pa mngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa med par mi 'grub pas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba ni so sor brtags pa mngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir so sor brtags pa med par mi 'grub pas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is cessation due to deliberation alone because it is not established without deliberation, since the cause is incomplete.

original: rang gi dang gis 'gag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab med par 'gag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi dang gis 'gag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab med par 'gag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it ceases by its very nature means because it ceases without wisdom.

original: de lta na ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni mi rtag pas 'gog pa kho na yin no zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni mi rtag pas 'gog pa kho na yin no zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then you would be saying that analytical cessation is cessation due to impermanence alone.

original: ma zhig na de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma zhig na de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it does not exist when it is destroyed means

original: rang gi dang gis 'gag pa de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: rang gi dang gis 'gag pa de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: because that cessation by its very nature does not exist.

original: gal te so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yang so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yang so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you say that analytical cessation is not impermanent because it is preceded by deliberation,

original: nyon @224b mongs pa dang skye ba mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: nyon @224b mongs pa dang skye ba mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa sngon du 'gro ba yin te /
translated: then the nonarising of affliction and birth is also preceded by deliberation.

original: de'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cessation due to deliberation would be impermanent.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: No, it would not.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why not?

original: de dag mi skye ba de ni snga nas yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dag mi skye ba de ni snga nas yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Because the non-arising of those is already existent.

original: gal te de dag mi skye ba de snga nas yod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: gal te de dag mi skye ba de snga nas yod pa kho na yin la /
translated: If the non-arising of those is already existent,

original: ji ltar de la shes rab kyi nus pa yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de la shes rab kyi nus pa yod ce na /
translated: how can there be the power of wisdom in that?

original: de'i phyir chos gang dag so sor brtags pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gang dag so sor brtags pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThose dharmas that do not arise when there is no deliberation,‚Äù and so on.

original: gegs ma byas pa can rnams skye ba la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gegs ma byas pa can rnams skye ba la zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-obstruction of arising‚Äù means

original: gang dus las skye ba la gegs ma byas pa yod pas na /
analyzed: gang dus las skye ba la gegs ma byas pa yod pas na /
translated: that which is the non-obstruction of arising from time.

original: skye ba la gegs ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba la gegs ma byas pa ste /
translated: The non-obstruction of arising is

original: de dag skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa'i nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa'i nus pa yin no //
translated: the power of deliberation in regard to that which is the obstruction of the arising of those.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen la ltos te res 'ga' skye bar 'gyur ba las shes rab skyes pas de dag skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang rkyen la ltos te res 'ga' skye bar 'gyur ba las shes rab skyes pas de dag skye ba la gegs byed pa'i dngos po yin gyi /
translated: Because they arise sometimes in dependence on causes and conditions, and because wisdom arises, they are things that obstruct their arising.

original: shes rab kyis mi skye ba snga nas yod pa ma yin pa skyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis mi skye ba snga nas yod pa ma yin pa skyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Wisdom does not cause the nonarising of what did not previously exist.

original: de'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa mi rtag pa nyid med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor brtags pas 'gog pa mi rtag pa nyid med la /
translated: Therefore, analytical cessation does not have impermanence.

original: de la shes rab kyi nus pa med pas yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi nus pa med pas yang ma yin no //
translated: Since wisdom has no power over it, it is not arisen.

original: gal te me skye ba kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te me skye ba kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi /
translated: If the mere arising of fire is nirvana,

original: chos mngon ba pa rnams kyi ltar rdzas gzhan zhig ma yin no /
analyzed: chos mngon ba pa rnams kyi ltar rdzas gzhan zhig ma yin no /
translated: then nirvana is not a substance, as the Abhidharma masters say.

original: de lta na 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na /
translated: If that is so,

original: 'das pa da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal dag skyes zin pa nyid kyis mi skye ba med pa'i phyir mdo'i tshig ni ji ltar drang /
analyzed: 'das pa da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal dag skyes zin pa nyid kyis mi skye ba med pa'i phyir mdo'i tshig ni ji ltar drang /
translated: then how do you interpret the sutra passage that states, ‚ÄúThe suffering of the past and present has already arisen and does not arise again‚Äù?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su gyur par khas ma blangs par 'di drang bar mi nus so snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su gyur par khas ma blangs par 'di drang bar mi nus so snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is thought that this cannot be interpreted if you do not accept that nirvana is a substance.

original: dbang po lnga ni dad pa la sogs pa dag go ;üîΩ/ kun du bsten pa ni mthong ba'i lam du'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni dad pa la sogs pa dag go ; / kun du bsten pa ni mthong ba'i lam du'o //
translated: The five faculties are faith, etc.üîΩCultivation is on the path of insight.

original: goms par byas pa ni bsgom pa'i lam du'o //
analyzed: goms par byas pa ni bsgom pa'i lam du'o //
translated: Practice is on the path of cultivation.

original: lan mang du byas pa ni mi slob pa'i lam la'o //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pa ni mi slob pa'i lam la'o //
translated: Repeated practice is on the path of no learning.

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe abandonment of the defilements that have that as their object‚Äù shows that

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la ni rang gi ngo pos spangs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la ni rang gi ngo pos spangs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: past and present suffering cannot be abandoned by their intrinsic natures.

original: gzugs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe desire and passion for form‚Äù shows that

original: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: desire is the wish for something,

original: 'dod chags ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: and passion is the strong attachment to it.

original: de ltar de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas sdug bsngal spangs pa @225a * //
analyzed: de ltar de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas sdug bsngal spangs pa @225a * //
translated: Thus, suffering is abandoned by the abandonment of the defilements that have it as their object.

original: yin dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod par brtags pa med bzhin du dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal spangs par rung ngo //
analyzed: yin dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod par brtags pa med bzhin du dus gsum pa'i sdug bsngal spangs par rung ngo //
translated: Even without the postulation of the substantial reality of nirvana, it is possible to speak of the abandonment of the suffering of the three times.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this possible?

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa phra rgyas gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa phra rgyas gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of thorough analysis causes the subtle proclivities of the afflictions that focus on the suffering of the past, future, and present to never arise.

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni 'don pa'i bye brag la'o //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni 'don pa'i bye brag la'o //
translated: ‚Äú Also‚Äù refers to a variant reading.

original: tshul ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa kho nas de spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa kho nas de spangs pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú This is the only way‚Äù means that one abandons that suffering by abandoning the afflictions that focus on it.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of thorough analysis causes the subtle proclivities of the afflictions that focus on the past, future, and present to never arise.

original: yang na dgongs pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'don pa'i bye brag nyid la nyon mongs pa rnams rang gi ngo bos spangs ba'i dgongs pa 'chad pa'o //üîΩskye ba snga ma la byung ba ni tshe rabs snga ma'o //
analyzed: yang na dgongs pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'don pa'i bye brag nyid la nyon mongs pa rnams rang gi ngo bos spangs ba'i dgongs pa 'chad pa'o // skye ba snga ma la byung ba ni tshe rabs snga ma'o //
translated: ‚Äú Or, the intended meaning‚Äù refers to the explanation of the intended meaning of the abandonment of the afflictions by their intrinsic reality, which is a variant reading.üîΩ‚Äú That occurred in a previous birth‚Äù means in a former life.

original: skye ba 'di la byung ba ni tshe 'di pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di la byung ba ni tshe 'di pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That occurred in this birth‚Äù means in this life.

original: de ltar bshad na 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa skad cig ma yin pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bshad na 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i nyon mongs pa skad cig ma yin pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If this is so, then it is clear that past and present afflictions are momentary.

original: 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this known?

original: ji ltar sred pa rnam par spyad pa dag la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar sred pa rnam par spyad pa dag la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúJust as it is for those who practice with craving.‚Äù

original: sred pa rnam par spyad pa dag la ni the tshom za bar 'gyur ba dag ste g-yo bar gyur pa dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sred pa rnam par spyad pa dag la ni the tshom za bar 'gyur ba dag ste g-yo bar gyur pa dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those who practice with craving are those who are doubtful, that is, those who are unstable.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma gcig gi dbang du mdzad nas yin par ni mi rung zhes 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i tshe rabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma gcig gi dbang du mdzad nas yin par ni mi rung zhes 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i tshe rabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: It is not appropriate to take this in terms of a single moment in the past and future, so it should be understood that this is stated in terms of past and present lives.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshe rabs snga ma pa dang / tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun mtha' dag dang sbyar gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshe rabs snga ma pa dang / tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun mtha' dag dang sbyar gyi /
translated: In the same way, here too, it is applied to the entire continuum of afflictions in past and present lives,

original: skad cig ma gcig dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig dang ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to a single moment.

original: sred pa rnam par spyad pa bco brgyad po de dag ni dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa'i yod na nga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sred pa rnam par spyad pa bco brgyad po de dag ni dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa'i yod na nga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, when there is the thought ‚ÄòI am,‚Äô there arises the thought ‚ÄòI am like this,‚Äô

original: nga 'di 'dra'o snyam pa dang / nga de lta ma yin no snyam pa dang / nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / da ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga 'di 'dra'o snyam pa dang / nga de lta ma yin no snyam pa dang / nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / da ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the thought ‚ÄòI am such,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI am not like that,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI am good,‚Äô and the thought ‚ÄòI am bad.‚Äô

original: de la 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúThere arises the thought ‚ÄòI will be,‚Äô

original: de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'byung par @225b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'byung par @225b 'gyur ro //
translated: the thought ‚ÄòI will not be,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI will be like this,‚Äô the thought ‚ÄòI will be such,‚Äô and the thought ‚ÄòI will be not like that.‚Äô

original: de la gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúThere arises the thought ‚ÄòMay I be,‚Äô

original: de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa dang / gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang /üîΩde 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde dag gi khyad par ni 'og tu bshad par bya 'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa gnyis po des kyang zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma pa dang / tshe 'di pa pas so //
analyzed: de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang / 'di 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa dang / gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste / de dag gi khyad par ni 'og tu bshad par bya 'o // nyon mongs pa gnyis po des kyang zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma pa dang / tshe 'di pa pas so //
translated: The thought May it be like this and the thought May it be like that, the thought May it not be like this, the thought May it be so, the thought May it be like this,üîΩthe thought May it be like that, and the thought May it not be like that arise.üîΩThe distinction between these will be explained later.üîΩAnd by these two afflictions means by those of former lives and those of this life.üîΩ

original: rgyud 'di la zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la'o //üîΩsa bon gyi dngos po ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'di la zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba la'o //üîΩsa bon gyi dngos po ni nus pa'o //
translated: The phrase one thinks, 'May it be like this,' 'May it be like that,' 'May it not be like this,' 'May it not be like that,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,' 'May it be otherwise,' 'May it not be otherwise,'

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa gnyis po des kyang rgyud nyon mongs pa ma 'ongs pa skyed par nus par byas pa des 'di la sa bon gyi dngos po bzhag la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa gnyis po des kyang rgyud nyon mongs pa ma 'ongs pa skyed par nus par byas pa des 'di la sa bon gyi dngos po bzhag la zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the two afflictions are said to establish the state of a seed in this continuum, since they make the continuum capable of generating future afflictions.

original: sa bon gyi dngos po de spangs pas tshe rabs snga ma pa dang / tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa gnyis po de yang spangs pa yin no ;
analyzed: sa bon gyi dngos po de spangs pas tshe rabs snga ma pa dang / tshe 'di pa'i nyon mongs pa gnyis po de yang spangs pa yin no ;
translated: The two afflictions of past lives and of this life are abandoned by abandoning the state of the seed.

original: / ji srid du des gzhag pa'i sa bon gnas pa de srid du ni nyon mongs pa 'gags kyang spangs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: / ji srid du des gzhag pa'i sa bon gnas pa de srid du ni nyon mongs pa 'gags kyang spangs pa ma yin la /
translated: As long as the seed established by them exists, the afflictions are stopped but not abandoned.

original: des gzhag pa'i sa bon gyi dngos po spangs na ni de yang spangs par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: des gzhag pa'i sa bon gyi dngos po spangs na ni de yang spangs par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When the state of the seed established by them is abandoned, they are also said to be abandoned.

original: dper na rnam par smin pa zad pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na rnam par smin pa zad pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is said that ‚Äúwhen the result of evolution is exhausted.

original: las sngar 'gags kyang ji srid du des gzhag pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma zad pa de srid du zad do zhes mi bya la /
analyzed: las sngar 'gags kyang ji srid du des gzhag pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma zad pa de srid du zad do zhes mi bya la /
translated: ‚Äù Even though the action has already ceased, as long as the result of evolution established by it has not been exhausted, it is not said to be exhausted.

original: de zad na ni las de zad par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de zad na ni las de zad par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: When it is exhausted, the action is exhausted.

original: des gzhag pa'i sa bon med pas ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs pa ji ltar spang zhe na /
analyzed: des gzhag pa'i sa bon med pas ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs pa ji ltar spang zhe na /
translated: If the seed that is to be eliminated by that is nonexistent, how could future suffering or afflictions be eliminated?

original: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal lam nyon mongs pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúFuture suffering or afflictions are not produced because their seed is not produced or because the seed does not exist.‚Äù

original: sa bon skye ba mi srid cing sa bon med pa'i phyir gtan mi skye la /
analyzed: sa bon skye ba mi srid cing sa bon med pa'i phyir gtan mi skye la /
translated: Because the seed is not produced, it is definitely not produced.

original: sa bon med pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kho nas yin te /
analyzed: sa bon med pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kho nas yin te /
translated: And the seed does not exist because of the power of analytical discrimination alone.

original: de ltar na dus gsum gyi sdug bsngal las nyon mongs pa spangs par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na dus gsum gyi sdug bsngal las nyon mongs pa spangs par gzhag go //
translated: In this way, suffering and affliction are posited as eliminated in the three times.

original: 'gags zin pa 'das pa dang ; 'gags pa la mngon du phyogs pa da ltar byung ba la ni 'bad pa ste gnyen po skyed pa'i 'bad pa don dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gags zin pa 'das pa dang ; 'gags pa la mngon du phyogs pa da ltar byung ba la ni 'bad pa ste gnyen po skyed pa'i 'bad pa don dang bcas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is pointless to make an effort to eliminate that which has already ceased, the past, or that which is present and has already ceased, because it is pointless to generate an antidote.

original: dgos pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgos pa dang bcas par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is not necessary.

original: de dag gi mchog ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par bshad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gi mchog ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par bshad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said that freedom from attachment is the best of these.

original: 'dod chags @226a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags @226a * //
translated: AttachmentüîΩüîΩ

original: dang bral ba ni 'dod chags zad pa ste /
analyzed: dang bral ba ni 'dod chags zad pa ste /
translated: Free from attachment means attachment is exhausted.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcessation through analysis‚Äù is that.

original: rtag pa'i phyir 'dus byas dag pas mchog yin la /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir 'dus byas dag pas mchog yin la /
translated: It is supreme among conditioned phenomena because it is permanent.

original: dge ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas dag pas mchog yin par bshad de /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas dag pas mchog yin par bshad de /
translated: It is supreme among unconditioned phenomena because it is virtuous.

original: de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi mchog kyang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos kyi mchog kyang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo dang 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, nirvana is the supreme phenomenon, both conditioned and unconditioned, and it is also a nonthing.

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa ni mtshan nyid med pas chos nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa ni mtshan nyid med pas chos nyid ma yin la /
translated: This contradicts sutra because a nonthing is not reality since it has no characteristics.

original: brjod du med pa ni brjod du med pa dag pas mchog nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni brjod du med pa dag pas mchog nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not supreme among the inexpressible because the inexpressible is supreme among the inexpressible,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, that which is called a phenomenon dharmma because it holds its own characteristics is a thing because it is the basis of conceptual consciousnesses that apprehend it.

original: chos gzhan dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i gang yin pa de ni don gzhan du gyur pa cung zad cig yin te /
analyzed: chos gzhan dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i gang yin pa de ni don gzhan du gyur pa cung zad cig yin te /
translated: That which is superior to other phenomena is a different object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar na med pa rnams kyi mchog med par 'os zhes bya bar smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar na med pa rnams kyi mchog med par 'os zhes bya bar smos so //
translated: Therefore, how could non-existent things be the best?

original: ji ltar med pa nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas rnams kyi mchog med pa 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par 'os 'dus ma byas med pa kho na'o zhes kyang mi smra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas rnams kyi mchog med pa 'dod chags dang bral ba yin par 'os 'dus ma byas med pa kho na'o zhes kyang mi smra ste /
translated: We do not assert that space and so on, which are non-existent unconditioned phenomena, are the best, since they are free from attachment, because they are non-existent unconditioned phenomena.

original: des na mdo dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na mdo dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction with the sutras.

original: gal te yod la rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: gal te yod la rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa des na /
translated: If it exists but does not substantially exist,

original: de ji lta bu zhig yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: then how could it be described?

original: de ni kho bo cag gis ji skad du bshad pa de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni kho bo cag gis ji skad du bshad pa de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is just as we have explained it.

original: reg bya med pa tsam ni nam mkha' yin la /
analyzed: reg bya med pa tsam ni nam mkha' yin la /
translated: Space is merely the absence of tangible objects.

original: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis gzhan mi skye pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin zhing /
analyzed: phra rgyas dang skye ba skyes pa 'gags nas so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis gzhan mi skye pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin zhing /
translated: The nonarising of other negative tendencies and birth that have already arisen and ceased through the power of analytical discrimination is analytical cessation.

original: so sor brtags pa med pa kho nar rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa med pa kho nar rkyen ma tshang bas mi skye ba ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The nonarising of other negative tendencies and birth that do not arise due to the mere incompleteness of conditions without the power of analytical discrimination is nonanalytical cessation.

original: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid la yod ces bya zhe na /üîΩdper na sgra la snga na med pa yang yod /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid la yod ces bya zhe na / dper na sgra la snga na med pa yang yod /
translated: How can one say that a non-existent self exists?

original: phyis med pa yang yod ces bya mod kyi /
analyzed: phyis med pa yang yod ces bya mod kyi /
translated: For example, one can say that sound exists prior to its occurrence and that it does not exist after its cessation.

original: 'on kyang dngos po med pa yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar bas yod par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po med pa yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar bas yod par mi 'grub ste /
translated: However, the term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is not established as existent by the term ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig phrad yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig phrad yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúexists‚Äù is a verbal prefix.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni yod do zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni yod do zhes kyang bya la /
translated: Unconditioned states should be viewed in the same way.

original: yod pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya bar ro //
translated: They are said to exist and they are said to not exist.

original: ji ltar med pa rnams kyi mchog med pa yin par 'os zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa rnams kyi mchog med pa yin par 'os zhes gang smras pa de'i lan ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: med pa yang kha cig ces bya ba rgyas par @226b 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: med pa yang kha cig ces bya ba rgyas par @226b 'byung ba'o //
translated: Some say that non-existence is the best,üîΩbut that is not so.

original: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gang gnod pa thams cad dang gtan bral bde ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gnod pa thams cad dang gtan bral bde ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: That which is completely free from all harm.

original: nad med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nad med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like being free from illness.

original: ci'i phyir 'di bsngags pa thob par 'os she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di bsngags pa thob par 'os she na /
translated: Why is it worthy of praise?

original: gdul bya rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gdul bya rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to inspire disciples to aspire to it,

original: gdul bya bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa rnams de la skrag bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdul bya bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa rnams de la skrag bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because disciples who possess attachment to self will be frightened by it.

original: nam mkha' ni gnod pa thams cad med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gnod pa thams cad med pa ma yin te /
translated: Space is not completely free from all harm,

original: reg bya med pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩso sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ni gtan bral ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: reg bya med pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro // so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ni gtan bral ba yin mod kyi /
translated: because it is characterized by the mere absence of contact.üîΩNonanalytical cessation is completely free,

original: gnod pa thams cad dang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad dang ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not completely free from all harm,

original: skye ba dang mi ldan pa rnams kho na'i de rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang mi ldan pa rnams kho na'i de rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only those who are not born obtain it.

original: de ltar na gzhan dag pas de mchog yin pas bsngags pa thob par 'os so //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan dag pas de mchog yin pas bsngags pa thob par 'os so //
translated: Thus, it is praiseworthy that it is superior to others.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid med kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ltar chos kyi tha snyad kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid med kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ltar chos kyi tha snyad kyang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why do you not accept that the designation of a phenomenon is not like the past and future, even though it does not exist by intrinsic identity?

original: bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: It is to be established.

original: mdzod kyi gnas lnga par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdzod kyi gnas lnga par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is to be established, as stated in the fifth chapter of the Abhidharmako≈õa:

original: 'di la bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: ji skad bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad ce na /
translated: What was explained?

original: 'dul ba rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar te /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnams de la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar te /
translated: In order to inspire the faithful,

original: brjod du med pa nyid yin yang snga na med pa la sogs pa ltar de dag phan tshun khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa nyid yin yang snga na med pa la sogs pa ltar de dag phan tshun khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: even though it is inexpressible, it is distinguished from other things, like the past and future.

original: 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: cessation would not be an ƒÅrya truth.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is it?

original: gang zhig ci yang ma yin pa de ni ji ltar de'i bden pa 'am /üîΩbrdzun pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gang zhig ci yang ma yin pa de ni ji ltar de'i bden pa 'am / brdzun pa zhes bya /
translated: How could that which is nothing be a truth or a lie?

original: re zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don 'di gang yin ci rdzas kyi don yin nam /
analyzed: re zhig 'gog pa'i bden pa'i don 'di gang yin ci rdzas kyi don yin nam /
translated: First, what is the meaning of the truth of cessation? Is it the meaning of a substance?

original: 'on te phyin ci ma log pa'i don yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te phyin ci ma log pa'i don yin nam /
translated: Or is it the meaning of non-error?

original: gal te rdzas kyi don yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kyi don yin na ni /
translated: If it is the meaning of substance,

original: de lta na kun rdzob kyi bden pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na kun rdzob kyi bden pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that the conventional truth does not exist,

original: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log ma log pa'i don khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log ma log pa'i don khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: and therefore you must accept the meaning of non-error and error.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal ltar sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang bden pa nyid du mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal ltar sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang bden pa nyid du mi 'gal lo //
translated: If that is so, then just as suffering is a truth, so too the cessation of suffering is not contradictory as a truth.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /üîΩji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal nyid du gzigs kyi /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal nyid du gzigs kyi /
translated: In order to demonstrate that point, he says, ‚ÄúThe noble ones see suffering as suffering,üîΩbut they do not see it as happiness.‚Äù

original: bde ba zhes bya bar ma yin pas sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par brjod pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal med pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar gzigs pa la sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes brjod @227a *
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya bar ma yin pas sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par brjod pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal med pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar gzigs pa la sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes brjod @227a *
translated: Just as the noble ones see suffering as suffering, but they do not see it as happiness, so too the noble ones see the cessation of suffering as the mere absence of suffering, and they do not see it as happiness.

original: // do // ji ltar med pa ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir gsum pa nyid du 'gyur zhen /
analyzed: // do // ji ltar med pa ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir gsum pa nyid du 'gyur zhen /
translated: How could nonexistence be the third, since it is nothing at all?

original: gnyis pa'i 'og tu mthong ba dang / bstan pas na gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i 'og tu mthong ba dang / bstan pas na gsum pa yin te /
translated: It is the third because it is seen and taught after the second.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe gnyis pa kun 'byung gi bden pa'i 'og tu rang gi shes rab kyis mthong ba dang / ston pa'i tshe gzhan gnyis kyis 'og tu bstan pas gsum pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe gnyis pa kun 'byung gi bden pa'i 'og tu rang gi shes rab kyis mthong ba dang / ston pa'i tshe gzhan gnyis kyis 'og tu bstan pas gsum pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of realizing the truth, it is called the third because it is seen by one's own wisdom after the second truth of origination, and because it is taught by the other two after the second.

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What would happen? means what fault would there be?

original: ci zhig tu yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yon tan ci zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhig tu yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yon tan ci zhig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What would be the benefit? means what good quality would there be?

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs bskyangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yon tan 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs bskyangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yon tan 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position would be upheld means this would be a good quality.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon cir 'gyur zhes gang smras pa de'i lan te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skyon cir 'gyur zhes gang smras pa de'i lan te /
translated: It would be an imagined falsity means this is the answer to the question, What fault would there be?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be a fault to impute something that is not real.üîΩWhy?

original: ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam gyis 'di bsgrub par mi nus so zhes rgyu dris pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam gyis 'di bsgrub par mi nus so zhes rgyu dris pa'o //
translated: The reason is asked: this cannot be established by mere words.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Like form, feeling, etc.

original: gang zhig dngos po yin pa de ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bos mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po yin pa de ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bos mngon sum gyis dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Whatever is a thing is, like form, feeling, etc., perceived by direct perception by its own nature.

original: yang na mig la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa ltar 'bras bu'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa yin na /
translated: Or, like the eye, etc., it is perceived by inference through its effect.

original: 'di la ni gnyis ka yang med pas 'dus ma byas dngos po ma yin no zhes bya bar gzung ste /
analyzed: 'di la ni gnyis ka yang med pas 'dus ma byas dngos po ma yin no zhes bya bar gzung ste /
translated: But since neither of these two is the case here, unconditioned things are not things.

original: 'di ni lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained more than once.

original: dngos po che ge mo zhig gi zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po'i 'o //
analyzed: dngos po che ge mo zhig gi zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dngos po'i 'o //
translated: A certain thing means a thing such as attachment.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: because things such as cause and effect would be impossible.
