original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nor dang bdag po dang / yan lag dang / yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can gyi 'brel pa rnams la sogs pa rnams gzung ste ;
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nor dang bdag po dang / yan lag dang / yan lag can dang / yon tan dang yon tan can gyi 'brel pa rnams la sogs pa rnams gzung ste ;
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes such things as the relation between wealth and an owner, between a part and a whole, and between a quality and that which possesses the quality.

original: 'gog pa ni dngos po'i 'bras bu ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni dngos po'i 'bras bu ma yin zhing /
translated: cessation is not the effect of a thing,

original: rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin la /
translated: it is not a cause,

original: nor dang bdag po yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nor dang bdag po yang ma yin no //
translated: and it is not wealth or an owner.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: bkag pa tsam du ni rung ngo zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bkag pa tsam du ni rung ngo zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ste /
translated: It is suitable as mere cessation, this is explained from the perspective of the relation between a property and a property possessor,

original: sgra dang mi rtag pa nyid @227b bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra dang mi rtag pa nyid @227b bzhin no //
translated: like the relation between sound and impermanence.

original: de ni de'i gnas skabs yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni de'i gnas skabs yin gyi /
translated: That is the state of that,

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of another.

original: dngos po gzhan nyid yin na yang nyon mongs pa gang gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan nyid yin na yang nyon mongs pa gang gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Even if it were a different thing, it would be the affliction of that, etc.

original: 'dir sems gnyis la 'gog pa gnyis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sems gnyis la 'gog pa gnyis blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, two cessations should be seen in relation to two minds.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam dang lhan cig tu nyon mongs pa'i thob pa 'gag la /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam dang lhan cig tu nyon mongs pa'i thob pa 'gag la /
translated: The obtainment of the affliction ceases simultaneously with the uninterrupted path.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa thob po //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang lhan cig tu so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa thob po //
translated: The cessation that is discerned is obtained simultaneously with the liberated path.

original: nyon mongs pa'i thob pa ma 'gags par ni bral ba'i thob pa mi thob pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i thob pa ma 'gags par ni bral ba'i thob pa mi thob pa ste /
translated: The obtainment of freedom is not obtained without the cessation of the obtainment of the affliction.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa gang gi thob pa 'gags nas 'gog pa gang thob pa de ni de'i yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa gang gi thob pa 'gags nas 'gog pa gang thob pa de ni de'i yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: Thus, when the obtainment of a certain affliction ceases, the cessation that is obtained is that of that affliction.

original: 'di la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: Here, since there is no relation of cause and effect, the question is asked:

original: 'o na de thob par nges pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa 'di'i thob pa chad pas 'gog pa 'di kho na 'thob kyi /
analyzed: 'o na de thob par nges pa'i rgyu gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'o // nyon mongs pa 'di'i thob pa chad pas 'gog pa 'di kho na 'thob kyi /
translated: What is the cause of the obtainment of that cessation?üîΩThere is no cause whatsoever that determines that this cessation alone is obtained by the severance of the obtainment of this affliction,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med de /
translated: and that other cessations are not obtained.

original: sngar bshad pa'i 'brel pa rnams mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na 'di ni 'dod chags kyi bral ba'i thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i 'brel pa rnams mi srid pa'i phyir ro // yang na 'di ni 'dod chags kyi bral ba'i thob pa yin gyi /
translated: because the previously explained relationships are impossible.üîΩOr else, there is no reason to ascertain that this is the obtainment of freedom from attachment,

original: gzhan gyi bral ba'i ni ma yin no zhes nges pa'i rgyu med de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bral ba'i ni ma yin no zhes nges pa'i rgyu med de /
translated: but not the freedom from other states,

original: 'dod chags kyi thob pa chad pa rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / lam la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi thob pa chad pa rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / lam la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the obtainment of attachment is not the cause of freedom, and because there is no difference in the path.

original: che ge mo zhig gi med pa'o zhes dgag pa tsam du ni mi rung ngo zhes gang smras pa de la lung dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: che ge mo zhig gi med pa'o zhes dgag pa tsam du ni mi rung ngo zhes gang smras pa de la lung dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: As for what was said, ‚ÄúIt is not suitable to say ‚Äòit does not exist‚Äô as a mere negation,‚Äù in order to demonstrate that this contradicts scripture,

original: mdo las mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mdo las mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúA sutra states, ‚ÄòOne who attains nirvana in this life‚Äô and so on.‚Äù

original: da ltar ba'i skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings kyi gnas skabs na yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i skye ba la mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i dbyings kyi gnas skabs na yin te /
translated: Attaining nirvana in the present life is the state of the dhƒÅtu that is accompanied by the remaining aggregates.

original: des ni med pa ni brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: des ni med pa ni brjod du med pa yin pa'i phyir na ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: Since it is inexpressible, how could it be attained?

original: de'i phyir mdo las thob par gsungs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa kho na yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las thob par gsungs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa kho na yin par bzhed do //
translated: Therefore, since it is said in the sutra that nirvana is attained, it is accepted that nirvana definitely exists.

original: med pa yin yang thob pa mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir gnyen po thob pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: med pa yin yang thob pa mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir gnyen po thob pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: To show that it is not contradictory to attain something that does not exist, he says, ‚ÄúBecause the antidote is attained,‚Äù and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa dag ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa dag ste /
translated: Afflictions and rebirth are afflictions and rebirth.

original: de dag gi skye ba ni nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba ni nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: Their arising is the arising of afflictions and rebirth.

original: nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa de'i skye ba de dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa de'i skye ba de dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten ni /
translated: The basis that is utterly incompatible with the arising of those afflictions and rebirth

original: @228a * // nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa'i skye ba dang / shin tu 'gal ba'i rten te /
analyzed: @228a * // nyon mongs pa dang yang srid pa'i skye ba dang / shin tu 'gal ba'i rten te /
translated: is the basis that is utterly incompatible with the arising of afflictions and rebirth.

original: de thob pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de thob pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is attained, it is called ‚Äúattaining nirvana.‚Äù

original: gnyen po'i stobs kyis 'gal ba'i rten thob cing 'bru mes tshig pa dang 'dra ba'i rten de lta bu'i de thob pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa 'am skye ba yang mi 'byung bas phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas mya
analyzed: gnyen po'i stobs kyis 'gal ba'i rten thob cing 'bru mes tshig pa dang 'dra ba'i rten de lta bu'i de thob pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa 'am skye ba yang mi 'byung bas phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas mya
translated: Because afflictions or birth do not occur in that life, nirvana with remainder is called

original: ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngan las 'das pa thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: attained nirvana, from the perspective of nirvana with remainder.

original: gnyen po ni 'dir bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: gnyen po ni 'dir bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The antidote is the uninterrupted path.

original: de thob pa na mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de thob pa na mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Attainment is the nature of actualization.

original: 'di ltar de ni des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rten skye ba dang 'gal bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni des spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang rjes su 'brel ba'i rten skye ba dang 'gal bas /
translated: Thus, it is attained because it is the antidote that is the life basis that is incompatible with the life basis that is concomitant with the seeds of the affliction to be abandoned by that antidote.

original: de'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtog pa'i rten skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rtog pa'i rten skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Immediately after that, the life basis that is the seed of the affliction arises.

original: de ltar na gnyen pos nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten thob po //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyen pos nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten thob po //
translated: Thus the antidote attains the life basis that is incompatible with the arising of the affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten thob na yang skye ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa skye ba dang 'gal ba'i rten thob na yang skye ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: When one obtains a basis that is incompatible with the generation of all afflictions, afflictions do not arise.

original: de ltar na de ni skye ba 'byung ba dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni skye ba 'byung ba dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be incompatible with the arising of birth.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ma 'gags na ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten mi thob la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ma 'gags na ni nyon mongs pa skye ba dang shin tu 'gal ba'i rten mi thob la /
translated: Thus, if the seeds of affliction are not stopped, one does not obtain a basis that is utterly incompatible with the generation of affliction.

original: gnyen po ma skyes na nyon mongs pa'i sa bon mi 'gag go //
analyzed: gnyen po ma skyes na nyon mongs pa'i sa bon mi 'gag go //
translated: If the antidote does not arise, the seeds of affliction are not stopped.

original: lung las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: lung las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Also, from scripture

original: 'dir dper brjod pa ni 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dper brjod pa ni 'byung ba med pa zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The example here is ‚Äúnon-arising,‚Äù

original: mi skye ba'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a synonym for non-production.

original: slob dpon gyis 'byung ba 'gag pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas 'byung ba med pa zhes khungs su bshad pas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'byung ba 'gag pa tsam gyi dbang du byas nas 'byung ba med pa zhes khungs su bshad pas /
translated: The Master explains the source in terms of the mere cessation of arising,

original: de'i phyir 'di yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: saying, ‚ÄúIf this is so,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir mi 'byung bas khyad par du gyur pa'i dngos po nyid bstan gyi /
analyzed: 'dir mi 'byung bas khyad par du gyur pa'i dngos po nyid bstan gyi /
translated: But since this is not the case, it is taught that nirvana is a special kind of nonexistence.

original: 'byung ba bkag pa tsam ni ma yin pas 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa mi skye ba tsam du shes par bya ba la khungs ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba bkag pa tsam ni ma yin pas 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa mi skye ba tsam du shes par bya ba la khungs ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But since it is not merely the negation of the elements, this passage is not a source for the knowledge that nirvana is mere nonarising.

original: bdun pa 'di ni nus pa med par blta'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bdun pa 'di ni nus pa med par blta'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The seventh is to be regarded as powerless.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩ'dir yin na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji skad du bshad pa yin zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba la zhes bya bar sbyar ro // 'dir yin na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji skad du bshad pa yin zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of the passage is that nirvana is a special kind of nonexistence, since it is the nonexistence of the aggregates that are to be attained.üîΩBut if it is the case that nirvana is the nonexistence of the aggregates, then how could it be a thing?

original: gal te de yod na ni zhes bya bar sbyar na ni ste /
analyzed: gal te de yod na ni zhes bya bar sbyar na ni ste /
translated: If you apply the phrase if it exists to the aggregates, then the meaning of the passage is that if the aggregates exist, then nirvana does not exist.üîΩBut if you apply the phrase if it exists to nirvana, then the meaning of the passage is that if nirvana exists, then the aggregates do not exist.

original: 'di yod na mi 'byung ba de ni 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba yin @228b na ni mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa'i phyir rtag tu mi 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yod na mi 'byung ba de ni 'byung ba med do zhes bya ba yin @228b na ni mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa'i phyir rtag tu mi 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if nirvana is permanent, then it would be impossible for the aggregates to arise, since they would never arise.

original: rten gyi don mi srid pas na gzhan du nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: rten gyi don mi srid pas na gzhan du nye bar bkod do //
translated: Since it is impossible for nirvana to be the object of support, it is presented as something else.

original: gang kho nas zhes bya ba ni lam gyis so //
analyzed: gang kho nas zhes bya ba ni lam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly that‚Äù refers to the path.

original: de thob par zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par ro //
analyzed: de thob par zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAttaining that‚Äù refers to attaining nirvana.

original: de nyid yod dam zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: de nyid yod dam zhes bya ba ni mngon du gyur pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very thing‚Äù refers to the manifest state.

original: thob na zhes bya ba ni rnyed na ste /
analyzed: thob na zhes bya ba ni rnyed na ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf attained‚Äù means if it is obtained.

original: lam dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lam dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the path.

original: sdug bsngal mi 'byung bar 'dod par gyis shig ces bya ba ni gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa don med pa brtags pa ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi 'byung bar 'dod par gyis shig ces bya ba ni gzhan mya ngan las 'das pa don med pa brtags pa ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYou should wish for the non-arising of suffering‚Äù means what is the use of imagining another nirvana?

original: de yi sems kyi rnam par thar //
analyzed: de yi sems kyi rnam par thar //
translated: The liberation of his mindüîΩis the non-existence of the mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is said

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na'o /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na'o /
translated: in the context of the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs nirvana without remainder.

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba po med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa nyid med pas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin zhing mya ngan las 'da' ba po med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa nyid med pas na /
translated: Since the past is nirvana and the one who attains nirvana does not exist, nirvana itself does not exist.

original: chos mngon pa las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said in the Abhidharma‚Ä¶

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ;
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re ;
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:

original: 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is not the meaning of this s≈´tra.

original: dngos po med pa ni lus med pa dang / rang gi ngo bo med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni lus med pa dang / rang gi ngo bo med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Nonexistence is not the nonexistence of a body or the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dngos po'i sgra'i don du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i sgra'i don du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of the term ‚Äúthing‚Äù is not a non-thing.

original: gal te 'di don ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di don ma yin na /
translated: If this is not the meaning of this s≈´tra,

original: 'o na gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang yin zhe na /
translated: then what is?

original: dngos po ni rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: There are five types of things:

original: rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid dngos po'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid dngos po'o //
translated: The nature of a thing is a thing.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Just as a thing is is the meaning of just as an object is.

original: dmigs pa nyid dngos po yin pa ni dmigs pa'i dngos po'o //üîΩldan pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba la /üîΩldan pa'i dngos po ni ldan pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid dngos po yin pa ni dmigs pa'i dngos po'o // ldan pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba la / ldan pa'i dngos po ni ldan pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: An object itself is a thing is an object-thing.üîΩA related thing is a thing.üîΩA related thing is a thing is a related thing.üîΩA causal thing is a thing.

original: rgyu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid dngos po yin pa ni rgyu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid dngos po yin pa ni rgyu'i dngos po'o //
translated: A cause itself is a thing is a causal thing.

original: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the term ‚Äúentity that is appropriated,‚Äù

original: yongs su gzung ba 'am /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba 'am /
translated: appropriation or

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: grasping is the entity that is appropriated.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'dir bdag gir byed pa'o ;
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa ni 'dir bdag gir byed pa'o ;
translated: Grasping is the act of making something one‚Äôs own.

original: / de'i phyir 'dir rgyu'i dngos po'i sgrar gsungs kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'dir rgyu'i dngos po'i sgrar gsungs kyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, this passage teaches that the unconditioned are called entities because they are causes, but not because they have their own intrinsic reality.

original: gang gi phyir chos mngon pa las 'dus ma byas rnams rgyu med pa nyid du grub kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos mngon pa las 'dus ma byas rnams rgyu med pa nyid du grub kyi /
translated: This passage from the Abhidharma teaches that the unconditioned are established as being without cause,

original: rang gi ngo bo med pa ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med pa ni ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: but not as being without their own intrinsic reality.

original: yang 'bras bu 'di dag las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: yang 'bras bu 'di dag las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Again, the root text asks, ‚ÄúFrom among these results . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: @229a * // 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can rnam par smin pa dang / bdag po dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / skyes bu byed pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag las 'bras bu gang zhig rgyu drug po de las rgyu gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: @229a * // 'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can rnam par smin pa dang / bdag po dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / skyes bu byed pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag las 'bras bu gang zhig rgyu drug po de las rgyu gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: The five results that will be explained, such as the result of karmic maturation, the dominant result, the result of natural outcome, the result of conscious effort, and the result of separation, are results of which of the six causes?

original: de la re zhig bral ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu gang gi yang ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la re zhig bral ba'i 'bras bu ni rgyu gang gi yang ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Among them, it has already been explained that the result of separation is not a result of any cause.

original: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The last is the result of karmic maturation.

original: 'dir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na'i yin no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu kho na zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu kho na'i yin no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu kho na zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the result of karmic maturation is definitely ascertained to be the result of the cause of karmic maturation alone, but it is not the result of karmic maturation alone.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the dominant result is not refuted.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first is the dominant result.

original: 'di bdag po yin pa ni bdag po'i'o //
analyzed: 'di bdag po yin pa ni bdag po'i'o //
translated: The first cause is the dominant cause.

original: 'dir nges par gzung ba gnyis ka yang skyon dang bcas pas nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir nges par gzung ba gnyis ka yang skyon dang bcas pas nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Since both of these are faulty, they should not be definitely ascertained.

original: 'di ltar byed rgyu'i rgyu 'ga' zhig la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byed rgyu'i rgyu 'ga' zhig la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yang yod la /
translated: For example, some causes that are active causes are also personal active causes.

original: gzhan dag la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yod pa yin no //
translated: And some are dominant results.

original: de ltar na ni 'o na bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'o na bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that the first has no result called a dominant result.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni bdag po'i 'bras bu ltar thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni bdag po'i 'bras bu ltar thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that it has no result, because it is understood that a personal active result is not like a dominant result for all.

original: de nyid dbang byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi sgrib pa'i ngo bor gnas pa gang yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid dbang byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi sgrib pa'i ngo bor gnas pa gang yin pa kho na'o //
translated: That itself is the dominant condition means that it is the mere nondominant state.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu la skyed pa'i dngos po yang yod de zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yang ngo //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu la skyed pa'i dngos po yang yod de zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yang ngo //
translated: The active cause is also a productive entity means that it is also a productive entity.

original: 'dis ni 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa byed rgyu byed pa po dang btang snyoms pa dang rnam pa gnyis ka la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yod do zhes bya bar shes par bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dus ma byas ma gtogs pa byed rgyu byed pa po dang btang snyoms pa dang rnam pa gnyis ka la yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yod do zhes bya bar shes par bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: This should be understood to mean that, with the exception of the unconditioned, all active causes have dominant results in both the active cause and the neutral.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sngon 'byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //üîΩ'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
analyzed: sngon 'byung ma yin 'dus byas ni // 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
translated: Conditioned states that are not prior

original: zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes 'chad do //
translated: are the dominant result of conditioned states alone.

original: 'di lta ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five collections of consciousness are the dominant result of the eye and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched bcu ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi byed rgyu'i rgyu las gzhan pa lhan cig 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched bcu ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi byed rgyu'i rgyu las gzhan pa lhan cig 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The ten bases such as the eye are not coemergent causes and so forth that are active causes other than the eye consciousness and so on.

original: yid dang chos ci rigs par yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro @229b ba dang / lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: yid dang chos ci rigs par yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro @229b ba dang / lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag kyang yin te /
translated: The mental base and phenomena are the homogeneous cause, omnipresent cause, coemergent cause and concomitant cause of the mental consciousness.

original: de'i phyir bcu po dag kho na smos kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcu po dag kho na smos kyi /
translated: Therefore, only the ten are mentioned,

original: yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the mental faculty and the entity basis.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The world of sentient beings is the basis of the world of the physical environment.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten ni lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dod dgur mi 'jug pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis bskyed pa yin yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te /üîΩrnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten ni lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'dod dgur mi 'jug pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis bskyed pa yin yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te / rnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The world of the physical environment is not a ripened result, because it is neutral, it does not function as one desires, and it is generated by virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: sems can brjod ces mtshan nyid byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can brjod ces mtshan nyid byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a ripened result is not shared in common and because it is characterized as the expression of sentient beings.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mi srid pa las ni de'i byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mi srid pa las ni de'i byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin no //
translated: It is the active cause of that which is other than it, because it is impossible for it to be a cause of itself.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text indicates that the same analysis applies to the other ten bases.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: bsnams nas blta bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs par ro //
analyzed: bsnams nas blta bar 'dod pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs par ro //
translated: The desire to see arises after smelling.

original: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i //
analyzed: rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i //
translated: Natural outflow, homogeneous, and omnipresent

original: 'bras bu zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúeffect‚Äù is supplied.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: An effect similar to its cause is called an effect of natural outflow.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the effect of natural outflow is posited as the effect of both a homogeneous cause and a pervasive cause.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro bdag kho na'i yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi / rgyu mthun pa kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro bdag kho na'i yin no zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi / rgyu mthun pa kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly a homogeneous cause and a pervasive cause‚Äù is stated to indicate that only these two causes have an effect of natural outflow, but it does not indicate that the effect of natural outflow is only that.

original: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu yang de dag gi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu yang de dag gi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a personal effect and dominant effect are also effects of these two causes.

original: skyes bu pa ni gnyis kyi yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes bu pa ni gnyis kyi yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The personal effect is of two.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na gnyis kyi yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na gnyis kyi yin te /
translated: The personal effect is the effect of two causes.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho na la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho na la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because coemergent causes and conjoined causes possess activity only in relation to an effect that coexists with them.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu yang de dag gis der 'gyur mod gyi /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu yang de dag gis der 'gyur mod gyi /
translated: The dominant result is also that which arises from them.

original: de ni byed pa po ma yin pa'i yang yin pas 'dir brjod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni byed pa po ma yin pa'i yang yin pas 'dir brjod par mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is also the result of one who is not an agent, so it is not mentioned here.

original: tshig le'ur byas pas sbyar ba'i phyir skyes bu pa zhes bya ba'i sgra bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir skyes bu'i ngo bo las mi gzhan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pas sbyar ba'i phyir skyes bu pa zhes bya ba'i sgra bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir skyes bu'i ngo bo las mi gzhan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The term puru·π£akƒÅraphala is formed by adding the affix ka to the term puru·π£akƒÅra, which is derived from the verbal root kr with the prefix puru·π£a.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa ni bya ba dang las dang bya rgyu dang / g-yo ba zhes bya ba las don gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa ni bya ba dang las dang bya rgyu dang / g-yo ba zhes bya ba las don gzhan ma yin la /
translated: The activity of a person is not different from action, function, or motion.

original: bya ba yang bya ba dang ldan pa dag las gzhan ma yin pas skyes bu nyid skyes bu'i byed pa yin par bshad cing /
analyzed: bya ba yang bya ba dang ldan pa dag las gzhan ma yin pas skyes bu nyid skyes bu'i byed pa yin par bshad cing /
translated: And action is not different from those who possess action. Therefore, the activity of a person is explained as being the person himself.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu par bshad do //üîΩnang gi byed pa'i skyes bu @230a * //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu par bshad do // nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu @230a * //
translated: And its result is explained as the result of the activity of a person.

original: med pas skyes bu byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: med pas skyes bu byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: Since there is no inner agent, what is this so-called activity of a person?

original: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang gi byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'o //
translated: The function of any phenomenon is its human action.

original: gal te nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med pas skyes bu chos skyes tsam zhig yin pa de'i phyir chos kyi byed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu med pas skyes bu chos skyes tsam zhig yin pa de'i phyir chos kyi byed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the human action of a phenomenon is merely the arising of the phenomenon because there is no inner agent, then it is called the action of a phenomenon.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa zhes bya bar ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa zhes bya bar ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: It is not called the action of a human being.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i byed pa lta bu ni skyes bu byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i byed pa lta bu ni skyes bu byed pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚ÄúHuman action is like the action of a human being.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i skyes bu'i bya ba la skyes bu byed pa zhes grags pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i skyes bu'i bya ba la skyes bu byed pa zhes grags pas de'i phyir /
translated: The action of a human being is known in the world as the action of a human being.

original: 'jig rten pas brtags pa'i skyes bu byed pa de dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i byed pa lta bur mdzad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas brtags pa'i skyes bu byed pa de dang 'dra bar skyes bu'i byed pa lta bur mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, human action is like the action of a human being that is imagined by worldly people.

original: dper na bya rog gi rkang pa dang 'dra ba la bya rog rkang dang / skyes bu gang zhig glang po che myos pa 'dra bar lus rgyas pa 'am dpa' ba de la mi glang po che myos pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bya rog gi rkang pa dang 'dra ba la bya rog rkang dang / skyes bu gang zhig glang po che myos pa 'dra bar lus rgyas pa 'am dpa' ba de la mi glang po che myos pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the foot of a crow is called a crow‚Äôs foot, and a person whose body is as large or as courageous as an elephant is called an elephant.

original: ci gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Do they exist for other causes as well?

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang / byed rgyu'i rgyu rnams la yang yod dam /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang / byed rgyu'i rgyu rnams la yang yod dam /
translated: Do they exist for homogeneous, omnipresent, or karmic maturation causes, or for coemergent and concomitant causes?

original: 'on te lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa gnyis kho na'i yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa gnyis kho na'i yin zhe na /
translated: Or do they exist for coemergent and concomitant causes alone?

original: gzhan dag la yang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: They exist for other causes as well.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa dag la yang ste /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa dag la yang ste /
translated: They exist for homogeneous and omnipresent causes.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag la yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod kyi /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag la yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod kyi /
translated: The result of conscious effort that arises immediately after is the result of conscious effort for homogeneous and omnipresent causes.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a coemergent result.

original: ci'i phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag kho na'i yin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag kho na'i yin par brjod ce na /
translated: Why is the result of conscious effort the result of only coemergent causes and concomitant causes?

original: lhan cig dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba de ni de gnyis kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: lhan cig dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba de ni de gnyis kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: That which arises simultaneously or immediately before is the result of conscious effort of only those two causes.

original: snga ma dag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the result of the other two causes.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thams cad la yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thams cad la yang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The result of conscious effort does not arise immediately after all homogeneous causes.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'chi ka ma mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'chi ka ma mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that the final moment of death of an arhat is that.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag la ni gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag la ni gdon mi za'o //
translated: But it is definitely the result of coemergent and concomitant causes.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang kha cig la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod kyi /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang kha cig la skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yod kyi /
translated: The efficient cause is the result of conscious effort for some things,

original: thams cad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for all.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, ‚ÄúExcept for the cause of karmic maturation.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni @230b lhan cig 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni @230b lhan cig 'byung ba'am /
translated: The result of conscious effort is either simultaneous or

original: de ma thag tu 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'byung ba yin la /
translated: immediately subsequent.

original: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But the result of karmic maturation is not like that.

original: de ni rgyun la ltos pa kho na yin gyi /üîΩde ma thag pa'am /
analyzed: de ni rgyun la ltos pa kho na yin gyi / de ma thag pa'am /
translated: It is dependent on a continuum alone,üîΩnot on an immediately preceding condition

original: dus gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: or on the same time period.

original: gzhan dag na re de la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩ'di ltar so nam gyi bya ba mtshungs shing zhing la sogs pa 'byor par mtshungs pa bzhin du kha cig gi 'bru la sogs pa 'byor bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / 'di ltar so nam gyi bya ba mtshungs shing zhing la sogs pa 'byor par mtshungs pa bzhin du kha cig gi 'bru la sogs pa 'byor bar 'gyur la /
translated: Others say: It is also that,

original: kha cig gi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig gi ni ma yin te /
translated: because some crops such as barley are abundant and some are not, even though the work of cultivation is the same and the land and so on are similar.

original: de'i phyir / lhan cig 'byung ba dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir / lhan cig 'byung ba dang de ma thag tu 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, the result of conscious effort is not only simultaneous or immediately subsequent,

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu skal ba mnyam pa yang yod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu skal ba mnyam pa yang yod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: but also homogeneous.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges pa bshad zin to //
translated: The certainty of cause and result has been explained.

original: da ni 'bras bu rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu rnams kyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Now, the characteristics of the results should be stated.

original: de'i phyir yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúWhat is the result of karmic maturation?‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The result of karmic maturation is a neutral phenomenon.üîΩThe result of karmic maturation is only neutral and only a phenomenon that is said to be a sentient being.

original: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin zhing sems can du brjod pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par smin pa kho na sems can du brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin zhing sems can du brjod pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung gi / rnam par smin pa kho na sems can du brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the definite enumeration, but it is not that only the result of karmic maturation is said to be a sentient being.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rgyas pa las byung ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that it arises from natural outflow and enhancement, he says,

original: lung bstan phyis 'byung zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lung bstan phyis 'byung zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúarising after being declared.‚Äù

original: lung bstan pa'i phyi nas 'byung bas na lung bstan phyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa'i phyi nas 'byung bas na lung bstan phyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: Arising after being declared means arising after being declared.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúunobscured-indeterminate‚Äù is mentioned in order to clarify the two views: the afflicted view of the self and extreme view.

original: lta ba de gnyis ni sems tsam du ston pa dang / lung bstan phyis 'byung ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: lta ba de gnyis ni sems tsam du ston pa dang / lung bstan phyis 'byung ba yin mod kyi /
translated: These two views are taught to be mind only and they are subsequent states that are indeterminate.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin pas rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin pas rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: However, they are not unobscured-indeterminate states, and therefore they are not karmic maturation.

original: de lta na ni 'o na dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rgyu can yang lung du ma bstan pa'i phyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa'i rgyu can yang lung du ma bstan pa'i phyis 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: If that is so, then the great elements that are the basis of the sense faculties, which are enhanced by the cause of entering meditative attainment on the special actual basis of the first absorption, would be karmic maturation because they are subsequent states that are indeterminate and unobscured-indeterminate.

original: sems can du brjod pa'i phyir rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems can du brjod pa'i phyir rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
translated: And because they are called sentient beings.

original: de lta na rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dres par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa 'dres par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In that case, the presentation of the elements that are enhancement and karmic maturation would be mixed.

original: 'dres pa med de /üîΩrnam par @231a * //
analyzed: 'dres pa med de / rnam par @231a * //
translated: It is not mixed.

original: smin pa'i rgyu dang de'i 'bras bu dag ni sa tha dad pa nyid dam dus gcig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: smin pa'i rgyu dang de'i 'bras bu dag ni sa tha dad pa nyid dam dus gcig pa ma yin na /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation and its result are not of different levels or simultaneous.

original: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po brgyad pa dang / bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa dag ni dus gcig pa dang sa gnyis tha dad pa nyid yin pas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa las rnam par smin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po brgyad pa dang / bsam gtan gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa dag ni dus gcig pa dang sa gnyis tha dad pa nyid yin pas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas pa las rnam par smin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: However, the eight great elements of the sense faculties and those entering meditative attainment on the special actual basis of the first absorption are simultaneous and of different levels, but it is not that karmic maturation would arise from the augmentation of the great elements of the sense faculties.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩgang zhig de las dus phyi ma la 'byung zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / gang zhig de las dus phyi ma la 'byung zhing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says,

original: de dang lhan cig tu ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu ma yin no //
translated: That which arises later from that is not simultaneous with it.

original: de lta na 'o na sprul pa'i sems la yang thal bar 'gyur te /üîΩde yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dge ba las 'byung zhing /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na sprul pa'i sems la yang thal bar 'gyur te / de yang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dge ba las 'byung zhing /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that the mind governing emanation would also be so.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang sems can du brjod pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang sems can du brjod pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: That is because it arises from the virtuous mind of meditative attainment and it is not unobscured neutral or the mind that is called sentient being.

original: de'i phyir de ma thag tu ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ma thag tu ma yin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúit is not immediately after that.‚Äù

original: de ma thag pa ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i stobs kyis drangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ma thag pa ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i stobs kyis drangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is drawn out by the power of the immediately preceding condition,

original: sprul pa'i sems kyang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi de ma thag tu 'byung na /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems kyang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi de ma thag tu 'byung na /
translated: and because the mind of emanation occurs immediately after the mind of meditative equipoise,

original: rnam par smin pa ni de lta bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni de lta bu yang ma yin no //
translated: but karmic maturation does not occur in that way.

original: ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i don zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i don zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Why is it called the meaning of non-sentient things?

original: las las skyes pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du sems can du ston pa kho na rnam par smin pa yin la /
analyzed: las las skyes pa nyid du mtshungs bzhin du sems can du ston pa kho na rnam par smin pa yin la /
translated: Even though it is similar in being born from karma, only that which is sentient is karmic maturation,

original: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: but that which is non-sentient is not. What is the reason for this?

original: de'i phyir thun mong ba ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ba ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause it is not shared,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Karmic maturation is not shared.

original: rgyu gang la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yod pa de kho na la 'byung ba'i phyir de dang 'dra bar gzhan gyis myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yod pa de kho na la 'byung ba'i phyir de dang 'dra bar gzhan gyis myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result of karmic maturation arises only from that cause that possesses the result of karmic maturation and it is not experienced by another.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa gzhan gyis myong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The result of karmic maturation of karma committed by one person is not experienced by another.

original: de lta na ni ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud zos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang / byas pa chud zos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, one would encounter that which one has not done and that which one has done would perish.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir myong zhe na /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu sems can du ston pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir myong zhe na /
translated: Why is the dominant result of nonindicative form not experienced?

original: thun mong gi las las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thun mong gi las las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it arises from common karma.

original: de myong na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud zos pa med do //
analyzed: de myong na ma byas pa dang phrad pa dang byas pa chud zos pa med do //
translated: If it were experienced, one would encounter that which one has not done and that which one has done would perish.

original: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Natural outflow is similar to its cause.üîΩThe result of natural outflow is similar to its cause.

original: re zhig skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu rgyu dang dge ba dang mi dge ba lung du ma bstan par 'dra ba ni ris dang rang gi sa 'dra ba la ltos pa yin par gzung @231b la ;
analyzed: re zhig skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'i 'bras bu rgyu dang dge ba dang mi dge ba lung du ma bstan par 'dra ba ni ris dang rang gi sa 'dra ba la ltos pa yin par gzung @231b la ;
translated: The result of natural outflow of virtuous and nonvirtuous states is similar to its cause.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i ni nyon mongs pa can dang rang gi sa 'dra ba la ltos par ro //üîΩgal te kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yang 'dra ba yin na go //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i ni nyon mongs pa can dang rang gi sa 'dra ba la ltos par ro // gal te kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu yang 'dra ba yin na go //
translated: The pervasive cause is the cause of the afflicted view of the self and of the overesteeming of morality and asceticism of the realm of desire, of the first meditation and of the second meditation.

original: ci'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho nar mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho nar mi 'dod ce na /
translated: If the effect of the pervasive cause is similar to its cause, why is it not considered as homogeneous cause?

original: 'di ltar de ni sa dang nyon mongs pa can las 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sa dang nyon mongs pa can las 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The effect of the pervasive cause is similar to its cause from the point of view of stage and of the afflicted.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can kho na yin no //üîΩskal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rnam pa las kyang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can kho na yin no // skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du rnam pa las kyang ni ma yin te /
translated: The effect of the pervasive cause of the realm of desire is only afflicted of the realm of desire.

original: rnam pa lnga char yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga char yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not similar to its cause from the point of view of aspect, because the pervasive cause is the cause of five types of effect.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa las kyang 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin no ;üîΩ/ de la kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhig sa dang nyon mongs pa can las yin ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa las kyang 'bras bu dang 'dra ba yin no ;üîΩ/ de la kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu gang zhig sa dang nyon mongs pa can las yin ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The homogeneous cause is the cause of an effect similar to itself from the point of view of stage and of type.üîΩThe pervasive cause is not the cause of an effect similar to itself from the point of view of stage and of type.üîΩThe effect of the pervasive cause is not necessarily of the same stage as its cause.

original: rnam pa las kyang 'bras bu dang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa las kyang 'bras bu dang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do //
translated: And that which is similar to its result in terms of aspect is accepted as being a homogeneous cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig gang gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig gang gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin pa de zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: That is why it says, ‚ÄúThat which is a homogeneous cause of a certain factor is a homogeneous cause of the future homogeneous cause of that factor.‚Äù

original: kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu kho na'o //
translated: That which is not a pervasive cause is a homogeneous cause alone.

original: ris gzhan pa'i kun du 'gro ba ni kun du 'gro ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ris gzhan pa'i kun du 'gro ba ni kun du 'gro ba kho na'o //
translated: That which is a pervasive cause of another class is a pervasive cause alone.

original: gnyis ka yin pa ni rang gi ris pa'i kun du 'gro ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka yin pa ni rang gi ris pa'i kun du 'gro ba kho na'o //
translated: That which is both is a pervasive cause of its own class.

original: de ltar na mu gsum pa la bsams nas /
analyzed: de ltar na mu gsum pa la bsams nas /
translated: Thus, considering the fourth alternative,

original: gang zhig rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa las kyang 'dra ba de ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin par khas len pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is similar to its result in terms of aspect is accepted as being a homogeneous cause.‚ÄùüîΩThe fourth alternative is that which is excluded from the three alternatives.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu gsum du bshad pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mu gsum du bshad pa'i chos rnams ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that it is excluded from the factors explained in the three alternatives.

original: gang gi tshe dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mjug thogs su mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skye ba na snga ma de de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'am kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge ba la sogs pa rnams kyi mjug thogs su mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba skye ba na snga ma de de'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'am kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: When a dissimilar type arises immediately after wholesome states, etc., the former is not a homogeneous cause or omnipresent cause of the latter.

original: bral ba blo yis zad pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba blo yis zad pa'o //
translated: Disjunction is the termination of the possession of a nonvirtuous or neutral mind.

original: thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Obtainment is the acquisition of a nonobtainment.

original: 'gog pa smos pa ni ma thob pa tsam bral ba nyid yin pas dgag par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gog pa smos pa ni ma thob pa tsam bral ba nyid yin pas dgag par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mention of cessation is for the purpose of refuting that mere nonobtainment is disjunction.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs brjod pa ste /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs brjod pa ste /
translated: Therefore means that the reason is stated.üîΩBecause cessation is to be obtained by wisdom, it is explained that the result of the separation is analytical cessation.üîΩThe result that arises by the power of that is the result of conscious effort.üîΩThe result that arises by the power of that is the result of conscious effort.üîΩThe result that arises by the power of that is the result of conscious effort.

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa shes rab kyis thob par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba'i //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa shes rab kyis thob par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro // gang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba'i //

original: 'bras de skyes bu byed las skyes //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bras de skyes bu byed las skyes // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The result that arises by the power of that is the result of conscious effort.

original: rgyu @232a * //
analyzed: rgyu @232a * //
translated: The result that arises by the power of that is

original: gang gi stobs kyis 'bras bu gang zhig skye ba de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis 'bras bu gang zhig skye ba de ni de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That effect which arises by the power of a cause is the effect of human action of that cause.

original: dper na sa 'og ma pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dper na sa 'og ma pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, a higher realm arises from a lower realm.

original: 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu dang 'bras bu dag pa tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the cause and effect are different,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are contaminated and uncontaminated, and because they are virtuous and neutral.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin gyi /
translated: It is only the effect of human action,

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the effect of natural outflow.

original: de'i rgyu dang 'dra ba dang / rang gi sa pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang 'dra ba dang / rang gi sa pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Because it is asserted that the cause and effect are similar and of the same realm.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan yang bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzhan yang bsdu ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes other examples.

original: dper na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa las gzugs na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma do'i skad cig ma dang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa las gzugs na spyod pa'i srid pa bar ma do'i skad cig ma dang po lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the first moment of the intermediate existence of the form realm arises from a virtuous or neutral mind of death in the desire realm.

original: skyes bu byed pas thob pa'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la /üîΩso sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis thob pas de yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pas thob pa'i 'bras bu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa yang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis thob pas de yang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The result obtained by the power of the person is the result of conscious effort.üîΩAnd because the cessation resulting from deliberation is obtained by the power of deliberation, it is also the result of conscious effort.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The result of the cessation resulting from deliberation is the result of conscious effort.

original: ji ltar na de 'dir gzung ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na de 'dir gzung ba yin /
translated: How is that obtained here?

original: de ni skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni skye ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not produced.

original: nga'i nor skyes so zhes thob pa la yang skyes pa'i sgra brjod pa mthong ste /
analyzed: nga'i nor skyes so zhes thob pa la yang skyes pa'i sgra brjod pa mthong ste /
translated: We see that the word produced is used for obtaining, as in My wealth is produced.

original: bdag gis nor thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gis nor thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is I have obtained wealth.üîΩThe cessation resulting from deliberation is the result of the path because it is the result of the path.

original: de la bar chad med pa'i lam gang dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa de dag gi ni spangs pa ste bral ba'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: de la bar chad med pa'i lam gang dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa de dag gi ni spangs pa ste bral ba'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The result of the cessation resulting from deliberation is the result of conscious effort.

original: gang dag gis ma 'ongs pa sngar spangs pa rnams kyi bral ba 'ba' zhig thob pa de dag ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang dag gis ma 'ongs pa sngar spangs pa rnams kyi bral ba 'ba' zhig thob pa de dag ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu kho na yin te /
translated: Those who obtain the mere freedom from those previously abandoned in the future are only the result of conscious effort.

original: dper na nges pa la 'jug pa na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas phra rgyas bcu po dag spangs pa /
analyzed: dper na nges pa la 'jug pa na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas phra rgyas bcu po dag spangs pa /
translated: For example, when entering the state of an arhat, the ten negative tendencies abandoned by the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering are the result of conscious effort and the result of separation.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu khon yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la 'dod chags dang bral ba sngon du 'gro ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu khon yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Those free from attachment to the desire realm are free from attachment and the result of conscious effort, but they are only the result of conscious effort of those previously freed from attachment.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //üîΩsngon byung ba ma yin pa'i 'dus byas kho na 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras bu yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o // sngon byung ba ma yin pa'i 'dus byas kho na 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras bu yin gyi /
translated: This should be applied in the same way to other states.üîΩOnly conditioned states that are not previously arisen are the dominant results of conditioned states.

original: 'dus ma byas ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma yin zhing /
translated: They are not the dominant result of unconditioned states.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ste /
translated: This is ascertained because it is said that unconditioned states are not the dominant result of conditioned states.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu kho @232b na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu kho @232b na ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not the dominant result of conditioned states.

original: sngon byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba las gzhan sngon ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: sngon byung ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba las gzhan sngon ma byung ba'o //
translated: That which is not already arisen is that which is other than what is already arisen, that which has not yet arisen.

original: de ni lhan cig byung ba dang / phyis byung ba ste /
analyzed: de ni lhan cig byung ba dang / phyis byung ba ste /
translated: That is simultaneous and subsequent.

original: rgyu bas sngar skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rgyu bas sngar skyes pa'i 'bras bu ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest effect that arises prior to its cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the cause would be pointless.

original: sngar 'khor los sgyur ba nyid byed cing phyis der 'gyur ba'i las byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: sngar 'khor los sgyur ba nyid byed cing phyis der 'gyur ba'i las byed par 'gyur na /
translated: If one were to act first as a universal monarch and then act in such a way as to become that,

original: myu gu la sogs pa rnams kyi sngon du sa bon 'gro ba nyid du mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa rnams kyi sngon du sa bon 'gro ba nyid du mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: then it would contradict what is seen, because the priority of the seed is seen in the case of sprouts and so on.

original: 'bras bu skyes zin pas 'das pa ltar rgyu bya ba byas zin pa'i phyir mi skye bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes zin pas 'das pa ltar rgyu bya ba byas zin pa'i phyir mi skye bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as an arisen effect does not arise again because its cause has already performed its function, so too it would not arise because the past cause has already arisen.

original: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni de nyid de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bur rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni de nyid de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bur rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'dri ba'o //
translated: What is the difference between the results of conscious effort and dominant result?

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni byed pa po'i yin no zhes bya ba la /üîΩgang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni byed pa po'i yin no zhes bya ba la / gang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba //
translated: The result of conscious effort is the result of the agent.üîΩThe result that arises by the power of that is the result of conscious effort.üîΩThe result that arises by the power of that is the result of conscious effort.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa'i yang yin te zhes bya ba'i yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bdag po'i 'bras bu byed pa po'i yang yin pa ste /üîΩdper na bzo bo rnams kyi bzo skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa'i yang yin te zhes bya ba'i yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bdag po'i 'bras bu byed pa po'i yang yin pa ste / dper na bzo bo rnams kyi bzo skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The result that arises by the power of that is the result of conscious effort.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin no //üîΩgzhan dag gis bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu yang yin no //üîΩgzhan dag gis bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The result that arises by the power of

original: bzo bo ma yin pa gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa dag gi ni bzo de bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin gyi skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bzo bo ma yin pa gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa dag gi ni bzo de bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin gyi skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin no //
translated: The result of the dominant condition is the result of the dominant condition alone, not the result of conscious effort.

original: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩlnga po da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar bar bya'o // lnga po da ltar 'bras bu 'dzin //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to other conditions.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five possess results in the present.

original: da ltar kho na zhes nges par gzung gi / lnga po kho na zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar kho na zhes nges par gzung gi / lnga po kho na zhes bya bar ni ma yin te /
translated: The present alone is ascertained, not just the five alone.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dag 'dra mod kyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dag 'dra mod kyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe efficient cause is similar to those.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'phen pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'phen pa ste /
translated: Possessing a result means projecting a result.

original: dngos po gzhan skyed par bya ba la rgyu'i dngos por nye bar 'gro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan skyed par bya ba la rgyu'i dngos por nye bar 'gro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúapproaching the state of a cause in order to generate another thing‚Äù

original: de ni da ltar ba kho na la yod do //
analyzed: de ni da ltar ba kho na la yod do //
translated: That exists in the present alone.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dang 'dra mod kyi zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba kho na 'bras bu 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang de dang 'dra mod kyi zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba kho na 'bras bu 'dzin gyi /
translated: The efficient cause is similar to that.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the past and future.

original: gal te @233a * //
analyzed: gal te @233a * //
translated: If that is so,

original: de ltar na de yang da ltar ba 'bras bu 'dzin to zhes ci ste ma smras she na /
analyzed: de ltar na de yang da ltar ba 'bras bu 'dzin to zhes ci ste ma smras she na /
translated: why don‚Äôt you say that the present also possesses a result?

original: de'i phyir de ni 'bras bu dang bcas par ma nges pas ma brjod do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'bras bu dang bcas par ma nges pas ma brjod do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúBecause it is not definite that it possesses a result.‚Äù

original: 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because unconditioned states do not have a result.

original: gnyis ni rab tu 'byin par byed ces bya ba la ;
analyzed: gnyis ni rab tu 'byin par byed ces bya ba la ;
translated: Two generate,

original: da ltar ba dag kho na zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar ba dag kho na zhes bya bar nges par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: you should ascertain that only the present generates,

original: gnyis kho na zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kho na zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that only two generate.

original: dus mnyam pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are simultaneous,

original: rgyu'i dang po'i dus kho nar 'bras bu phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i dang po'i dus kho nar 'bras bu phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result is generated at the very time of the cause.

original: da ltar gyi dang 'das pa dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dang 'das pa dag ces bya ba la /
translated: The present and the past generate,

original: skabs su bab pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'byin par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i phyir 'bras bu 'byin par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: because the context is that of generating a result.

original: da ltar ba dag rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa mi srid do snyam ste /
analyzed: da ltar ba dag rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa mi srid do snyam ste /
translated: It is impossible for the present to generate a result that is a natural outflow.

original: re zhig gang 'das pa dag ni zhes dri ba rgyas par 'byung ngo /
analyzed: re zhig gang 'das pa dag ni zhes dri ba rgyas par 'byung ngo /
translated: The question is asked: ‚ÄúWhat is the result of past action?

original: mjug thogs su bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: mjug thogs su bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: ‚Äù The answer is: ‚ÄúBecause it is the result of the immediately preceding condition.‚Äù

original: de la 'bras bu gang zhig skal pa mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro pa'i rgyu dag gi yin par nges shing de dag gi mjug thogs su skye ba de ni de dag gi 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin la /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu gang zhig skal pa mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro pa'i rgyu dag gi yin par nges shing de dag gi mjug thogs su skye ba de ni de dag gi 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin la /
