translated: The result of the homogeneous cause and the universal cause is determined to be the result of the immediately preceding condition.

original: rgyu dag 'gags na ni gzung ba dang phyung zin pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dag 'gags na ni gzung ba dang phyung zin pa yin no //
translated: When the causes have ceased, the result has been taken up and projected.

original: de nyid kyi tshe ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not at that time.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: phyis kyang phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis kyang phyung ba yin no //
translated: Later, it is projected.

original: 'on te 'gags pa dag las 'bras bu skyes pa ni de lta na 'das pa dag gis 'bras bu phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'gags pa dag las 'bras bu skyes pa ni de lta na 'das pa dag gis 'bras bu phyung ba yin no //
translated: If the result arises from causes that have ceased, then the result is projected by the past causes.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu yang zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The efficient cause should also be mentioned.

original: cung zad cig ni byed rgyu da ltar byung ba'i yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni byed rgyu da ltar byung ba'i yang bdag po'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Some results of the efficient cause are the dominant result of the present.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the visual consciousness.

original: cung zad cig ni de ma thag tu yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni de ma thag tu yin te /
translated: Some are immediately antecedent conditions,

original: dper na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering among the supreme mundane factors.

original: cung zad cig ni dus gzhan gyi tshe yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni dus gzhan gyi tshe yin te /
translated: Some are at another time,

original: dper na thar pa'i cha dang ma thun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi byang chub gsum lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: dper na thar pa'i cha dang ma thun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi byang chub gsum lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: for example, the three enlightenments with regard to the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: 'di ma smos pa'i rgyu sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ma smos pa'i rgyu sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The reason for not mentioning the others has been explained earlier.

original: dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúvirtuous homogeneous cause.‚Äù

original: mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dang rgyun la mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dang rgyun la mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This refers to non-associated compositional factors and the continuum.

original: tha mar 'dor pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha mar 'dor pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúat the end, they are relinquished.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du'i chung du rnams kyi thob pa thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba dag ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du'i chung du rnams kyi thob pa thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba dag ste /
translated: All the obtainments of the smallest of the small roots of virtue are relinquished at the end.

original: gzhan dag ni sngar ngor zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sngar ngor zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The others are relinquished earlier.

original: de dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi @233b 'byin pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi @233b 'byin pa ni ma yin te //
translated: They are only the cause that maintains the result and not the cause that produces the result.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i gnas skabs na dge ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i gnas skabs na dge ba mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the root of virtue is severed, virtue does not arise.

original: gnyis pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gi nyid mtshams sbyor bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gi nyid mtshams sbyor bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second is when one links with the roots of virtue.

original: 'byin pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byin pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi /
translated: It is only the act of producing,

original: 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: not the act of holding,

original: sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di skad du de dag nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro // 'di skad du de dag nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: because it has already been held.üîΩThe third is when one obtains what was previously nonexistent.

original: snga na med pa rnyed na 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin par srid pa'i phyir de dag nyid ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa rnyed na 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin par srid pa'i phyir de dag nyid ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since it is possible that it holds and produces its result, it should be called that which holds and produces its result.

original: gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o //üîΩzhes bya ba ;
analyzed: gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o // zhes bya ba ;
translated: The fourth is in the remaining states.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i gnas skabs gnyis po ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i gnas skabs gnyis po ma gtogs pa /
translated: The remaining states are those that are not included in the two states just explained.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams gzung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du ma chad pa'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams gzung ste /
translated: The remaining states are those in which the root of virtue is not severed.

original: bdag cag la sogs pa lta bu'i thob pa dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin no /
analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pa lta bu'i thob pa dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin no /
translated: Obtainment of the roots of virtue in the remaining states is the act of holding and producing its result.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth is when one obtains what was previously nonexistent.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i gnas skabs ni sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin la ;
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa'i gnas skabs ni sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin la ;
translated: The state of complete severence of the root of virtue is not maintained, because it was previously obtained.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid ma tshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid ma tshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not generated, because the root of virtue itself is not connected.

original: mi dge ba'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nonvirtuous states

original: mi dge ba rnams kyi thob pa thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba ste /üîΩthob pa de dag tu ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams kyi thob pa thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba ste / thob pa de dag tu ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: are relinquished at the end of all obtainment.

original: 'byin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Obtainment of nonvirtuous states is maintained but not generated,

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de ma thag pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthams cad kyi dang por thob pa'i mi dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu 'byin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu de ma thag pa med pa'i phyir ro // thams cad kyi dang por thob pa'i mi dge ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu 'byin pa yin gyi /
translated: because the result of natural outflow does not immediately follow.

original: 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The first nonvirtuous homogeneous cause that is obtained generates its result but does not maintain it,

original: sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it was previously obtained.

original: 'di skad du de dag nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'di skad du de dag nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharmakosa:

original: mi dge pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'byin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi dge pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu 'di ni 'byin pa yin gyi /
translated: Nonvirtuous states are relinquished at the end of all obtainment.

original: 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that they are grasped,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dus su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is free from attachment at the time they are obtained.

original: thob pa gang dag sngon med pa dang por rnyed pa de dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: thob pa gang dag sngon med pa dang por rnyed pa de dag ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yang yin no //
translated: Those that are obtained for the first time, which were not previously obtained, are both the cause that projects and the cause that produces their effect.

original: gsum pa ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third is in the remaining states in which one is not free from attachment.üîΩThe first and second states are as they have been explained.

original: gnas skabs dang po dang gnyis pa ji skad du bshad pa de dag gnyis kho na ma gtogs pa gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs dang po dang gnyis pa ji skad du bshad pa de dag gnyis kho na ma gtogs pa gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su ste /
translated: The remaining states are those that are not included in those two.

original: kho bo cag gi lta bu mi dge ba'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi lta bu mi dge ba'i skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa yin no //
translated: The homogeneous cause of nonvirtue is both the cause that projects and the cause that produces its effect, as in our own system.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam @234a * //üîΩpa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam @234a * // pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth is in states other than those.

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral pa'i gnas skabs na sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral pa'i gnas skabs na sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir mi 'dzin la /
translated: In the state of being free from attachment to the desire realm, it does not grasp its effect because it has already grasped it.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las nyams pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las nyams pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not emitted by the degeneration of freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i yang de bzhin du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Obscured neutral states are also like that.

original: dri ba la mu bzhi dgra bcom nyid thob pa dang / yongs su nyams pa las ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩmu dang po'i srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa dang ldan pas thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba'i thob pa gang dag yin pa'o ;
analyzed: dri ba la mu bzhi dgra bcom nyid thob pa dang / yongs su nyams pa las ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o // mu dang po'i srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa dang ldan pas thams cad kyi tha mar 'dor ba'i thob pa gang dag yin pa'o ;
translated: The four possibilities in response to the question are:üîΩThe first possibility is the obtainment of the final state that is obtained by one who obtains freedom from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: / gnyis pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pas thams cad kyi dang por thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: / gnyis pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams pas thams cad kyi dang por thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The second possibility is the obtainment of the first state that is obtained by one who degenerates from freedom from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: gsum pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gnas skabs lhag ma rnams su'o //
translated: The third possibility is the remaining states that are not free from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The fourth possibility is states that are not included in those.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las ma nyams pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba las ma nyams pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot degenerated from freedom from attachment to the summit of existence‚Äù is understood.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa smos pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúobstructed indeterminate‚Äù should be applied to the afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the form and formless realms.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyar bar bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyar bar bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúunobstructed indeterminate‚Äù should be applied to the latter phrase.

original: phyis dri ba'i tshig gis gang du don go bar byed pa ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: phyis dri ba'i tshig gis gang du don go bar byed pa ni tshig phyi ma dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The latter phrase is applied to that which causes understanding of the meaning through a subsequent question.

original: re zhig 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni 'dzin pa yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re zhig 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni 'dzin pa yang yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is an issuing cause is also an appropriating cause.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An unobstructed indeterminate homogeneous cause exists until one passes into nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: 'dzin la mi 'byin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'dzin la mi 'byin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is appropriating but not issuing.

original: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩde'i tshe ni phung po thams cad las nges par byung ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med pas 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste / de'i tshe ni phung po thams cad las nges par byung ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu med pas 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: They are the final aggregates of an arhat.

original: 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, they are only apprehended, not emitted, because they are definitely separated from all aggregates and thus do not have a result that is a natural outflow.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nges pas ni skad cig re re ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i nges pas ni skad cig re re ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those that are associated with objects are momentary.

original: sngar ni dmigs pa med pa thob pa rnams dang / rgyun la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du bshad la /
analyzed: sngar ni dmigs pa med pa thob pa rnams dang / rgyun la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du bshad la /
translated: Previously, it was explained that those that obtain the state of being free from attachment are homogeneous causes in a continuum.

original: da ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang skad cig re re la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: da ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang skad cig re re la skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du brjod do //
translated: Now it is said that those that are associated with objects are homogeneous causes in each moment.

original: dge ba'i @234b sems kyi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba'i @234b sems kyi mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la /
translated: Immediately after a virtuous mind.

original: dge ba'i sems skyes pas dge ba'i sems rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid du gzung ba gang yin pa de de'i mjug thogs su mi skye bas 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems skyes pas dge ba'i sems rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid du gzung ba gang yin pa de de'i mjug thogs su mi skye bas 'bras bu 'dzin pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: When a virtuous mind arises, it is the result of a virtuous mind that is similar to its cause.

original: 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But since it does not arise immediately after that virtuous mind, it is a result that is held but not projected.

original: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The second is the opposite of that.

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba'i sems mngon du byed pa de'i tshe sngar 'gags pa'i dge ba'i sems de 'byin pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba'i sems mngon du byed pa de'i tshe sngar 'gags pa'i dge ba'i sems de 'byin pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: When a virtuous mind manifests immediately after a nonvirtuous or neutral mind, then the virtuous mind that previously ceased projects that virtuous mind.

original: 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not hold it,

original: sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bzung zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it was previously held.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth is that which is not included in those three.

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can nam mi dge ba'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can nam lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed pa de'i tshe dge ba'i sems de sngar bzung ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can nam mi dge ba'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can nam lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed pa de'i tshe dge ba'i sems de sngar bzung ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'dzin la /
translated: When a virtuous mind manifests immediately after a nonvirtuous or neutral mind, then the virtuous mind does not hold its result because it was previously held.

original: rigs mi mthun pa'i sems kyis bar du chod pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa'i sems kyis bar du chod pa'i phyir 'byin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it that which is emitted by a mind of a different type intervening.

original: mi dge ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dge ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The same should be applied to nonvirtuous and so on.

original: mu dang po ni gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba 'am lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su dge ba 'am lung du ma bstan pa'i sems mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is when a virtuous or neutral mind manifests immediately after a nonvirtuous mind.

original: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: The second is the reverse.

original: gsum pa ni gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi dge ba kho na skye ba'o //üîΩbzhi pa ni gang gi tshe dge ba 'am lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba 'am /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi dge ba kho na skye ba'o // bzhi pa ni gang gi tshe dge ba 'am lung du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su dge ba 'am /
translated: The third is when a nonvirtuous mind arises immediately after a nonvirtuous mind.

original: lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The fourth is when a virtuous or neutral mind manifests immediately after a virtuous or neutral mind.

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Obscured and unobscured neutral minds should be applied in the same way.

original: gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: One is emitted by a past cause.

original: gcig ni 'das pa kho nas zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gcig ni 'das pa kho nas zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: One is called past only,

original: gcig kho na 'das pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig kho na 'das pas ni ma yin te /
translated: but not one that is past alone.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa kho nas 'bras bu 'byin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni 'das pa kho nas 'bras bu 'byin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the result of the cause of karmic maturation is produced only by the past.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause there is no karmic maturation that is simultaneous

original: 'di ltar lhan cig gam //üîΩde ma thag tu rnam par smin pa ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig gam // de ma thag tu rnam par smin pa ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: or immediately subsequent.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rgyun la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rgyun la ltos pa yin no //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is dependent on a continuum.

original: 'di la brten pas na rten no //
analyzed: 'di la brten pas na rten no //
translated: That which is supported by this is supported.

original: rten gyi 'bras bu ni rten gyi 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rten gyi 'bras bu ni rten gyi 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result of the supported is the result of the supported.

original: gang zhig gang la brten pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la brten pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That which is supported by this is the result of this.

original: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The result of preparation is the result of preparation.

original: mi sdug pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te mi skye ba shis pa'i bar lta bu'o /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te mi skye ba shis pa'i bar lta bu'o /
translated: For example, from the beginning of the application of mindfulness of repulsiveness up to the knowledge of nonarising.

original: sbyor ba @235a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba @235a * //
translated: The result of preparation

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste //
translated: should be applied in the same way to other preparations.

original: mi sdug pa smos pa ni 'dir dpe'i don du yin no //
analyzed: mi sdug pa smos pa ni 'dir dpe'i don du yin no //
translated: The unpleasant is mentioned here as an example.

original: tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ni tshogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of the assemblage is the effect of the assemblage.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of meditation is the effect of meditation.

original: de la kha cig na re ni rten gyi 'bras bu bdag po'i 'bras bu'i khongs su 'du'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la kha cig na re ni rten gyi 'bras bu bdag po'i 'bras bu'i khongs su 'du'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the effect of the support is included in the effect of dominance.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: thams cad kyang skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi khongs su 'du'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag gi khongs su 'du'o zhes zer ro //
translated: All are included in the effect of human action and the effect of dominance.

original: de la chos gang zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de la chos gang zhig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: With regard to that, it is said in detail:

original: chos dag ni mang ste de dag re re nas rgyas par bshad par mi nus pas thams cad phung po bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos dag ni mang ste de dag re re nas rgyas par bshad par mi nus pas thams cad phung po bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: There are many phenomena, and it is not possible to explain each one in detail, so all are established in four aggregates.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdor bsdu na chos kyi rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag kho na yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdor bsdu na chos kyi rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag kho na yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said: In brief, there are just these four aspects of phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya bas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dge ba dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat are defiled‚Äù refers to those that are nonvirtuous due to being associated with attachment and so on, those that are obscured and neutral, and those that are concomitant with them.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnams so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat arise from karmic maturation‚Äù refers to those that are the result of karmic maturation.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbang po rnams ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbang po rnams ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe uncontaminated faculties‚Äù refers to those that are concomitant with the perseverance for Dharma knowledge regarding the truth of suffering.

original: rnam par smin pa ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma bstan pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are neutral, except for those that arise from karmic maturation‚Äù refers to

original: de dag ni spyod lam pa dang / gzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de dag ni spyod lam pa dang / gzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa thams cad do //
translated: those that are the four that are related to deportment, the four that are related to skill in arts and crafts, and all those that are related to emanations.

original: dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are virtuous‚Äù refers to those that are contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: ji skad du bshad pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las skye bas na lhag ma las skyes so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las skye bas na lhag ma las skyes so //
translated: Those that arise from the remainder are those that arise from the remainder of those that have been explained.

original: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúafflicted phenomena‚Äù is expanded in the Abhidharmako≈õa:

original: rnam par smin pa ni chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can rnams skyes pa las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can rnams skyes pa las rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: because they are not karmic maturation, they are not karmic maturation.

original: de la sems las byung ba lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang sems ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag yin no //
analyzed: de la sems las byung ba lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang sems ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag yin no //
translated: The coemergent mental factors and the mind are the coemergent and concomitant causes of the mind and mental factors.

original: de bzhin du sems las byung ba dag la yang so sor brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems las byung ba dag la yang so sor brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for each of the mental factors.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rang gi ris dang sa pa'i chos nyon mongs pa can sngar skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rang gi ris dang sa pa'i chos nyon mongs pa can sngar skyes pa rnams so //
translated: Homogeneous causes are afflicted phenomena of one‚Äôs own class and level that arose in a former moment.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni kun du 'gro ba'i rang gi sar sngar skyes pa rnams @235b so ;
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i rgyu ni kun du 'gro ba'i rang gi sar sngar skyes pa rnams @235b so ;
translated: Omnipresent causes are those that arose in a former moment and are omnipresent.

original: / byed rgyu'i rgyu ni ci rigs par rang ma gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: / byed rgyu'i rgyu ni ci rigs par rang ma gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Active causes are all phenomena, except for the phenomenon itself.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexcept for the pervasive cause‚Äù is stated.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: The pervasive cause is only for those that are afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi ma yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnams kyi ma yin la /
translated: It is not for those that are not afflicted.

original: rnam par smin pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de'i rgyu de nyid yin pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de'i rgyu de nyid yin pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Since the cause of karmic maturation is not afflicted, it is excluded from being the cause of that pervasive cause.

original: 'dir yang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, the co-existent cause and the associated cause are as previously explained.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni lung du bstan pa sngar skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ni lung du bstan pa sngar skyes pa rnams so //
translated: The homogeneous cause is a previously arisen that is declared.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de dag gang dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni de dag gang dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa mi dge ba dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is that which is the effect of the cause of karmic maturation. It is non-virtuous and virtuous contaminated states.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The active cause is as previously explained.

original: rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexcept for the cause of karmic maturation and the pervasive cause‚Äù is stated.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs la /
translated: Because they are not karmic maturation, they are excluded from the cause of karmic maturation.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs so //
translated: Because they are not afflictive, they are excluded from the cause of universal occurrence.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kho na yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kho na yin no //
translated: Coemergent causes and concomitant causes are only coemergent.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The homogeneous cause should be explained as appropriate.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The active cause is like the former.

original: rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Excluding the cause of karmic maturation and the cause of universal occurrence and the homogeneous cause.

original: de dang 'dra ba sngar skyes pa med pa'i phyir dang / dge ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba sngar skyes pa med pa'i phyir dang / dge ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no previously arisen state similar to it and because it is virtuous,

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs so //
translated: it is excluded from the homogeneous cause, the cause of universal occurrence and the cause of karmic maturation.

original: 'dir yang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni lhan cig 'byung ba rnams kho na yin no //
translated: Here, co-existent causes and associated causes are only co-existent.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The efficient cause is as before.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu smos pa'i phyir /
translated: Because associated causes are mentioned,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba yin par shes te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba yin par shes te /
translated: it is understood that they are only mind and mental factors.

original: de lta ma yin na de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu smos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, they would not be mentioned as associated causes.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig pu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig pu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for the single associated cause,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu med do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir de dag la mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu med do //
translated: because they are not of the nature of mind and mental factors, they do not have associated causes.

original: nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams dang / lhag ma rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams dang / lhag ma rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: Other defiled and so on means defiled, arisen from karmic maturation, remaining, and uncontaminated things.

original: @236a * // de la nyon mongs pa can rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @236a * // de la nyon mongs pa can rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are afflicted‚Äù refers toüîΩafflicted form and afflicted non-associated compositional factors.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi gzugs dang nyon mongs pa can gyi ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa bzhi las so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi gzugs dang nyon mongs pa can gyi ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa bzhi las so //
translated: They arise from four causes: the co-existent cause, the homogeneous cause, the pervasive cause, and the ripening cause.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that arise from the ripening cause‚Äù refers to

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa bzhi las so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ma gtogs pa bzhi las so zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: those that arise from four causes: the co-existent cause, the pervasive cause, the cause of similar lot, and the ripening cause.

original: de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i ldan pa yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs dang rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i ldan pa yin pa rnams so //
translated: They are the form that arises from the ripening cause and the associated factors that arise from the ripening cause.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gsum las so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gsum las so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe remaining ones‚Äù refers toüîΩthose that are not afflicted and not arisen from the ripening cause.üîΩThey arise from three causes: the co-existent cause, the cause of similar lot, and the ripening cause.

original: lhag ma'i gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / byed rgyu'i rgyu dang gsum las skye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / byed rgyu'i rgyu dang gsum las skye'o //
translated: The remaining form and the non-associated compositional factors arise from three causes: co-arising cause, homogeneous cause, and the cause of karmic maturation, excluding the concomitant cause and the pervasive cause.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni gnyis las te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po ni gnyis las te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first uncontaminated states arise from two causes.

original: zag pa med pa'i dang po gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni byed rgyu'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag las so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dang po gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams ni byed rgyu'i rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag las so //
translated: The first uncontaminated states, which are not associated with form, arise from the cause of karmic maturation and the co-arising cause.

original: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu gcig las byung ba'i chos ni med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are no phenomena that arise from one cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang byed rgyu'i rgyu dag phan tshun mi 'khrul pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang byed rgyu'i rgyu dag phan tshun mi 'khrul pa'i phyir la /
translated: Co-arising causes and the cause of karmic maturation are mutually inclusive.

original: rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir dus thams cad du skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir dus thams cad du skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not dependent on co-producing causes, they would arise at all times.

original: sngar rgyu dang rkyen dag med pa ni /
analyzed: sngar rgyu dang rkyen dag med pa ni /
translated: Previously, there were no causes and conditions.

original: skye ba bskyed bya skyed byed min //
analyzed: skye ba bskyed bya skyed byed min //
translated: The arising of arising does not give rise to itself.

original: zhes bshad pa de la rgyu rnams ni grangs dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / 'bras bu'i sgo nas bstan na /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa de la rgyu rnams ni grangs dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / 'bras bu'i sgo nas bstan na /
translated: The causes have been presented in terms of number, intrinsic nature, and result.üîΩNow, the conditions should be presented in terms of their intrinsic nature and function.

original: da ni rkyen rnams dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / byed pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya dgos so zhes 'dri ba ni rkyen rnams gang zhe na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ni rkyen rnams dang / rang gi ngo bo dang / byed pa'i sgo nas brjod par bya dgos so zhes 'dri ba ni rkyen rnams gang zhe na zhes bya'o //
translated: The question, ‚ÄúWhat are the conditions?‚Äù

original: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs //
analyzed: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs //
translated: It is said that there are four conditions.

original: gang nas gsungs zhes bya ba ni mdo las sam 'on te chos mngon ba las gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang nas gsungs zhes bya ba ni mdo las sam 'on te chos mngon ba las gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From where is it said? Is it said in the sutras or in the Abhidharma?

original: de'i phyir mdo las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúin the sutras.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: It is taught as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das kho nas bstan gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho nas bstan gyi /
translated: Only the BhagavƒÅn taught it,

original: chos mngon pa pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: not the Abhidharma masters.

original: rkyen du 'dra ba ni rkyen nyid do //
analyzed: rkyen du 'dra ba ni rkyen nyid do //
translated: Similarity of conditions is a condition.

original: 'dir dngos po'i rkyen gyis bstan pa ni 'dra ba nye bar blangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po'i rkyen gyis bstan pa ni 'dra ba nye bar blangs pa'o //
translated: Here, the condition of an entity is taught as similarity.

original: thams cad rang bzhin tha dad pa yin yang rkyen gyi dngos po las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: thams cad rang bzhin tha dad pa yin yang rkyen gyi dngos po las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Although all are different by nature, they do not go beyond being conditions.

original: rkyen gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi rten to snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi rigs rnam pa bzhi rten to snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: One should think that they are the four types of conditions.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin //üîΩzhes bya @236b ba la /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin // zhes bya @236b ba la /
translated: The cause is five causes.

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni lnga kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni lnga kho na yin gyi /
translated: The causal condition is only five causes.

original: lnga rgyu'i rkyen kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lnga rgyu'i rkyen kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: But five causes are not only causal conditions.

original: de dag kyang mi shes pas byed rgyu'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi shes pas byed rgyu'i rgyu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since they are not understood, the Abhidharmakosa states, ‚Äúexcluding the active cause.‚Äù

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the active cause is not a causal condition?

original: bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it occurs in the treatise.

original: bstan bcos las rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos las rgyu'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, ‚ÄúWhat is a causal condition?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: All conditioned phenomena.‚Äù

original: chos 'dus ma byas ma smos pas rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po dag yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos 'dus ma byas ma smos pas rgyu'i rkyen ni rgyu lnga po dag yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since unconditioned phenomena are not mentioned, it is established that the causal condition is the five causes.

original: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
translated: Arisen minds and mental factors

original: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag //
analyzed: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag //
translated: The last is not similar and is immediate.üîΩ

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The last is not a similar antecedent.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba smos pas //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba smos pas //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmind and mental factors‚Äù

original: gzugs dang 'dus ma byas dang ldan pa yin pa gsal ba'i sgo nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro
analyzed: gzugs dang 'dus ma byas dang ldan pa yin pa gsal ba'i sgo nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin gyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ni ma yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro
translated: is stated in order to clarify that only mind and mental factors are similar and immediately antecedent conditions, not form or unconditioned dharmas.

original: // sems dang sems las byung ba dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // sems dang sems las byung ba dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Mind and mental factors are of two kinds:

original: tha ma dang tha ma ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: tha ma dang tha ma ma yin pa dag go //
translated: last and not last.

original: tha ma dag ni gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: tha ma dag ni gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: The last are those that are not followed by mind and mental factors.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa'i dus kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa'i dus kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the last moment of thought of an arhat who is about to enter parinirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: tha ma ma yin pa de dag ni gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: tha ma ma yin pa de dag ni gang dag gi mjug thogs su sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'o //
translated: Those that are not last are those that are followed by mind and mental factors.

original: de'i phyir tha ma gsal ba'i sgo nas phyi ma dang bcas pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir tha ma ma yin pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha ma gsal ba'i sgo nas phyi ma dang bcas pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir tha ma ma yin pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúnot the last‚Äù is stated in order to show that the last is a similar and immediately antecedent condition by way of clarity and by way of possessing a subsequent state.

original: skyes pa rnams zhes bya bas ni ma 'ongs pa pa gsal ba'i sgo nas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams zhes bya bas ni ma 'ongs pa pa gsal ba'i sgo nas 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that have arisen‚Äù indicates that future states are included by way of clarity in the past and present.

original: rkyen 'di ni mtshungs pa yang yin de ma thag pa yang yin pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rkyen 'di ni mtshungs pa yang yin de ma thag pa yang yin pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis condition is similar and immediately antecedent‚Äù shows that only minds and mental factors possess the meaning of similar and immediately antecedent conditions.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no zhes ston to //
translated: Other states do not possess that meaning.

original: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyud gcig la rdzas rigs mthun pa gnyis mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyud gcig la rdzas rigs mthun pa gnyis mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSimilar‚Äù means that two states of similar type do not possess similar and immediately antecedent conditions in a single mindstream.

original: de ma thag tu zhes bya ba rdzas rigs mthun pas bar du ma chod pa'i 'bras @237a * //üîΩbu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu zhes bya ba rdzas rigs mthun pas bar du ma chod pa'i 'bras @237a * // bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Immediately is a result that is not obstructed by a homogeneous substance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi mnyam par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi mnyam par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, form is not a condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent because it arises unequally.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: It is not a condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent because the meaning of equivalent and immediate antecedent is absent.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the meaning of equivalent and immediate antecedent is absent, he says:

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Because form belonging to the desire realm...

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni so sor thar ba'i sngom pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa ni so sor thar ba'i sngom pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Form belonging to the desire realm is the non-informative form of the prƒÅtimok·π£a vow.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni bsam gtan gyi sngom pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni bsam gtan gyi sngom pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Form belonging to the form realm is the form of the meditative absorption vow.

original: zag pa med pa ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The uncontaminated is the form of the uncontaminated vow.

original: gang gi tshe sngom pa blangs pa bsam gtan nam lam la snyoms par mi 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs las 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na 'byung ngo //üîΩgang gi tshe snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe na 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngom pa blangs pa bsam gtan nam lam la snyoms par mi 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs las 'dod pa na spyod pa kho na 'byung ngo // gang gi tshe snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe na 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When one who has taken up the vows does not enter meditative attainment of the absorptions or the path, then nonindicative form of the desire realm arises from nonindicative form of the desire realm.üîΩWhen one enters meditative attainment, then nonindicative form of the desire realm and the form realm arises.

original: gang gi tshe lam la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa 'byung bas gzugs mngon du 'gyur ba 'chol ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lam la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i tshe ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa 'byung bas gzugs mngon du 'gyur ba 'chol ba yin no //
translated: When one enters the path, then nonindicative form of the desire realm and uncontaminated states arises. Thus the manifestation of form is mixed.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni 'chol ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni 'chol ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The immediately preceding condition is not mixed.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi mjug thogs su ni nam yang 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang // zag pa med pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi mjug thogs su ni nam yang 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang // zag pa med pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Immediately after minds and mental factors of the desire realm, never do desire realm, form realm and uncontaminated states arise.

original: btsun pa dbyig bshes na re rgyas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la //
analyzed: btsun pa dbyig bshes na re rgyas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la //
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra says: That called ‚Äúarisen from enhancement‚Äù is that which arises from enhancement.üîΩJust as food and the absorptions and so on enhance, so too, without doubt, form arisen from karmic maturation is enhanced by the absorptions and food of a similar type.

original: ji ltar zas dang bsam gtan la sogs pas rgyas par byas pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma 'gag pa kho nar de dang rigs mthun pa bsam gtan dang zas la sogs pas rgyas pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs gzhan skye ba de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar zas dang bsam gtan la sogs pas rgyas par byas pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ma 'gag pa kho nar de dang rigs mthun pa bsam gtan dang zas la sogs pas rgyas pa dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs gzhan skye ba de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang /
translated: Just as form arisen from karmic maturation arises, so too, without doubt, virtuous and nonvirtuous minds arise from a neutral mind.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ma 'gags pa kho nar dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ni mi 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ma 'gags pa kho nar dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems ni mi 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: The Bhadanta says: Without doubt, virtuous and nonvirtuous minds do not arise from a neutral mind.

original: btsun pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa gnas brtan chos skyob po //
analyzed: btsun pa zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa gnas brtan chos skyob po //
translated: The Bhadanta is the elder DharmatrƒÅta of the SautrƒÅntika school.

original: ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Because it is sometimes greater and sometimes less.

original: 'di ltar chos gzugs can rnams ni rdzas nges pa med par 'gyur bar 'gal ba med de la lar ni ches nyung du mang por @237b 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gzugs can rnams ni rdzas nges pa med par 'gyur bar 'gal ba med de la lar ni ches nyung du mang por @237b 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it is not contradictory that physical phenomena are not definitely substantial, since sometimes many arise from a few.

original: dper na nur nur po la sogs pa dag las gzugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nur nur po la sogs pa dag las gzugs lta bu'o //
translated: For example, form and so on arise from the kalala stage and so on.

original: la lar ni ches mang ba yang nyung dur 'gyur te /
analyzed: la lar ni ches mang ba yang nyung dur 'gyur te /
translated: Sometimes many arise from a few.

original: dper na stobs dang ldan pa'i lus las stobs chung du 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na stobs dang ldan pa'i lus las stobs chung du 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a weak body arises from a powerful body.

original: de'i phyir 'di mtshungs pa de ma thag pa nyid kyi byed pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di mtshungs pa de ma thag pa nyid kyi byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not a similar immediately preceding condition.

original: sems las byung ba rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The same applies to mental factors.

original: 'di ltar 'dod par gtogs pa'i dge ba'i sems la sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod par gtogs pa'i dge ba'i sems la sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gnyis 'byung la /
translated: Thus, twenty two mental factors arise in a virtuous mind belonging to the desire realm.

original: mi dge ba 'dres pa dang lta ba dang ldan pa la nyi shu'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba 'dres pa dang lta ba dang ldan pa la nyi shu'o //
translated: Twenty arise in a mixed nonvirtuous mind possessing view.

original: bsgribs pa la ni bco brgyad do //
analyzed: bsgribs pa la ni bco brgyad do //
translated: Eighteen arise in an obscured mind.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: Twelve arise in an unobscured neutral mind.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni bsam gtan dang po'o //
translated: The concentration that possesses investigation and analysis is the first absorption.

original: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no //
analyzed: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no //
translated: The concentration that possesses analysis but not investigation is the special absorption.

original: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar te /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar te /
translated: The concentration that possesses neither investigation nor analysis is the second absorption and so on up to the summit of existence.

original: sems dang ting nge 'dzin de dag phan tshun mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis rkyen gyi ngo bor 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: sems dang ting nge 'dzin de dag phan tshun mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis rkyen gyi ngo bor 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Those minds and concentrations are asserted to be the essence of the immediately preceding condition since they are equivalent and immediately preceding conditions.

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyang ches mang ba dang nyung du byung bas gzugs bzhin du mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por 'gal lo /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyang ches mang ba dang nyung du byung bas gzugs bzhin du mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i dngos por 'gal lo /
translated: But since mental factors sometimes arise in greater or lesser number, they are incompatible with the state of being an equivalent immediately preceding condition, like form.

original: rigs gzhan la ni yod mod kyi //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs gzhan la ni yod mod kyi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They exist in other types.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa rigs gzhan du gyur pa rnams ni sems 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang mi 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa rigs gzhan du gyur pa rnams ni sems 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba dang mi 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: Investigation, analysis and so on exist in some minds but not in others.

original: 'dir ni gzugs bzhin du rang gi rigs la ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzugs bzhin du rang gi rigs la ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba med do zhes brjod do //
translated: But here, unlike form, there is no great increase or decrease in the number of its own type.

original: 'di ltar tshor ba'i rdzas gcig gi mjug thogs su tshor ba'i rdzas gnyis sam tshor ba gnyis kyi mjug thogs su gcig 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba'i rdzas gcig gi mjug thogs su tshor ba'i rdzas gnyis sam tshor ba gnyis kyi mjug thogs su gcig 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one substance of feeling does not immediately follow two substances of feeling, nor does one substance of feeling immediately follow two substances of feeling.

original: de ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rdzas nges par 'byung bas 'dir gzugs dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rdzas nges par 'byung bas 'dir gzugs dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: Thus, since minds and mental factors definitely arise as substances, the consequence that they are like form does not apply here.

original: yang ci rang gi rigs kho na'i zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen mi mnyam pa mi 'dod pas 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: yang ci rang gi rigs kho na'i zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen mi mnyam pa mi 'dod pas 'dri ba'o //
translated: Again, does it arise from its own type alone? This is asked because it is not asserted that the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is not equal.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: That is not so, it is said in response.

original: 'dir ni gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la yang gzugs ltar ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba ma yin nam zhes gang smras pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rdzas nyung du las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byungüîΩba de tsam zhig brjod kyi /üîΩrang gi rigs kho na mtshungs pa de ma @238a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la yang gzugs ltar ches mang ba dang nyung du 'byung ba ma yin nam zhes gang smras pa de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa rdzas nyung du las zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba de tsam zhig brjod kyi / rang gi rigs kho na mtshungs pa de ma @238a * //
translated: But here, in order to clarify the statement, ‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt the number of other minds and mental factors sometimes exceed and sometimes fall short of the number of forms?,‚Äù the root text declares, ‚ÄúWhen there are fewer substantial entities, such as feelings, etc.‚Äù

original: thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thag pa'i rkyen ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: The root text does not say this in order to demonstrate that only members of the same class can be equivalent immediately preceding conditions.

original: de'i phyir chogs pa mtha' dag kho na tshogs pa gzhan mtha' dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chogs pa mtha' dag kho na tshogs pa gzhan mtha' dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
translated: Therefore, the entire collection of all the members of a class is the equivalent immediately preceding condition for the entire collection of all the other members of that class.

original: rgyud 'dra ba dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /üîΩ'di dag la rgyud dang 'dra bas tha snyad 'dogs pa yod pas na de dag ni rgyud 'dra ba dag go //
analyzed: rgyud 'dra ba dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la / 'di dag la rgyud dang 'dra bas tha snyad 'dogs pa yod pas na de dag ni rgyud 'dra ba dag go //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúWhen the mind and mental factors are similar.‚ÄùüîΩThe term ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù is used here in the sense of being of the same class.

original: gal te 'dra ba kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba kho na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: If the mind and mental factors are similar, they are equivalent immediately preceding conditions.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa can du 'byung zhe na /
translated: How can a defiled mind arise immediately after a non-defiled mind?

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: When a non-defiled mind is immediately followed by a defiled mind, the defiled mind arises from a non-defiled mind of a different class.

original: 'di ltar rigs gzhan gyis par mchod pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs gzhan gyis par mchod pa mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen du mi 'dod kyi /
translated: In fact, we do not accept that a similar immediately antecedent condition is of the same class.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rang gi rigs kyis ma chod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyis ma chod pa'o //
translated: It is not obstructed by a member of its own class.üîΩFor example, when a defiled mind arises immediately after a non-defiled mind, the defiled mind arises from a non-defiled mind of a different class.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni de nyid la dpe rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni de nyid la dpe rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the extended example.

original: de skad du ni mi brjod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de skad du ni mi brjod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: We do not say that.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /üîΩsems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / rigs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir te / sems kyi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: Because it contradicts the treatise and because it contradicts reason.üîΩWhat are the mental factors that are similar and immediately antecedent conditions of the mind?

original: sems gang gi mjug thogs su de las gzhan pa'i sems sam sems las byung ba dag ces rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems gang gi mjug thogs su de las gzhan pa'i sems sam sems las byung ba dag ces rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The mind that is immediately followed by another mind or mental factors.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems mi 'byung par thal pa'i phyir na rigs pa dang yang 'gal lo //üîΩsdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i snga rol du byung ba'i chos zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems mi 'byung par thal pa'i phyir na rigs pa dang yang 'gal lo // sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i snga rol du byung ba'i chos zag pa med pa ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: and because it would follow that uncontaminated states would not occur, it would also contradict reason.

original: sngar lam ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar lam ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There are no uncontaminated states that occur prior to perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering because the path has not been generated previously.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúalso nonassociated compositional factors‚Äù is extensive.

original: thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: thob pa dang skye ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Obtainment, arising and so on.

original: khams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because those possessing the three realms and those not possessing the three realms manifest simultaneously.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la skad cig la 'dod ba na spyod pa'i chos kyi thob pa'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang zag pa med pa'i thob pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la skad cig la 'dod ba na spyod pa'i chos kyi thob pa'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang zag pa med pa'i thob pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: Those not free from attachment to the desire realm manifest the obtainment of desire realm phenomena simultaneously with the obtainment of form realm, formless realm and uncontaminated states in a single moment.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they possess the afflictions of the form and formless realms.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i 'phags pa la yang khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / zag pa med @238b pa'i chos kyi thob pa mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i 'phags pa la yang khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / zag pa med @238b pa'i chos kyi thob pa mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, the obtainment of the afflictions and uncontaminated states of the three realms manifest for ƒÅryas who have not yet freed themselves from attachment to the desire realm and who have obtained the meditative attainment of the form and formless realms.

original: de bzhin du khams gsum dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i dge ba rnams dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa rnams kyang cig car mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i dge ba rnams dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa rnams kyang cig car mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, the obtainment of the three realms, the obtainment of virtuous states that are neither of those, and the obtainment of obscured neutral states manifest simultaneously.

original: 'dis ni skye ba la sogs pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni skye ba la sogs pa rnams cig car mngon du 'gyur ba yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains that birth and so on manifest simultaneously.

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom ba thob pa dang yongs su nyams pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom ba thob pa dang yongs su nyams pa dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should also state what is relevant to the obtainment of an arhat and the degeneration of that state.

original: skyes pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag ces bshad pas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams mtshungs pa de ma thag ces bshad pas 'dri ba ni /
translated: The question is:

original: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: why is it called future?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'chol ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus 'chol ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the future time is confused,

original: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: snga phyi med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, because there is no sequence.

original: snga phyir 'byung ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pas da ltar ba snga pa dang / da ltar ba bas 'das pa snga bar brjod par nus na /
analyzed: snga phyir 'byung ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pas da ltar ba snga pa dang / da ltar ba bas 'das pa snga bar brjod par nus na /
translated: If the future were related to what occurs earlier and later, then it could be said that the future is earlier than the present, and the present is earlier than the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa la ni de ltar snga phyi yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la ni de ltar snga phyi yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the future does not exist in this way as earlier or later,

original: dus snga phyi dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus snga phyi dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not related to earlier or later times.

original: de nyid kyi phyir da ltar ba da ltar ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir da ltar ba da ltar ba'i mtshungs pa de ma thag pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: For this very reason, the present is not called the similar and immediately antecedent condition of the present,

original: dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is simultaneous.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste /üîΩgal te ma 'ongs pa'i dus la snga phyi med na'o //
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ste / gal te ma 'ongs pa'i dus la snga phyi med na'o //
translated: Well then, how can the Lord be said to have declaredüîΩif there is no sequence in the future?

original: 'das pas da ltar la 'am /
analyzed: 'das pas da ltar la 'am /
translated: The past is in relation to the present,üîΩand the present is in relation to the future.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar dag las rjes su dpog pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar dag las rjes su dpog pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar gyi las rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Inference from the past and present is inference from the past and present.

original: rnam par smin pa ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The result of karmic maturation is like this.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩchos las skyes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o // chos las skyes zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the result of karmic maturation.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: Born from the Dharma is the result of natural outflow.

original: de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de lta na bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Thus the BhagavƒÅn said.

original: gal te 'das pas da ltar ba la rjes su dpog go zhes bya bar 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'das pas da ltar ba la rjes su dpog go zhes bya bar 'dod na'o //
translated: If it is asserted that the present is inferred from the past,

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar 'di la sngon gyi mtha' la mi ltos par /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar 'di la sngon gyi mtha' la mi ltos par /
translated: How does the BhagavƒÅn, without relying on the past,üîΩdirectly perceive the future result of the karma of this one, and from that, the thought arises, ‚ÄúAfter such and such a future event, this will definitely occur‚Äù?

original: de'i rig can gyi las kyi 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa mngon sum gyis gzigs pa las ma 'ongs pa che ge mo zhig gi mjug thogs su 'di kho na 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du nges par 'khrungs par 'gyur ba de ltar sems can gyi rgyud dag las
analyzed: de'i rig can gyi las kyi 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa mngon sum gyis gzigs pa las ma 'ongs pa che ge mo zhig gi mjug thogs su 'di kho na 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du nges par 'khrungs par 'gyur ba de ltar sems can gyi rgyud dag las
translated: In the continuum of sentient beings,

original: 'das pa'i las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa rab tu mkhyen pa yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa rab tu mkhyen pa yin te /
translated: He knows the past action and its relation to the result.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do zhes zer ro //üîΩ'bras bu'i rtags su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i mtshan mar gyur pa dang / rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do zhes zer ro // 'bras bu'i rtags su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i mtshan mar gyur pa dang / rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this fault does not exist.üîΩThe expression ‚Äúsign of the result‚Äù means the sign of the result, the reason of the result, the cause of the result.

original: rtags mtshan du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtags mtshan du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the sign of the sign of the result.
