translated: If transmigrating beings arise from ƒ™≈õvara,

original: 'gro ba rim gyis 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'gro ba rim gyis 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: The world would not arise in sequence,

original: gang gang mthong de de nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gang mthong de de nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because what is seen is just that.

original: skye dgu'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lor mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skye dgu'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lor mi 'gyur ro // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The wheel of life of living beings would not exist.

original: phyi'i myu gu la sogs pa dang / nang gi nur nur po la sogs pa rnams rim gyis 'byung bar yang snang ngo //üîΩgang gi rgyu gang zhig sngar lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa de ni phyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i myu gu la sogs pa dang / nang gi nur nur po la sogs pa rnams rim gyis 'byung bar yang snang ngo // gang gi rgyu gang zhig sngar lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa de ni phyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: The external such as sprouts and the internal such as the embryo are seen to arise in sequence.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which arises without depending on a cause that is previously existent and a cooperative cause is not so later, because there is no difference.

original: des na dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin no //üîΩdngos po rnams skye ba ni yod na yod pa'i phyir dang / de med na med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na dbang phyug la sogs pa dag ni 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin no // dngos po rnams skye ba ni yod na yod pa'i phyir dang / de med na med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, ƒ™≈õvara and so on are not the cause of the world.

original: rgyu'i tshogs pa'i dbang gis yin na /
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs pa'i dbang gis yin na /
translated: If things arise, they arise due to the power of the assembly of causes, because they exist when that exists and do not exist when that does not exist.

original: dbang phyug la ni de ltar yod na yod pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug la ni de ltar yod na yod pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If that were so, ƒ™≈õvara would not exist when he exists,

original: rtag tu yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is always existent.

original: de bzhin du dngos po'i skye ba yul dang dus dang dngos po nges pas yin par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po'i skye ba yul dang dus dang dngos po nges pas yin par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, the arising of things would not be determined by place, time, and thing,

original: de dag rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i yul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i yul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because those are not causes, like other places, etc.

original: de ni 'di ni da ltar skye bar gyur cig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ni da ltar skye bar gyur cig ces bya ba la /
translated: That is, ‚ÄúMay this arise now!‚Äù

original: dbang phyug rgyu nyid yin yang 'dod pa'i dbang gis dngos po rnams kyi rim pa la sogs pa mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyu nyid yin yang 'dod pa'i dbang gis dngos po rnams kyi rim pa la sogs pa mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: Even if God is the cause, it is not contradictory that the order, etc. of things is due to the will.

original: 'o na 'dod pa tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'o na 'dod pa tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: But then it would follow that the will is different from God,

original: 'dod pa rnams ni dbang phyug dang phan tshun las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni dbang phyug dang phan tshun las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: because the wills are mutually different from God.

original: de'i phyir de dag dngos po rnams rim gyis skye ba dang / yul dang dus dang dngos po nges pa'i rgyu yin @244b pas rgyu du mar grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dngos po rnams rim gyis skye ba dang / yul dang dus dang dngos po nges pa'i rgyu yin @244b pas rgyu du mar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since those are the cause of the sequential arising of things, and the determination of place, time, and thing, it is established that there are many causes.

original: de'i phyir phyogs dang po dang 'gal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs dang po dang 'gal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that would contradict the first position.

original: 'dod pa tha dad pa de yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa tha dad pa de yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: And that difference of will is also,

original: 'dod pa rnams kyi rgyu yang dbang phyug kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyi rgyu yang dbang phyug kho na yin te /
translated: The cause of all desires is only God.

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i khyad par lhag ma 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'dod pa tha dad pa yang cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i khyad par lhag ma 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'dod pa tha dad pa yang cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, not only the remaining specific things but also the various desires would occur simultaneously.

original: ce'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ce'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'dod pa'i rgyu dbang phyug de tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu dbang phyug de tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause of desire, God, is not different.

original: 'dod pa rnams cig car 'byung na yang 'gro ba thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams cig car 'byung na yang 'gro ba thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if desires occur simultaneously, all reincarnating beings would occur simultaneously,

original: thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because God is the cause of all.

original: rgyu gzhan / tha dad pa la ltos na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan / tha dad pa la ltos na ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you say that the occurrence of desires is contingent on other causes,

original: 'dod par rnams so so so sor rgyu gzhan la ltos te dbang phyug las skyes la /
analyzed: 'dod par rnams so so so sor rgyu gzhan la ltos te dbang phyug las skyes la /
translated: then the desires would arise from God in dependence on other causes.

original: rgyu gzhan po de dag kyang dbang phyug ltar rtag pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de rnams rim gyis 'byung bar mi 'gal lo zhen /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan po de dag kyang dbang phyug ltar rtag pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de rnams rim gyis 'byung bar mi 'gal lo zhen /
translated: But those other causes are not permanent like God, and therefore it is not contradictory that they occur sequentially.

original: de lta na yang dbang phyug kho na rgyu ma yin pas slar yang phyogs dang po dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta na yang dbang phyug kho na rgyu ma yin pas slar yang phyogs dang po dang 'gal lo //
translated: But since God is not the only cause, the first position is contradicted.

original: de dag kyang rim gyis skye ba la nang dang phyi'i dngos po 'am /
analyzed: de dag kyang rim gyis skye ba la nang dang phyi'i dngos po 'am /
translated: Moreover, if they arise in sequence, then internal and external things

original: 'dod pa dang 'dra bar rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang 'dra bar rgyu gzhan gyi bye brag la ltos par 'gyur la /
translated: would depend on the specific causes of desire.

original: de lta yin na yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And if that were so, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'dir 'dod pa'i rgyu dbang phyug las gzhan pa khas blangs pas sh'akya'i sras po'i lugs khas blangs par 'gyur ro zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa'i rgyu dbang phyug las gzhan pa khas blangs pas sh'akya'i sras po'i lugs khas blangs par 'gyur ro zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Here, since you accept a cause of desire other than God, you accept the system of the son of ≈öƒÅkya.

analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gi 'dod pa rnams cig car yin du zin kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste / dbang phyug gi rgyu can nyid yin yang rim pa la sogs pa rnams mi 'gal lo snyam du bsams pa'o //

original: 'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rim gyis skye ba la rgyu smras pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rim gyis skye ba la rgyu smras pa'o ;
translated: But if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not occur.üîΩBut if the desires of God are not simultaneous, then the sequence of arising, the sequence of birth, and so on would not

original: ;'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ;'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so.üîΩ

original: 'dod pa de dag la phyir khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyu yod bzhin du lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med pa 'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa de dag la phyir khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // rgyu yod bzhin du lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu med pa 'am /
translated: But it is not so, because there is no difference in the desire.

original: 'gal ba'i rgyu yod pa las 'bras bu mi skye bar 'gyur na 'dod pa rnams la ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu cig car yod la /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rgyu yod pa las 'bras bu mi skye bar 'gyur na 'dod pa rnams la ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu cig car yod la /
translated: If there were a cause, then an effect would not arise from the non-existence of a co-operating cause or from the existence of an opposing cause. But in the case of desires, the co-operating cause exists simultaneously.

original: thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug yin zhing /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug yin zhing /
translated: And the cause of all is God.

original: thams cad la 'gal ba'i rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: thams cad la 'gal ba'i rgyu yang med do //
translated: And there is no opposing cause for any of them.

original: 'dod pa dag la bdag nyid kyi khyad par snga na med par 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la bdag nyid kyi khyad par snga na med par 'ga' zhig yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And there is no difference in the self of desires that did not exist previously.

original: de rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because that is dependent on another cause,

original: rgyu gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and there is no other cause.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba @245a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa ji lta bar skye ba @245a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not so that birth is in accordance with desire.

original: ma yin te /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But rather,

original: thams cad cig car skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad cig car skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: everything would arise simultaneously.

original: dbang phyug gi 'byin pa'i tshogs 'di snyed la dgos pa cung zad cig yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi 'byin pa'i tshogs 'di snyed la dgos pa cung zad cig yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And there is no purpose at all in the collection of causes that is emitted by the Almighty.

original: dbang phyug ni 'byin pa'i 'byin pa po ma yin te dgos pa dang bral ba'i phyir dbang phyug las gzhan pa'i byed pa po bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni 'byin pa'i 'byin pa po ma yin te dgos pa dang bral ba'i phyir dbang phyug las gzhan pa'i byed pa po bzhin no //
translated: The Almighty is not the cause of emission, because he is devoid of purpose, like any other agent.

original: nges na rtog pa 'di ni log pa yin no //
analyzed: nges na rtog pa 'di ni log pa yin no //
translated: If he is not the cause of emission, then this theory is false.

original: gal te dga' ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dga' ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that he is the cause of pleasure,

original: dga' ba nyid byed la rag mod /
analyzed: dga' ba nyid byed la rag mod /
translated: then he is the cause of pleasure,

original: yang na de la dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na de la dbang phyug ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: but he is not the Almighty,

original: de'i thabs med par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i thabs med par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not act without a means.

original: gzhan yang de kho na dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang de kho na dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it is just like that.

original: ji ltar dga' ba la dbang phyug ma yin pa de bzhin du khams gsum pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dga' ba la dbang phyug ma yin pa de bzhin du khams gsum pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: Just as he is not the Almighty with regard to pleasure, so he is not with regard to the three realms,

original: thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dbang phyug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dbang phyug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not the Almighty with regard to the unobstructed.

original: ji ltar thabs med par dga' ba bskyed par mi nus pa de bzhin du thabs kyang thabs gzhan med par mi skyed pas thams cad la 'di'i dbang phyug rdugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar thabs med par dga' ba bskyed par mi nus pa de bzhin du thabs kyang thabs gzhan med par mi skyed pas thams cad la 'di'i dbang phyug rdugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as pleasure cannot be generated without a means, so also a means cannot be generated without another means. Thus, everything would be without a master.

original: yang na thabs bzhin du dga' ba yang thabs la mi ltos pa kho nar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na thabs bzhin du dga' ba yang thabs la mi ltos pa kho nar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, just like the means, pleasure also would be produced without depending on a means.

original: gnod pa mang po dang zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gnod pa mang po dang zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Or, there would be many harms.

original: gnod pa ni char dang blu dang gnam lcags dang rims dang 'khru nad la sogs pa nye bar 'tshe ba rnams so //
analyzed: gnod pa ni char dang blu dang gnam lcags dang rims dang 'khru nad la sogs pa nye bar 'tshe ba rnams so //
translated: Harms are the calamities of rain, hail, lightning, plague, and cholera.

original: 'brel pa dag ces bya ba ni nye bar gtses pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa dag ces bya ba ni nye bar gtses pa dag ste /
translated: Those who are related are those who are afflicted.

original: skye dgu dag byung nas gal te dga' bar 'gyur na ni de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: skye dgu dag byung nas gal te dga' bar 'gyur na ni de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: If people were to be pleased after they have arisen, then they would be worshipped.

original: 'di ni bsting tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsting tshig yin no //
translated: This is a joke.

original: de las brtsams nas zhes bya ba la rgyas pas drag po brgya pa las smos so /
analyzed: de las brtsams nas zhes bya ba la rgyas pas drag po brgya pa las smos so /
translated: Beginning from that, the extensive is stated in the Shatarudriya.

original: gang phyir ma lus sreg pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang phyir ma lus sreg pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the burning of everything,

original: gang gi phyir ma lus par sreg pa de'i phyir drag po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma lus par sreg pa de'i phyir drag po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it burns completely, therefore it is called ‚Äúfierce.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa mngon sum zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa dag la sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa mngon sum zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa dag la sa bon la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The activity of a person is direct perception, such as the activity of seeds, etc., with regard to sprouts, etc.üîΩBecause the activity of something other than the causes is not seen.

original: rgyu rnams las gzhan gyi byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la 'di ltar mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams las mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa la de rnams las gzhan pa'i byed pa mi snang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu rnams las gzhan gyi byed pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la 'di ltar mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams las mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa la de rnams las gzhan pa'i byed pa mi snang ngo //
translated: Thus, the visual consciousness arises from the eye, form, light, and mental activity, and the activity of something other than those is not seen.

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa yod na res 'ga' mig gi rnam par shes pa skye la /
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa yod na res 'ga' mig gi rnam par shes pa skye la /
translated: Just as the visual consciousness sometimes arises when the eye, etc., exist,

original: res 'ga' mi skye ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: res 'ga' mi skye ba de bzhin du /
translated: and sometimes does not arise,

original: gal te dbang phyug yod na yang yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug yod na yang yin na ni /
translated: if ƒ™≈õvara exists,

original: de lta na gzhan gyi byed pa rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig go //
analyzed: de lta na gzhan gyi byed pa rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig go //
translated: then the activity of something other than those would be recognized.

original: dbang phyug de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang po @245b rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dbang phyug de lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang po @245b rnams la yang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd the first of the cooperating causes‚Äù is the expansion.

original: de dag ni rang gi mthus 'bras bu skyed par byed pas 'di dag la de dbang phyug nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi mthus 'bras bu skyed par byed pas 'di dag la de dbang phyug nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they generate the effect by their own power, they are not God.

original: de la dang po byung ba dbang phyug gi rgyus las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dang po byung ba dbang phyug gi rgyus las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: In that regard, the first arising is from the cause of God.

original: de ltar na skyes bu'i byed pa mngon sum la snyon pa ma byas pa dang rgyu las gzhan gyi byed pa mi snang bar yang 'gyur bas dbang phyug 'jig rten rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na skyes bu'i byed pa mngon sum la snyon pa ma byas pa dang rgyu las gzhan gyi byed pa mi snang bar yang 'gyur bas dbang phyug 'jig rten rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, since the activity of a person is not denied in perception, and the activity of something other than the cause does not appear, there is no contradiction in God being the cause of the world.

original: dang po byung ba de yang dbang phyug bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang po byung ba de yang dbang phyug bzhin du thog ma med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, that first arising would absurdly follow as being without beginning, like God,

original: dbang phyug ni dang po byung ba bskyed par bya ba la rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang rtag ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni dang po byung ba bskyed par bya ba la rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang rtag ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because God, in generating the first arising, does not rely on another cause and is permanent.

original: de ltar na dang po byung ba med pa'i phyir dbang po byung ba yang rgyu de las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dang po byung ba med pa'i phyir dbang po byung ba yang rgyu de las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since the sense faculty does not exist prior to its arising, it does not arise from that cause.

original: de bzhin du gtso bo la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtso bo la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, the creator should be stated in the same way, as appropriate.

original: gtso bo ni sems pa med pa yin pas 'dod pa'i rtog pa ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ni sems pa med pa yin pas 'dod pa'i rtog pa ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since the creator is insentient, all other statements except for the statement of desire should be made.

original: blo ma sbyangs pa ni don dam pa'i bstan bcos dag gis blo ma sbyangs pa dag go //
analyzed: blo ma sbyangs pa ni don dam pa'i bstan bcos dag gis blo ma sbyangs pa dag go //
translated: Those whose minds are untrained are those whose minds are untrained by means of the treatises on the ultimate.

original: thams cad phya las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad phya las ni ma yin te /
translated: Not all of them are from fate.

original: skyes bu'i rtsal kho na las yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir rang rang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtsal kho na las yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir rang rang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to teach that they are only from the power of the person, it says in detail, ‚Äúfrom each of their own ripened results.‚Äù

original: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
translated: The other arises from both.

original: zhes bya ba der chos gzugs can rnams rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen gnyis las skye'o zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba der chos gzugs can rnams rgyu dang bdag po'i rkyen gnyis las skye'o zhes bshad pa /
translated: In that verse, it is explained that physical phenomena arise from both causes and dominant conditions.

original: de la gzugs ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i rgyu'i rkyen ji ltar yin pa dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen ji ltar yin pa 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba rnams dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i rgyu'i rkyen ji ltar yin pa dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen ji ltar yin pa 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since form is derived from the elements and is also an element, how are the elements the causal condition of the elements and of that derived from the elements? How is that derived from the elements the causal condition of that derived from the elements and of the elements?

original: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad do zhes bdag po'i rkyen ni shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa'i chos thams cad do zhes bdag po'i rkyen ni shes pa yin gyi /
translated: The dominant condition is understood as all phenomena except for the phenomenon itself.

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni rnam pa mang po'i phyir mi shes pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni rnam pa mang po'i phyir mi shes pa de'i phyir na /
translated: Since the causal condition is manifold, it is not understood.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams zhes rgyas par dris so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams zhes rgyas par dris so //
translated: Therefore, in terms of that, it is asked, ‚ÄúHow are the elements the causal condition of the elements?‚Äù and so on.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag gis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag gis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The answer is ‚Äúby the homogeneous cause and co-originated cause.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba sngar skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba sngar skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The previously arisen elements are the homogeneous cause.

original: rang gi ngo bo tha dad kyang bya ba gcig la zhugs pa'i phan tshun mthun pa nyid skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tha dad kyang bya ba gcig la zhugs pa'i phan tshun mthun pa nyid skal ba mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Homogeneity is the mutual conformity of those that are different in substance but are engaged in the same activity.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lhan cig skyes pa rnams phan tshun te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lhan cig skyes pa rnams phan tshun te /
translated: Coexistent causes are those that are mutually coexistent.

original: thams cad phan tshun med par mi skye ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid @246a * //
analyzed: thams cad phan tshun med par mi skye ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid @246a * //
translated: All are coexistent causes because none can arise without the other.

original: yin no // 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yin no // 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are coexistent causes because they assist each other in arising.

original: 'byung ba rnam par 'gyur na 'byung ba las gyur pas 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed do //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnam par 'gyur na 'byung ba las gyur pas 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed do //
translated: When the primary elements transform, those derived from the primary elements transform in accordance with them.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa des mnyam du skyes pa dag las gang yang rung ba zhig ji ltar rjes su mthun par byed ce na /üîΩmyu gu dad grib ma bzhin nam /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa des mnyam du skyes pa dag las gang yang rung ba zhig ji ltar rjes su mthun par byed ce na / myu gu dad grib ma bzhin nam /
translated: How do the primary elements and those derived from the primary elements assist each other in arising?üîΩLike a sprout and its shadow,

original: mar me dang snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mar me dang snang ba bzhin no //
translated: or like a lamp and its light.

original: de ltar na de dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Thus, these are coexistent causes.

original: 'byung ba dag las skye ba'i phyir skye ba'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag las skye ba'i phyir skye ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: It is the cause of origination because it is the cause of origination from the elements.

original: de'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: It is the cause of transformation because it conforms to the transformation.

original: rten du 'gyur ba'i phyir rten pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: rten du 'gyur ba'i phyir rten pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: It is the cause of support because it is the support.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyu nyid do /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyu nyid do /
translated: It is the cause of duration because it is the cause of the continuity.

original: 'phel par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: 'phel par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: It is the cause of increase because it is the cause of growth.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: skye dang rjes mthun rten dang ni //
analyzed: skye dang rjes mthun rten dang ni //
translated: Because it is the cause of origination, support,

original: rgyun mi 'chad dang 'phel ba las //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad dang 'phel ba las //
translated: continuity, and increase,üîΩit is called the cause of origination, the cause of support, the cause of duration,

original: skyed phyir rten phyir gnas phyir dang // rten pa'i phyir dang 'phel byed phyir //üîΩzhes bya'o // rnam pa lnga po de yang byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin te /
analyzed: skyed phyir rten phyir gnas phyir dang // rten pa'i phyir dang 'phel byed phyir // zhes bya'o // rnam pa lnga po de yang byed rgyu'i rgyu kho na yin te /
translated: the cause of support, and the cause of increase.

original: rgyu gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This fivefold cause is only the active cause, because other causes are not tenable.

original: 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: The elements are not co-originating causes of the derivative form,

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result is different.

original: gzhan yang 'byung ba las gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byung ba las gyur pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the great elements are not the homogeneous cause of the derivative material form.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: Derivative material form is wholesome, unwholesome, nondefined;

original: 'byung ba rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: the great elements are only nondefined.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid can ma yin no //
translated: The simultaneous cause does not have this characteristic.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas nas yin par yang 'dod do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'das pa'i 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas nas yin par yang 'dod do //
translated: One also accepts that the derivative material form of the present and future is based on the great elements of the past.

original: de bzhin du kha cig 'byung ba rnams dad mi ldan yang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig 'byung ba rnams dad mi ldan yang 'byung ba las gyur pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, some believe that the great elements are not associated with the derivative material form, but are the cause of the derivative material form.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos nyid ni de ltar ma yin pas 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos nyid ni de ltar ma yin pas 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: But the nature of simultaneous factors is not like that. Thus the great elements are not the simultaneous cause of the derivative material form.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not the associated cause,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not of the nature of thought and thought concomitants.

original: kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not pervasive or karmic maturation causes.üîΩ

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskal ba mnyam pa'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro // skal ba mnyam pa'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not pervasive or karmic maturation causes because they are unobscured neutral states.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir la dus phyis skyes pa dang yang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir la dus phyis skyes pa dang yang mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not homogeneous causes because they arise simultaneously and do not resemble each other.

original: 'byung 'gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du //
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du //
translated: The three future are each other's

original: zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par ro //üîΩlus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i @246b sngom pas bsdus pa srog gcod pa nas tshig kyal pa spong ba'i bar 'chal ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa bdun spong ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par ro // lus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i @246b sngom pas bsdus pa srog gcod pa nas tshig kyal pa spong ba'i bar 'chal ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa bdun spong ba ste /
translated: mutually homogeneous causes.üîΩThe three future karmic paths of action are each other's homogeneous causes.üîΩThe three karmic paths of action of body and speech that are concomitant with the mind are mutually homogeneous causes.

original: spong ba bdun po 'di dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: spong ba bdun po 'di dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The seven abandonments of unethical conduct, from abandoning taking life to abandoning idle speech, which are subsumed by the bonds of absorption and uncontaminated vows, are mutually homogeneous causes.

original: sngar byung ba thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngar byung ba thams cad skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: All past states are homogeneous causes of future states.

original: dge ba dge ba'i yin pa nas lung du ma bstan pa'i par gyi yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dge ba'i yin pa nas lung du ma bstan pa'i par gyi yin no //
translated: Virtue is the domain of virtue, up to and including indeterminate states.

original: lus dang ngag gi las gang gi rnam par smin pa mig la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las gang gi rnam par smin pa mig la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the karmic maturation of bodily and verbal karma that is the eye, etc.?

original: lus dang ngag gi las ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
translated: Bodily and verbal karma is virtuous or nonvirtuous form that is derived.

original: des rnam par smin pa 'byung ba chen po dag 'phen pa yin no //
analyzed: des rnam par smin pa 'byung ba chen po dag 'phen pa yin no //
translated: It projects the great elements that are its karmic maturation.

original: rgyas par byas na nyi shu yin par mdor bsdus na sems bcu gnyis so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyas par byas na nyi shu yin par mdor bsdus na sems bcu gnyis so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If one expands on this, there are twenty, but if one summarizes, there are twelve minds.

original: dge ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //üîΩbsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o // bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: Virtue is concomitant with nonattachment and so on.üîΩObscured neutral states are concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and extreme view.

original: mi dge ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye bar nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o//
analyzed: mi dge ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye bar nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o//
translated: Nonvirtue is concomitant with the remaining afflictions and branch afflictions.

original: de dag las gzhan pa ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Other minds are unobscured-neutral.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na mi dge ba med de /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na mi dge ba med de /
translated: Neither virtue nor nonvirtue exist in the form and formless realms.

original: ji skad du 'dod pa dag las dben zhing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan //üîΩzhes 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du 'dod pa dag las dben zhing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan // zhes 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The s≈´tras say, ‚ÄúFreed from attachment to desire realm objects, freed from negative tendencies of the desire realm,‚Äù and so on, and ‚ÄúAll higher realms are unobscured-neutral.‚Äù

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir bsgribs pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir bsgribs pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: They are obscured because they are the karmic maturation of afflictions and branch afflictions.

original: mi dge ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not nonvirtuous because

original: de'i phyir de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems thams cad bsgribs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems thams cad bsgribs pa kho na yin no //
translated: all minds concomitant with them are obscured.

original: slob pa'i zag pa med pa ni slob pa'i sems so //
analyzed: slob pa'i zag pa med pa ni slob pa'i sems so //
translated: The uncontaminated mind of a learner is the mind of a learner.

original: mi slob pa ni mi slob pa'i sems so //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni mi slob pa'i sems so //
translated: The uncontaminated mind of a nonlearner is the mind of a nonlearner.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang zhes bya ba 'byung ba la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang zhes bya ba 'byung ba la /
translated: The mind of meditative equipoise is virtuous.

original: dge ba gang gi mjug thogs su dge ba gang dang sa gang gis bsdus pa 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba gang gi mjug thogs su dge ba gang dang sa gang gis bsdus pa 'byung zhe na /
translated: What virtue arises immediately after what virtue?

original: 'dod pan spyod pa'i dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su sbyor ba las byung ba kho na yin gyi /üîΩskyes nas thob pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pan spyod pa'i dge ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i mjug thogs su sbyor ba las byung ba kho na yin gyi / skyes nas thob pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Immediately after virtue of the desire realm arisen from the branches of the first absorption, virtue arisen from the branches of the first absorption alone arises.

original: 'dir skyes pas mngon du byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir skyes pas mngon du byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not virtue obtained from birth because one who is born here cannot manifest it.

original: kha cig na re ni mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa kho na 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re ni mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa kho na 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It arises only subsumed by unrestricted access concentration.

original: gzhan dag na re ni bsam gtan dang po'i yang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni bsam gtan dang po'i yang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It also arises subsumed by the first absorption.

original: gzhan dag na re ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi yang ngo zhes zer ro //üîΩbtsun pa dbyangs @247a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi yang ngo zhes zer ro // btsun pa dbyangs @247a * //
translated: Others say: It also arises subsumed by the special first absorption.

original: sgrogs na re ni bsam gtan gnyis ba'i sa ba'i bar du yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgrogs na re ni bsam gtan gnyis ba'i sa ba'i bar du yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhadanta Gho·π£aka says: It also arises subsumed by the second absorption and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re ni mnyam par ma bzhag pas thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa ltar sas bar du chod pa 'dren par mi nus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni mnyam par ma bzhag pas thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa ltar sas bar du chod pa 'dren par mi nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It cannot induce the meditative attainment of alternating meditative attainment since it is not equipoise.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Obscured mind at the time of linking.

original: skye ba'i srid pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir na skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su bsgribs pa yin gyi /üîΩgzugs dang gzugs med ba na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lud du ma bstan pa dag mngon du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir na skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su bsgribs pa yin gyi / gzugs dang gzugs med ba na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lud du ma bstan pa dag mngon du 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Because birth existence is afflicted by all afflictions, it is subsequent to virtuous minds obtained from birth.

original: rang gi sa ba'i sems la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa ba'i sems la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unobscured-neutral minds of the form and formless realms do not manifest because it is dependent on minds of its level.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The formless realm is subsequent to the desire realm.

original: de la rten ring ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rten ring ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the distance of the basis.

original: ji ltar gzugs su gtogs pa'i rten gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems mngon du byed pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs su gtogs pa'i rten gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa'i sems mngon du byed pa ltar /
translated: Just as a basis belonging to the form realm does not manifest a mind of desire realm emanation,

original: gzugs med par gtogs pa'i rten gyis 'dod par gtogs pa'i chos mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med par gtogs pa'i rten gyis 'dod par gtogs pa'i chos mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: a basis belonging to the formless realm does not manifest a mind belonging to the desire realm.

original: de la rnam par ring ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam par ring ba nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The distance is as follows:

original: ji ltar gzugs na spyod pas rag las pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu rnam par byed pa ltar gzugs med pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa'i khams rnam par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs na spyod pas rag las pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu rnam par byed pa ltar gzugs med pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa'i khams rnam par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Just as a mind of the form realm does not manifest the desire realm in the aspects of dependence and so on, a formless mind does not manifest the desire realm.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa ring ba nyid kyis kyang ring ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa ring ba nyid kyis kyang ring ba yin no //
translated: Therefore it is distant due to distant focal objects.

original: gzugs kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs med pa dag 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs med pa dag 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po yang ma yin te /
translated: The formless realm is not an antidote to the desire realm, just as it is not an antidote to the form realm.

original: de ltar na gnyen po'i ring ba nyid kyis kyang ring ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyen po'i ring ba nyid kyis kyang ring ba yin no //
translated: Therefore it is distant due to being distant antidotes.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i mjug thogs su'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe learner and the nonlearner‚Äù refers to the immediately preceding state of a virtuous mind that is acquired through preparatory effort.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir bas ni skyabs tshol ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir bas ni skyabs tshol ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone who is oppressed by an afflicted meditative state‚Äù refers to one who is seeking a refuge.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is dependent upon a virtuous mind that is active in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sems thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sems thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall minds that are active in the realm of form and the formless realm‚Äù refers to the following.

original: sa gong ma'i sems rnam pa drug gis 'chi 'pho ba la 'dod pa'i khams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba bzlog tu med do //
analyzed: sa gong ma'i sems rnam pa drug gis 'chi 'pho ba la 'dod pa'i khams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba bzlog tu med do //
translated: When one dies and casts off the six types of minds that are active in the higher realms, it is impossible to be reborn in the realm of desire.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa mngon du 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su nyon mongs pa mngon du 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is also impossible for an afflicted mind to manifest immediately after a pure mind.

original: de las bzhi ste /üîΩsa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i mjug thogs su sa gong ma pa'i sems mngon du byed pa med la /
analyzed: de las bzhi ste / sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i mjug thogs su sa gong ma pa'i sems mngon du byed pa med la /
translated: Four types of minds can manifest immediately after a pure mind.üîΩA mind of its own level can manifest immediately after a pure mind.üîΩA virtuous mind of a lower level can manifest immediately after a pure mind.üîΩA mind of entry into the formless realm can manifest immediately after a pure mind.

original: zag pa med pa yang mngon du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang mngon du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: A mind of entry into meditative absorption can manifest immediately after a pure mind.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba las zhes bya ba la /
translated: A virtuous mind that is active in the realm of form can manifest immediately after a pure mind.

original: sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan gyi 'bras @247b bu ste ;
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan gyi 'bras @247b bu ste ;
translated: The emanation mind is the result of absorption.

original: / de ni bsam gtan lam zhugs par mngon du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de ni bsam gtan lam zhugs par mngon du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible to manifest the emanation mind when entering the path of absorption.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba'i tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu nyid mtshams sbyor ba bzlog tu med la /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba'i tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu nyid mtshams sbyor ba bzlog tu med la /
translated: When dying with an unobscured neutral mind, it is impossible to stop taking rebirth in the form and formless realms.

original: gdon mi za bar bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu'i mjug thogs su yang bsam gtan la 'jug par bya dgos pas ma bsgribs la lud du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang gnyis dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can kho na'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu'i mjug thogs su yang bsam gtan la 'jug par bya dgos pas ma bsgribs la lud du ma bstan pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang gnyis dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, after the result of absorption, it is definitely necessary to enter absorption. Thus two minds arise from an unobscured neutral mind: a virtuous mind and an afflicted mind that occur in the form realm and an afflicted mind that occurs in the formless realm.

original: gzugs na dge las bcu gcig go //
analyzed: gzugs na dge las bcu gcig go //
translated: Eleven from virtue in the form realm.

original: zhes bya ba la rang gis pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rang gis pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bzhi ste /
translated: Three of its level, four of the desire realm,

original: ldang ba'i tshe dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe mi dge ba dang bsgribs pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa sprul ba'i sems dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs pa dang /
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe mi dge ba dang bsgribs pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa sprul ba'i sems dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe bsgribs pa dang /
translated: When linking at death, it arises from a virtuous mind of the formless realm and from an obscured mind of the formless realm.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //üîΩgzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan ba ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa'o // gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan ba ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: When entering meditative attainment, it arises from a learner mind and from an unlearner mind.üîΩExcept for a formless realm unobscured neutral mind.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sems ni rang gis pa'i sems la rag las pa'i phyir de ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sems ni rang gis pa'i sems la rag las pa'i phyir de ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for a formless realm mind derived from preparation, because it is not derived from the roots of virtue.

original: de ni dgu'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni dgu'i mjug thogs su zhes bya ba la /
translated: It arises from nine.

original: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa gnyis te snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang / sbrul pa'i sems dang sdang ba'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba sa 'og ma pa la brten pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can dang /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa gsum dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa gnyis te snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshe dge ba dang / sbrul pa'i sems dang sdang ba'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba sa 'og ma pa la brten pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can dang /
translated: Three of its own level, two of the desire realm level, because when entering meditative attainment, it is virtuous and when emanating, it is the virtuous mind of the formless realm level and when afflicted, it is afflicted because it is supported by lower levels when oppressed by afflicted meditative attainment.

original: ldang ba'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa las so //
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe slob pa dang mi slob pa las so //
translated: When rising from meditative attainment, it arises from learner and nonlearner minds.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Two afflicted minds of the desire realm level arise from it.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi sbyor ba ma yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi sbyor ba ma yin la /
translated: An afflicted mind is not preparation for the absorptions and meditative attainments.

original: dge ba'i sems kyis nyid mtshams sbyor ba la yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems kyis nyid mtshams sbyor ba la yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it link with a virtuous mind.

original: de ltar na gsum po 'di dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar na gsum po 'di dag ma gtogs so //
translated: Thus three minds arise from it.

original: bsgribs pa brgyad las zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: bsgribs pa brgyad las zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Eight obscured minds arise from it.

original: rang gi sa pa'i gsum dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa gsum las so //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i gsum dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshe dge ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe gzugs med pa na spyod pa gsum las so //
translated: three of its own level, and at the time of linking, the virtuous mind and unobscured neutral mind of the desire realm, and the three of the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'dod pa'i khams las @248a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang zhes bya ba la / 'dod pa'i khams las @248a * //
translated: Two afflicted minds of the desire realm arise from it.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la gzugs kyi khams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba med la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la gzugs kyi khams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba med la /
translated: One who is not free from attachment to the desire realm does not link with the form realm.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sems kyis 'chi 'pho ba yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bzhi po 'di dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sems kyis 'chi 'pho ba yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bzhi po 'di dag ma gtogs so //
translated: And it is not the case that death occurs through the mind of training or the mind of no more learning. Therefore, these four are excluded.

original: de las drug rang gi sa pa gsum dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba'i tshe dge ba'o //
analyzed: de las drug rang gi sa pa gsum dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe sa 'og ma pa'i nyon mongs pa can gnyis dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi snyoms par 'jug pas gzir ba'i tshe dge ba'o //
translated: Six arise from that: three of its own level, and at the time of linking, the two afflicted minds of lower levels and the virtuous mind when oppressed by afflicted meditative attainment.

original: gang gi phyir sbyor ba'i sems ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyor ba'i sems ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the unobscured neutral mind that is the mind of preparation does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa'i dge ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i mjug thogs su slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / gzugs med pa'i dge ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the learner and nonlearner minds and virtuous formless realm minds do not arise from it.

original: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la ni sa gong mar skye ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'og ma las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la ni sa gong mar skye ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, those not free from attachment to lower levels do not generate the upper level.
